[A LONG gallery opening on each side to [small rooms]95-small rooms]94-a long gallery opening on each side to small rooms gave [the inhabitants of [St. Cécile ’s Monastery]1-st. cécile ’s monastery]96-the inhabitants of st. cécile ’s monastery access both to [them]96-the inhabitants of st. cécile ’s monastery and to [the larger apartment which was inhabited by [the Reverend Mother]98-the reverend mother [herself]98-the reverend mother]97-the larger apartment which was inhabited by the reverend mother herself . [This latter room]99-this latter room was of an oblong shape , very bare of furniture , and of all kinds of decoration . The windows were without curtains ; there was but one table , and on [it]100-it stood a crucifix . Two benches by the wall were all the accommodation for sitting down . [The one figure which occupied [the chamber]102-the chamber]101-the one figure which occupied the chamber required not even so much , for [she]101-the one figure which occupied the chamber was kneeling in the middle of the floor , with support of no kind , and quite upright , except [her]101-the one figure which occupied the chamber head , which was bowed under the thick cloth or veil hanging over it , and which concealed even [her]101-the one figure which occupied the chamber hands . “ [She]101-the one figure which occupied the chamber is praying , ”[103-a nun] said [a nun]103-a nun , looking into [the room]104-the room , “ [you]109-the superior had better wait ; ”[103-a nun] and these words [she]103-a nun addressed to [a young girl who accompanied [her]103-a nun , in the ordinary tone of conversation , such as befitted the occupations of [the place]106-the place]105-a young girl who accompanied her , in the ordinary tone of conversation , such as befitted the occupations of the place . [The young girl]107-the young girl advanced into [the room]104-the room , and [herself]107-the young girl went down on [her]107-the young girl knees at a little distance from [the Superior]109-the superior , running over [her]107-the young girl beads while [she]107-the young girl waited till [she]107-the young girl might speak . [She]107-the young girl was very simply dressed in white , with parted hair , like [a child]110-a child , but abundant and beautiful , falling low on low shoulders and delicately rounded waist . [Her]107-the young girl face was fair , with very little colour , and the eyes , which [she]107-the young girl raised often , while [she]107-the young girl slid [her]107-the young girl beads through [her]107-the young girl fingers , had a simplicity of religious expression , such as fades even in those happy enough once to possess it , when the habits of [a pious child‐ hood come to be contradicted by those of the general world]111-a pious child‐ hood come to be contradicted by those of the general world . When [the Superior]109-the superior rose from [her]109-the superior knees , so did [Elinor]21-elinor , and advanced towards [the elder lady]113-the elder lady , who kissed [her]21-elinor on the forehead , and gave a blessing . The conversation was in French , though [the girl]114-the girl was English , for it was in [a Convent of [Brittany]2-brittany]115-a convent of brittany that the scene took place . It did not begin in the tone supposed to be exclusively that of [Lady Abbesses]116-lady abbesses . “ Has [Louisa]22-louisa finished the marking of all [your]114-the girl shifts , [[my]109-the superior dear]1127-my dear ? Are [they]1128-they ready ? ”[109-the superior] “ Yes , [dear Mother]1129-dear mother , and packed up , ”[21-elinor] said [Elinor]21-elinor . “ And have [you]114-the girl heard whether [Madame Néotte]23-madame néotte is come . ”[21-elinor] “ Yes , that is what [I]109-the superior came here to tell [you]114-the girl , as [you]114-the girl desired . ”[109-the superior] “ Then to‐morrow [you]114-the girl leave [us]1130-us , ”[109-the superior] said [the Superior]109-the superior , in a melancholy voice . “ It is [you]109-the superior who have determined it , ”[21-elinor] said [Elinor]21-elinor . “ Ah , [[my]21-elinor child]1131-my child ! [[your]114-the girl guardian]1132-your guardian believes it best ; it is [his]1132-your guardian doing . ”[21-elinor] “ And [I]114-the girl shall come back , ”[114-the girl] said [the girl]114-the girl . “ No , [dear]1133-dear , [you]1133-dear will never do that . [I]114-the girl know [your]1133-dear feelings better than [you]1133-dear do . It will be a hard parting with [us]1130-us all , but when [you]1133-dear are away [you]1133-dear will be glad . [You]1133-dear will enjoy [the world]1134-the world , [you]1133-dear will choose it , and [you]1133-dear will be welcome in [it]1134-the world . No ; [you]1133-dear will never wish to come back [here]1135-here . [I]114-the girl have known [many gentle girls like [you]1133-dear , who could not find what [they]1136-many gentle girls like you , who could not find what they wanted here wanted [here]1135-here]1136-many gentle girls like you , who could not find what they wanted here . [They]1136-many gentle girls like you , who could not find what they wanted here require to be carried along — not to walk alone , as in [a convent]1138-a convent . ”[114-the girl] “ Am [I]21-elinor one of those , ”[21-elinor] said [Elinor]21-elinor , catching hold of [the Abbess]119-the abbess ’s hand and passionately kissing it ; “ [I]21-elinor who have been so happy ? ”[21-elinor] “ And have made [us]1139-us all happy — but [you]1133-dear must go . Sit down a little while , let [us]1139-us talk for the last time . [The world]1134-the world is full of snares , [[my]114-the girl dear]1127-my dear . ”[114-the girl] “ What are [they]1142-they ? ”[21-elinor] said [Elinor]21-elinor . “ What will [they]1142-they tempt [me]21-elinor to do ? ”[21-elinor] “ Vanity , the pride of life , the lusts of the devil , ”[109-the superior] answered [the Superior]109-the superior . “ [You]1133-dear must be prepared for all . [Some]1143-some will pretend that [you]1133-dear have beauty ; [some]1143-some will praise [your]1133-dear voice , as if [you]1133-dear were [a musician]1145-a musician ; [some]1143-some will talk to [you]1133-dear of [the world]1134-the world — and all , all for [their]1143-some own bad ends . ”[109-the superior] “ What are those ends ? ”[21-elinor] asked [Elinor]21-elinor , again . [The Abbess]119-the abbess , was a little puzzled . “ [Man]1148-man , ”[119-the abbess] said [she]119-the abbess , solemnly , “ is [a creature going about to devour]1149-a creature going about to devour . Listen not to [him]1148-man , go not near [him]1148-man , keep [him]1148-man far from [you]1133-dear . [He]1148-man will hurt [you]1133-dear , [he]1148-man will destroy [you]1133-dear ; [you]1133-dear have already learned this ; now is [your]1133-dear time to practise . Keep [your]1133-dear eyes from [his]1148-man face , keep [your]1133-dear speech from [his]1148-man commerce . One day it may come to pass that [[your]1133-dear guardian]1132-your guardian may select [one who is to be [[your]1133-dear husband]1152-your husband]1151-one who is to be your husband . Then submit [yourself]1133-dear to the will of [[your]1133-dear superiors]1153-your superiors , and adopt the state of life which shall be allotted [you]1133-dear ; but till such a fate is brought to [your]1133-dear door , remember that [a maiden]1154-a maiden must keep [her]1154-a maiden finger on [her]1154-a maiden lips and [her]1154-a maiden heart full of thoughts holy and virtuous , avoiding the very shadow of sin . ”[119-the abbess] [Elinor]21-elinor was set thinking what these sins could be ; but [she]21-elinor resolved , at all events , to do right , and to keep the precepts of [[her]21-elinor early friend]122-her early friend in [her]21-elinor memory . [She]21-elinor continued talking with [the Reverend Mother]98-the reverend mother as long as [convent]124-convent duties permitted ; then , for the last time , partook the Evening Service and assisted to make the vesper beautiful by [her]21-elinor exquisite voice , against [the world]1134-the world ’s estimation of which [the Superior]109-the superior thought [she]21-elinor had successfully warned [her]21-elinor . [She]21-elinor rose that night for Vigils ; and next morning was up at [Matins]3-matins — the last time of doing these duties making them seem to [her]21-elinor as if [she]21-elinor would fain never cease to do them ; and when the hour for [her]21-elinor journey arrived , the wrench of the first roots [she]21-elinor had ever struck in hearts and places , overwhelmed [her]21-elinor with a girlish sorrow , which , fortunately , was not put to such proof as an offer to remove it would have been ; for there is no saying how [her]21-elinor wish to remain in [the Convent]127-the convent would have been modified , if the chaise into which [she]21-elinor so sobbingly stepped had been ordered back into [its]128-its old remise . ON [the English side of the Channel]129-the english side of the channel , which [[our]130-our heroine]131-our heroine was about to cross , a different scene was passing in the early life of [one of the opposite sex]132-one of the opposite sex . [A young man]133-a young man , four years older than [Elinor]21-elinor ( who was just seventeen ) , had passed that summer a triumphant Examination at [Oxford]4-oxford , and heaped on [himself]133-a young man every honour which it was possible for [its young members]134-its young members to obtain . [He]133-a young man had been accustomed to success ever since [he]133-a young man became [a school‐boy]135-a school‐boy ; and [he]133-a young man was so far from satiated by it , that [he]133-a young man already looked upon all [his]133-a young man achievements as mere marks of past progress , and on [himself]133-a young man as now about to begin the career which contained objects really worthy of [his]133-a young man ambition . [He]133-a young man was [an orphan]136-an orphan , never acquainted with [father]137-father or [mother]138-mother ; wholly unconscious of tender influences on [his]133-a young man boyhood , and of domestic sympathy with [his]133-a young man successes and desires . [He]133-a young man had come not to want them ; disappointment [he]133-a young man had not had , and the hard measure of public applause suited [him]133-a young man better than the fond exaggerations of [home]139-home , to which [he]133-a young man had not grown up , nor been bettered by [them]140-them . Life was a fine , hard reality to [him]133-a young man ; [he]133-a young man knew it , for evil and good , and while [he]133-a young man destroyed every illusion as fast as [they]140-them courted [him]133-a young man , [he]133-a young man looked keenly to its enjoyments and rated [them]140-them by the vast power of pleasure within [him]133-a young man which [he]133-a young man shared with [most healthy and active human beings]141-most healthy and active human beings . [He]133-a young man was passing some weeks at [a country house]142-a country house , where [his]133-a young man late very hard work gave zest to the summer repose in which [the old place]143-the old place lay buried . Long , solitary , morning walks in the heavenly beauty of a hot July did [his]133-a young man thinking faculties good , after [their]140-them late stretch upon [other men]144-other men ’s thoughts . The society of [well educated women]145-well educated women , [their]145-well educated women music , [their]145-well educated women vivacity , [their]145-well educated women fancies ; the riding parties , the evenings when there was dancing , or [the garden]146-the garden by moonlight , and the pleasure of pretending to feelings , and , as it were , acting them , for they were no better to [him]133-a young man than a play , these things suited [him]133-a young man for a little while , till the moment should come for executing the projects in [his]133-a young man head which would drive all the present scene far away . [He]133-a young man had everything to recommend [him]133-a young man to [the world]1134-the world . [A fine person , full of health and strength]148-a fine person , full of health and strength , a fortune and a place which were competent to ordinary wishes , and had been augmented by all the savings of [a well managed minority]149-a well managed minority ; a high reputation for ability ; and natural claims on certain great names for assistance in entering on [his]133-a young man career . [His]133-a young man manner was more taking than winning , [he]133-a young man took hold on society as if it were [his]133-a young man due place , and [his]133-a young man admirable tact made [him]133-a young man hold it gracefully , and to the delight of [[his]133-a young man companions]150-his companions . These qualities and advantages had made a strong impression on the fancy of [the young lady who presided over [the house]152-the house]151-the young lady who presided over the house . [She]151-the young lady who presided over the house was [[the owner]153-the owner ’s sister]154-the owner ’s sister , a few years older than [[my]0-i hero]155-my hero ( whom [I]0-i will call [Leslie]24-leslie , though [I]0-i do not assert that such was indeed [his]24-leslie name ) ; [she]151-the young lady who presided over the house was handsome , rich , and hitherto courted by all whom [she]151-the young lady who presided over the house had a mind should do so . But it was not so with [[her]151-the young lady who presided over the house present guest]156-her present guest ; [he]156-her present guest often seemed on the brink of fascination , and then , like [Sampson]25-sampson , burst the withies like burnt flax and was as free as ever . The irritation of this state of things was excessive ; [she]151-the young lady who presided over the house longed to break through the feminine restraints which bound [her]151-the young lady who presided over the house , and ask [him]156-her present guest if indeed [he]156-her present guest cared for [her]151-the young lady who presided over the house or not . The absolute impossibility of thus setting [herself]151-the young lady who presided over the house free was a galling chain , for ever working on [the wounded place]157-the wounded place ; and the necessity of a smiling face , and disengaged manner , at times when [she]151-the young lady who presided over the house was fretting at [her]151-the young lady who presided over the house heart ’s core , acquainted [her]151-the young lady who presided over the house with a torment which [the daughters of Eve]158-the daughters of eve sometimes heavily endure . “ Let [us]1155-us ride this afternoon , ”[151-the young lady who presided over the house] [she]151-the young lady who presided over the house said , one hot but cloudy day ; “ the air of [the house]152-the house burns one . ”[151-the young lady who presided over the house] “ With all [my]24-leslie heart , ”[24-leslie] said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “ but [we]1155-us shall have a storm . ”[24-leslie] “ [I]26-laura am not afraid , ”[26-laura] said [Laura]26-laura . “ Would [I]26-laura were quite sure that , in fact , [you]26-laura have no fears ! ”[26-laura] “ Oh ! [I]151-the young lady who presided over the house would tell [them]1157-them . [I]151-the young lady who presided over the house am very frank , [I]151-the young lady who presided over the house hate concealment . It is very hard on [women]1158-women that [they]1158-women are required to be [liars and deceivers]1159-liars and deceivers . ”[151-the young lady who presided over the house] “ But that ’s not the case , ”[24-leslie] said [Leslie]24-leslie , “ what is so delightful to [a man]1160-a man as a frank , open nature which prints its thoughts as fast as they come into the mind . ”[24-leslie] “ So [you]24-leslie say , but [you]24-leslie know it is not so — at least , not unless [a woman]1161-a woman has no thought whatever , except the price of a dress or the hope of a ball . ”[151-the young lady who presided over the house] “ Oh , that would not pay the expense of printing or reading either , ”[24-leslie] said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “ but what has this to do with [your]24-leslie first plan of riding ? Shall [we]159-they go ? ”[24-leslie] “ Yes ; [Mrs. Axross]27-mrs. axross , [you]24-leslie will ride ? and [Captain Bertham]28-captain bertham — ring ; the horses are ready in case [we]159-they should want [them]1162-them . Come and put on [your]24-leslie habit . ”[27-mrs. axross] When [they]159-they got on horseback , [Leslie]24-leslie perversely kept with [Mrs. Axross]27-mrs. axross , [a timid horsewoman]160-a timid horsewoman , and in consequence of being occupied with genuine fear , [a rather dull companion]161-a rather dull companion . [They]159-they fell behind [the others]162-the others , whose horses stepped out freely under lightly held bits , nor did [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson know how to alter the order of [their]159-they progress . When [she]29-miss chanson contrived , under pretence of pointing out a view , or a remarkable tree , to get back to [the loiterers]163-the loiterers , [she]29-miss chanson still found that [Leslie]24-leslie adhered to [[his]24-leslie first companion]164-his first companion , and suffered [her]29-miss chanson again to get before [him]24-leslie . “ How [I]29-miss chanson hate a horse that ca n’t walk , ”[29-miss chanson] [she]29-miss chanson said , at last , impatiently striking [her]29-miss chanson own , which bounded at the unjust assault and tossed [his]24-leslie head angrily . “ Well , then let [us]159-they gallop , ”[24-leslie] said [Leslie]24-leslie , laughing , for [he]24-leslie read [her]29-miss chanson heart exactly . “ [[My]24-leslie companion]1163-my companion , ”[24-leslie] [he]24-leslie added , as [they]159-they went off , “ thinks only of keeping [her]1163-my companion seat . When [she]1163-my companion gets [home]139-home safe , [she]1163-my companion will have fulfilled the sole purpose of riding out . ”[24-leslie] “ Well , [I]26-laura ’m better than that , ”[26-laura] said [Laura]26-laura , [her]26-laura spirits rising instantly , “ [I]26-laura can enjoy all when there is anything to enjoy — but [Captain Bertham]28-captain bertham is so stupid . ”[26-laura] [Leslie]24-leslie laughed again , for [he]24-leslie knew that [Captain Bertham]28-captain bertham did not deserve a reproach of which [he]24-leslie felt [himself]24-leslie to be the indirect cause . “ How can [anyone]1165-anyone be dull with [you]26-laura for [a companion]1166-a companion , ”[24-leslie] said [he]24-leslie , again , as [they]159-they increased [their]159-they pace and went gaily along . [Laura]26-laura was pleased , [she]26-laura did not consider that [she]26-laura had provoked the compliment , and that it is only voluntary attentions from [a man that tell]165-a man that tell . “ Here come the great raindrops , ”[24-leslie] said [Leslie]24-leslie , as the first of the storm fell one by one . “ Oh , no ! it is only the last of a shower . See , it is blowing over . ”[24-leslie] “ [I]26-laura do n’t see it at all , but if [you]26-laura order [me]26-laura to see it , [I]26-laura will . ”[26-laura] “ [I]26-laura do , then , ”[26-laura] said [Laura]26-laura , gaily ; “ so let [us]159-they go on . ”[26-laura] “ Was that lightning or not ? ”[24-leslie] said [Leslie]24-leslie , as a flash startled [their]159-they horses , and thunder rolled at a distance . “ It was not , ”[26-laura] said [Laura]26-laura ; “ come on . ”[26-laura] “ On , on , to the end of [the world]1134-the world under [your]26-laura guidance . ”[26-laura] But now the rain at once arrived and poured upon [them]159-they . “ What will [Mrs. Axross]27-mrs. axross do , ”[26-laura] said [Laura]26-laura , laughing ; “ [she]27-mrs. axross will walk [her]27-mrs. axross horse all the way [home]139-home , for fear [he]166-he should jump at the storm . [We]159-they must turn back and look for [them]159-they . ”[26-laura] [Leslie]24-leslie rather wondered [she]26-laura should do so , instead of profiting by [her]26-laura present tête‐à‐tête with [him]166-he ; but presently [he]166-he understood [the manœuvre]167-the manœuvre . When [they]159-they came to [a cross road]168-a cross road , [she]26-laura examined the footmarks on [the road]169-the road , and declared it was most extraordinary , but certainly [[their]159-they companions]170-their companions had gone the wrong way . “ [They]159-they will get lost in [the wood]1169-the wood , ”[26-laura] [she]26-laura said ; “ and what will [Mr. Axross]30-mr. axross say , if [we]159-they go [home]139-home without [[his]30-mr. axross wife]1171-his wife ? Let [us]159-they canter up here and set [them]159-they right . [We]159-they shall overtake [them]159-they in a minute . ”[26-laura] “ [You]1172-you will be wet through , ”[24-leslie] said [Leslie]24-leslie . “ No , no , canter [home]139-home ! ”[24-leslie] “ [I]26-laura do n’t care ; go [home]139-home if [you]1172-you like . ”[26-laura] “ No , [I]24-leslie am [yours]1172-you , to the very skin ”[24-leslie] said [Leslie]24-leslie , venturing on a brutality . [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson did not look angry , and on [they]171-they went , away from [home]139-home . Presently [a little farmhouse]173-a little farmhouse appeared in sight . “ [They]159-they have taken [shelter]1175-shelter [there]1176-there , ”[174-the lady] said [the lady]174-the lady , “ no doubt . Come , let [us]171-they see if [they]159-they are to be found ; ”[174-the lady] and arriving at the door , [she]174-the lady jumped from [her]174-the lady horse , saying to [the farmer , who came out at the sound of horses]175-the farmer , who came out at the sound of horses , “ [[My]174-the lady friends]1177-my friends are [here]1135-here , are not [they]159-they ? Come , [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie . ”[174-the lady] [He]175-the farmer , who came out at the sound of horses followed , after first putting the horses into [the stable]176-the stable , and giving [them]177-them over to the care of [[the farmer]178-the farmer ’s boy]179-the farmer ’s boy , and found , [[his]175-the farmer , who came out at the sound of horses companion]180-his companion standing before the kitchen fire , [her]180-his companion hat off , [her]180-his companion hair let down to dry , and [her]180-his companion habit open . “ The weather is too bad to stay in , is not it ? ”[174-the lady] [she]174-the lady said , as [he]175-the farmer , who came out at the sound of horses came in . “ Let [us]1179-us wait till the storm goes by ; ”[174-the lady] and [she]174-the lady pulled [her]174-the lady dress together . “ A lucky storm for [me]24-leslie , ”[24-leslie] said [Leslie]24-leslie , glancing at [her]174-the lady disarranged toilette . “ Why are these lovely tresses locked up in ribbon and garlands — not always thus delightfully visible ? ”[24-leslie] [Laura]26-laura affected embarrassment , and hastily twisted them in [her]26-laura hands , but yielded to slight impulse from [Leslie]24-leslie to release them . Finally [she]26-laura placed [herself]26-laura in a very picturesque attitude on what is called the settle , by the fire , and [Leslie]24-leslie carried on briskly the conversation [she]174-the lady affected . “ All this time , ”[175-the farmer , who came out at the sound of horses] said [he]175-the farmer , who came out at the sound of horses , at last , when the flirtation became a little wearisome , “ what is become of [Mrs. Axross]27-mrs. axross ? ”[175-the farmer , who came out at the sound of horses] “ [I]26-laura had almost forgotten [her]27-mrs. axross , ”[26-laura] said [Laura]26-laura , softly , with a smothered sigh . “ [I]24-leslie had quite done so , ”[24-leslie] said [Leslie]24-leslie , sighing also . “ Only [you]175-the farmer , who came out at the sound of horses recollected [her]27-mrs. axross , ”[26-laura] said [Laura]26-laura , a little reproachfully . “ Nay , the storm is over . It is getting late . [I]26-laura would not have [you]175-the farmer , who came out at the sound of horses catch cold for [the world]1134-the world — [I]26-laura would not be responsible for the anxiety [your]175-the farmer , who came out at the sound of horses absence will create — [I]26-laura would not have [you]175-the farmer , who came out at the sound of horses exposed to further rain — [I]26-laura would ...... ”[26-laura] “ Get [home]139-home in time for dinner , ”[26-laura] interrupted [Laura]26-laura , very impatiently . Then checking [herself]26-laura , [she]26-laura added , as gaily as [she]26-laura could , “ which would be an excellent thing , for [I]26-laura am very hungry . ”[26-laura] “ Then heaven forbid [you]26-laura should wait ! ”[24-leslie] said [Leslie]24-leslie . “ [I]24-leslie ’ll fetch the horses in a moment . ”[24-leslie] Accordingly [he]24-leslie went [himself]24-leslie to [the stable]176-the stable , and forgot to lament the loss of the beautiful curls , which were twisted under the hat when [he]24-leslie came back ; and placing [Laura]26-laura on [her]26-laura horse , [they]182-they rode [home]139-home together , [the lady]174-the lady feeling in [herself]174-the lady that hollowness in [her]174-the lady satisfaction which comes when the foundation of a very gay and promising structure wants perfect solidity . “ How very handsome [he]24-leslie is , ”[26-laura] [she]26-laura said to [herself]26-laura , as [she]26-laura ran up [the house‐steps]185-the house‐steps ; “ how agreeable — and [I]26-laura do n’t feel sure [he]24-leslie will make [himself]24-leslie agreeable next time — that makes one curious to be with [him]24-leslie again . ”[26-laura] [The butler]186-the butler stopped [her]26-laura in [the hall]187-the hall , and said , “ [Miss Elinor Ladylift]21-elinor was arrived . ”[186-the butler] “ Ha ! [[our]1182-our little nun]1183-our little nun , ”[26-laura] said [she]26-laura , turning back to [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie ; “ [we]1182-our did not expect [her]189-a young figure , perfectly enveloped in a gray cloak till to‐morrow . Come and see [her]189-a young figure , perfectly enveloped in a gray cloak . ”[26-laura] [He]24-leslie followed [her]26-laura into [the room]104-the room , and saw standing by the table [a young figure , perfectly enveloped in a gray cloak]189-a young figure , perfectly enveloped in a gray cloak , while a veil concealed [her]189-a young figure , perfectly enveloped in a gray cloak features from any one at a little distance . The only characteristic which [he]24-leslie could observe was , that the flowers on the table trembled , as if the hand which rested on it gave [them]190-them that motion . “ Oh ! [[my]26-laura dear]1127-my dear , [I]26-laura did not know [you]1127-my dear would be here to‐day . [I]26-laura beg [your]1127-my dear pardon for not being here to receive [you]1127-my dear . [You]1127-my dear forgive [me]26-laura , do n’t [you]1127-my dear ? ”[26-laura] “ Yes ! ”[26-laura] said a low , timid voice . [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson laughed . “ That ’s all right ! Then come along with [me]29-miss chanson , for [I]29-miss chanson am wet through : [you]1127-my dear would not have [me]29-miss chanson die of cold , would [you]1127-my dear ? ”[29-miss chanson] “ No ! ”[26-laura] said the voice . “ Right , again ! [I]26-laura ’ll show [you]1127-my dear [[your]1127-my dear room]1185-your room — but first [I]26-laura ’ll present [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie to [you]1127-my dear . This is [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie , [[my]26-laura dear]1127-my dear . ”[26-laura] “ Is it ? ”[26-laura] said the voice again . “ Yes , indeed ! ”[26-laura] and again [Laura]26-laura laughed , looking up at [the young man]191-the young man sportively , and taking [the girl]114-the girl ’s arm went out of [the room]104-the room with [her]26-laura . “ There ’s no fear that [she]114-the girl will captivate [any one whom [I]26-laura choose for [myself]26-laura]1187-any one whom i choose for myself , especially [such a man as that]1188-such a man as that , so brilliant [himself]191-the young man , and so fond of intellect and manner , ”[26-laura] thought [she]26-laura . That perfect security at first sight generally ends in a total contradiction . [I]0-i have remarked it as often as the case of security has taken place . “ [She]114-the girl is tired and frightened , and wo n’t come to dinner , ”[29-miss chanson] said [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson , as [she]29-miss chanson entered [the drawing‐room]194-the drawing‐room after dressing . “ No wonder ! the inside of [a convent]1138-a convent is all [she]114-the girl knows of life . ”[29-miss chanson] “ What does [she]114-the girl look like ? ”[195-her brother] asked [[her]26-laura brother]195-her brother , [a man five‐and‐twenty years older than [the bright Laura]197-the bright laura]196-a man five‐and‐twenty years older than the bright laura , and [an indifferent , idle bachelor]198-an indifferent , idle bachelor , who disregarded [his]196-a man five‐and‐twenty years older than the bright laura appearance , and looked yet ten years older than [he]196-a man five‐and‐twenty years older than the bright laura was , in consequence . “ [She]114-the girl is [a pale , slight girl]1190-a pale , slight girl , ”[26-laura] said [Laura]26-laura , “ and expects to be devoured by all of [us]1191-us . [She]114-the girl has the least possible French accent , and moves about like a mouse . ”[26-laura] THE next day , [Elinor]21-elinor appeared at breakfast , coming into [the room]104-the room close at the side of [[her]21-elinor hostess]200-her hostess , to whom [she]21-elinor clung , and sat down in the next chair , which vexed [Laura]26-laura , for it was [[Mr. Leslie]24-leslie ’s habitual place]201-mr. leslie ’s habitual place . [He]196-a man five‐and‐twenty years older than the bright laura took [the one below [Elinor]21-elinor]202-the one below elinor , and endeavoured to engage [her]21-elinor in conversation , but was received like [an enemy]203-an enemy , and did not seek to avoid [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson ’s looks of intelligence , who remarked silently on the repulses [he]196-a man five‐and‐twenty years older than the bright laura suffered . The impression on [him]196-a man five‐and‐twenty years older than the bright laura , however , was not exactly what [he]196-a man five‐and‐twenty years older than the bright laura allowed [Laura]26-laura to believe . [He]196-a man five‐and‐twenty years older than the bright laura remarked the delicate shape of the pale face , the ease of the slight figure , the fine form of the hands , which , if not very white as yet , were formed in the noblest feminine model . [Her]21-elinor gray gown was perfectly simple , and it was quite uninteresting to [him]196-a man five‐and‐twenty years older than the bright laura whether it was cut fashionably or unfashionably . The eyes , which were kept cast down on [her]21-elinor plate so pertinaciously , excited [his]196-a man five‐and‐twenty years older than the bright laura curiosity ; [he]196-a man five‐and‐twenty years older than the bright laura wanted to find some phrase which should raise them , that [he]196-a man five‐and‐twenty years older than the bright laura might see them . Interest was awakened , but do and say what [he]196-a man five‐and‐twenty years older than the bright laura would , [he]196-a man five‐and‐twenty years older than the bright laura never succeeded , during all that breakfast , in making [her]21-elinor look at [him]196-a man five‐and‐twenty years older than the bright laura . [She]21-elinor disappeared when it was over , and [he]196-a man five‐and‐twenty years older than the bright laura saw [her]21-elinor not again till after dinner , when , on coming into [the drawing‐room]194-the drawing‐room , [he]196-a man five‐and‐twenty years older than the bright laura found [her]21-elinor seated close to [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson , diligently at work . [The latter]205-the latter was becoming a little tired of such close companionship ; [she]21-elinor could not rise from [her]21-elinor chair , but what [Elinor]21-elinor did the same , thereby preventing many manœuvres hitherto easy to practise . “ [[My]21-elinor dear child]1192-my dear child , if [you]1192-my dear child like [that place]1193-that place , keep it , ”[21-elinor] said [she]21-elinor ; “ the lamp suits [your]1192-my dear child work , and [I]21-elinor must go to talk to [that stupid old lady , whom it is [my]21-elinor duty to amuse]1194-that stupid old lady , whom it is my duty to amuse . ”[21-elinor] “ Shall [I]21-elinor go , ”[21-elinor] said [Elinor]21-elinor . “ [They]1195-they always used to send [me]21-elinor to talk to [Madame Les Forces]31-madame les forces . ”[21-elinor] “ Did [you]26-laura succeed ? ”[26-laura] said [Laura]26-laura , laughing sarcastically . “ Yes , sometimes . ”[26-laura] “ But [you]26-laura do n’t know [this lady]1196-this lady — shall [you]26-laura have the courage ? ”[21-elinor] “ Why not ? ”[21-elinor] “ Nay , [you]26-laura will not speak one syllable to [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie . ”[26-laura] “ No ! ”[21-elinor] “ And why ? ”[26-laura] said [Laura]26-laura . “ [I]26-laura talk to [him]24-leslie — [we]1197-we all talk . ”[26-laura] “ [The Reverend Mother]98-the reverend mother said [I]26-laura must not . ”[26-laura] “ Did [she]98-the reverend mother say [you]26-laura might speak to none but [women]1158-women ? ”[24-leslie] said [Leslie]24-leslie , very gently . “ Yes ! ”[24-leslie] “ Oh ! that ’s excellent ! ”[26-laura] cried [Laura]26-laura . “ [[My]26-laura dear nun]1200-my dear nun , [you]1200-my dear nun must get rid of some of those maxims ; [you]1200-my dear nun are in [a very different place from [[your]1200-my dear nun nunnery]1202-your nunnery]1201-a very different place from your nunnery . Do n’t make [yourself]1200-my dear nun ridiculous . ”[26-laura] [The young girl]107-the young girl coloured excessively ; [she]107-the young girl was too young to bear being ridiculous , too , fond of [[her]107-the young girl habitual teachers]207-her habitual teachers to fancy [they]207-her habitual teachers could be misinformed . [She]107-the young girl was perplexed , and rising , shrank away to [the stupid lady]208-the stupid lady , whose work [she]107-the young girl began admiring ; and as long as [no one else]209-no one else heard [her]107-the young girl voice , contrived to keep up a dialogue . “ What [a quaint little creature]1203-a quaint little creature ! ”[29-miss chanson] said [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson , “ But now [I]29-miss chanson ’ll do [my]29-miss chanson part to amuse [the other stupid people]1204-the other stupid people , by giving [you]107-the young girl all some music . ”[29-miss chanson] “ Do , ”[24-leslie] said [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie ; “ though [you]107-the young girl know [I]24-leslie am so lost in dulness as to talk most when music is best . ”[24-leslie] “ [I]107-the young girl know that ; but at all events [I]107-the young girl entertain [you]107-the young girl even in that case . ”[107-the young girl] [She]107-the young girl said this rather sentimentally ; and [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie opened the piano‐forte , and talked a little nonsense while [she]107-the young girl arranged [her]107-the young girl books . When fairly embarked , and when [other people]210-other people collected round [her]107-the young girl , and [they]210-other people were all interested with [her]107-the young girl performance and [their]210-other people own , [he]24-leslie drew gradually to the side of [Elinor]21-elinor , and watched [his]24-leslie chance of speaking to [her]21-elinor . [She]21-elinor listened to the music , which was very good , with great interest ; but [she]21-elinor drew away from [him]24-leslie , and [he]24-leslie could do no better than some dialogue with [the stupid old lady]211-the stupid old lady . At last , when there was a pause in the performance , [he]24-leslie took up [his]24-leslie courage , and said boldly to [Elinor]21-elinor , “ [You]21-elinor perceive , [Miss Ladylift]21-elinor , that [they]210-other people are all tired , and can play and sing no more . [You]21-elinor ought to assist [them]210-other people — [you]21-elinor ought to help in amusing [us]1205-us all . ”[24-leslie] [She]21-elinor rose in a moment , as if bound to obey whoever commanded [her]21-elinor , and walked towards the piano‐forte . “ [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie told [me]21-elinor [I]21-elinor ought to sing , ”[21-elinor] [she]21-elinor said . “ Ought [I]21-elinor ? ”[21-elinor] “ To be sure , if [you]24-leslie can . But what — not psalm tunes ? ”[21-elinor] “ Very well , [I]21-elinor will not . [I]21-elinor know a great many airs which [Frère du Lap]32-frère du lap taught [all the pensionnaires]1206-all the pensionnaires . ”[21-elinor] “ [I]26-laura should like to hear [Frère du Lap]32-frère du lap ’s scholar very much , ”[26-laura] said [Laura]26-laura . “ Should [you]21-elinor ? ”[21-elinor] said [Elinor]21-elinor , looking up at [her]21-elinor , unconscious of the sarcasm ; and [she]21-elinor placed [herself]21-elinor before the piano‐forte . Now nature had made [her]21-elinor a present of a voice , such as [she]21-elinor gives very rarely : “ It were the bul‐bul , but [his]33-handel throat , Tho ’ sweet , [ne’er]1207-ne’er uttered such a note . ”[21-elinor] It was no merit of [Elinor]21-elinor ’s ; there seemed no object in bestowing it upon [her]21-elinor ; but [she]21-elinor was lucky in being the one to get it , for its effect was to dispose [the hearers]212-the hearers to love [her]21-elinor . It was as pure as the song of the angels heard by [Handel]33-handel , and set down by [him]33-handel as sung to [the Shepherds]213-the shepherds ; it had been well taught , also , so that it was a delight to the ear , a charm to the heart . [Leslie]24-leslie , who was moving away , stopped as [she]21-elinor began to sing , and turned to fasten [his]24-leslie eyes upon [her]21-elinor , as upon a new sense of delight , a pleasure revealed for the first time . [She]21-elinor rose up when it was done ; indeed , [she]21-elinor had not actually sat down , but had bent one knee towards the level of the piano‐forte , and played an accompaniment varying with the words . [She]21-elinor was plainly [a perfect mistress of [her]21-elinor art]214-a perfect mistress of her art ; and , according to the fashion of drawing‐rooms , [her]21-elinor performance was greeted with clapping of hands , and a few bravas . [She]21-elinor looked round , astonished ; and if [any one]215-any one had desired another song , would have obeyed ; but [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson came up with the last notes , and after a brief thank [you]216-you , led [her]21-elinor away , saying [her]21-elinor voice seemed a little tired . [She]21-elinor then organized other amusements , and the music was over for the evening . [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie contrived to elude [them]217-them all , and very quietly coming up beside [Elinor]21-elinor , [he]24-leslie said to [her]21-elinor , “ That song is one [I]24-leslie shall never forget . [I]24-leslie shall hear many more , [I]24-leslie hope , but the first time one listens to a perfect thing it is remembered for ever . ”[24-leslie] [Elinor]21-elinor shook [her]21-elinor head . “ [[My]24-leslie Mother]1208-my mother told [me]24-leslie [you]24-leslie would say so . ”[24-leslie] “ That [I]24-leslie should say so ? How could [the Holy Mother]1209-the holy mother know anything of [me]24-leslie ? ”[24-leslie] “ Not of [you]24-leslie , but of all . ”[24-leslie] “ [She]1208-my mother could , only say that all of [us]1210-us should be aware [you]24-leslie have one of the finest voices in [the world]1134-the world . ”[24-leslie] “ Yes , [she]1208-my mother did say so — that [you]24-leslie would try to persuade [me]24-leslie of it . ”[24-leslie] “ [I]218-he do n’t wish it to be thought of [me]218-he that [I]218-he would persuade [any one]215-any one to believe an untrue thing . Let [us]1210-us consider for a moment , ”[218-he] and [he]218-he sat down beside [her]219-her at the table , leaning upon it , and trying to look in [her]219-her face , which was bent over [her]219-her work . “ [You]24-leslie have heard the music of this evening ? ”[218-he] “ Yes ! ”[24-leslie] “ It was very good , was it not ? ”[24-leslie] “ Very good , very strong ; [I]218-he never heard such before . ”[218-he] “ But was there any voice as expressive as [yours]24-leslie ? ”[24-leslie] “ No ! ”[24-leslie] “ Or that was so unlike a flute , or an organ , or a harp , but was so purely human ; the perfection of [human]1213-human . ”[218-he] “ [I]24-leslie can not hear [my]24-leslie own voice . ”[24-leslie] “ Surely , [Miss Ladylift]21-elinor , [you]21-elinor can . ”[219-her] [Elinor]21-elinor knew [she]219-her could , and [he]218-he put the question plainly . [She]219-her suddenly lifted up [her]219-her large eyes upon [him]218-he , and looked full into [his]218-he for a moment — there was an anxiety to penetrate [his]218-he meaning , but it yielded in another instant to the dread of encountering [a stranger]220-a stranger ’s gaze ; however , [he]218-he had seen those large eyes . “ [You]21-elinor can if [you]21-elinor will , ”[218-he] said [he]218-he ; “ [every‐ body]1214-every‐ body can judge [themselves]1214-every‐ body as well as [they]1214-every‐ body can judge [other people]210-other people , if [they]1214-every‐ body will be honest to [themselves]1214-every‐ body . And it is not being honest , to think worse of [oneself]1216-oneself than is the truth . ”[218-he] “ [[My]218-he dear [Mother]34-the reverend mother]1217-my dear mother told [me]218-he [my]218-he voice was such a voice as [hundreds of others]1218-hundreds of others have . ”[218-he] “ But what do [you]218-he think [yourself]218-he ? ”[218-he] “ [I]21-elinor believe [her]34-the reverend mother , ”[21-elinor] said [Elinor]21-elinor . “ Yes , surely , ”[24-leslie] answered [Leslie]24-leslie , afraid of alarming [[his]24-leslie companion]180-his companion . “ [She]34-the reverend mother spoke [her]34-the reverend mother entire conviction , no doubt ; still [she]34-the reverend mother judged from [[her]34-the reverend mother Convent]1219-her convent alone . There , perhaps , where all is holy , all dedicated to divine things , [the inhabitants]1220-the inhabitants may be blessed , many of them , with gifts like the one [you]21-elinor have in [your]21-elinor voice ; but it is not so in [the world]1134-the world . [You]21-elinor are in [the world]1134-the world now ; [you]21-elinor must judge by what [you]21-elinor see and hear ; [you]21-elinor may find there are things unlike those which [the Reverend Mother]34-the reverend mother knows . ”[24-leslie] “ Oh ! [she]34-the reverend mother can not be mistaken , ”[21-elinor] said [Elinor]21-elinor . “ Only ask [yourself]21-elinor whether [she]34-the reverend mother is , ”[24-leslie] said [Leslie]24-leslie . “ If so , some things which were good guides in [the convent]127-the convent , may lead wrong here . ”[24-leslie] [Elinor]21-elinor answered nothing . The first doubt of the kind was painful , the more so because [her]21-elinor honest nature saw that perhaps it was true . After a pause , [she]21-elinor said , “ Who can [I]21-elinor trust , then ? ”[21-elinor] “ [I]24-leslie know [this outer world]1224-this outer world , ”[24-leslie] said [Leslie]24-leslie . “ But [I]21-elinor do not know [you]24-leslie , ”[21-elinor] said [Elinor]21-elinor ; “ [I]21-elinor know [nobody]1225-nobody . [I]21-elinor will do [my]21-elinor best ; [you]24-leslie must not try to prevent [me]21-elinor . If [you]24-leslie liked [my]21-elinor singing , [I]21-elinor am glad of that ; but perhaps [you]24-leslie do not understand music , and then [you]24-leslie can not judge . ”[21-elinor] “ No , perhaps [I]24-leslie do not , ”[24-leslie] said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “ [you]24-leslie know [I]24-leslie can only say what [I]24-leslie honestly feel . ”[24-leslie] “ Yes , to be sure ! [I]21-elinor know [you]24-leslie do that . [Everybody]1226-everybody does that , ”[21-elinor] said [Elinor]21-elinor , speaking as [she]21-elinor had been unconsciously taught , and as [she]21-elinor felt , that though there were [wicked people in [the world]1134-the world]222-wicked people in the world , [nobody with whom one associates]224-nobody with whom one associates could be in the number of those wicked . [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie abhorred [Laura]26-laura for coming up and interrupting the conversation . [She]26-laura said [she]26-laura was sorry to see [Elinor]21-elinor look so pale ; no doubt [she]26-laura was used to very early hours in [the Convent]127-the convent , and [she]26-laura had better go to bed . [She]26-laura did not say [she]26-laura thought [[her]26-laura young friend]226-her young friend tired ; for knowing [her]26-laura not to be tired , [she]26-laura felt that [Elinor]21-elinor would say No . “ [You]24-leslie have persuaded [the nun]1227-the nun to talk , [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie , ”[26-laura] said [she]26-laura ; “ how clever [you]24-leslie are . ”[26-laura] “ It gives [one]1228-one an interest in succeeding , when the task is so difficult , ”[24-leslie] said [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie . “ No doubt ; [a woman who has the audacity to know or feel anything , and to say it]1229-a woman who has the audacity to know or feel anything , and to say it , must expect the contempt of the nobler sex . ”[24-leslie] “ Why so ? , ”[24-leslie] said [Leslie]24-leslie , coolly . “ [Men]1230-men are so short‐sighted , so easily taken in . If [women]1158-women affect simplicity and reserve , [men]1230-men see no further than just what [those women]1233-those women give [themselves]1233-those women the trouble to put on . ”[24-leslie] “ Is [that little girl]1234-that little girl [a dissembler]1235-a dissembler ? ”[24-leslie] “ Oh ! [I]24-leslie suppose [you]24-leslie can judge . ”[24-leslie] “ [I]24-leslie should judge not ; but [you]24-leslie know best . ”[24-leslie] “ If [I]26-laura knew anything , [I]26-laura would not say it against [[my]26-laura friend]1236-my friend , ”[26-laura] said [Laura]26-laura . “ [My]26-laura nature is more constant than that . ”[26-laura] “ More generous than that , ”[24-leslie] said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “ constant is not the word , for [your]24-leslie acquaintance is so short . It is indeed very generous . ”[24-leslie] [Laura]26-laura liked the words , and did not understand further , and though [she]26-laura was not satisfied , [she]26-laura went away fancying [she]26-laura was . Next morning , [every one else being occupied in [[their]227-every one else being occupied in their rooms rooms]228-their rooms]227-every one else being occupied in their rooms with what letter‐writing or other business [they]227-every one else being occupied in their rooms might have , [Laura]26-laura , who could not lose any chance of being with [Leslie]24-leslie , and [Leslie]24-leslie , who could lose none of being with [Elinor]21-elinor , and [Elinor]21-elinor , who fixed [herself]21-elinor upon [Laura]26-laura as [her]21-elinor best safety in the new scenes , were all three in [the library]229-the library , standing about , looking at a print or a flower , and not knowing very well what to do . [Elinor]21-elinor only was at ease , knitting gloves , move where [she]21-elinor would . “ Suppose , ”[24-leslie] said [Leslie]24-leslie , “ [we]230-we show [the wood‐walk]1237-the wood‐walk to [Miss Ladylift]21-elinor . Would it not be a good employment of this delightful morning ? ”[24-leslie] [Laura]26-laura assented ; that [WE]230-we sounded so pleasantly to [her]26-laura . Accordingly , [each lady]231-each lady took up a parasol in [the hall]187-the hall , and [they]231-each lady all stepped into the perfumed air , and proceeded down some broad steps , which led from [the garden]146-the garden to [the steep wooded banks below [the house]152-the house]234-the steep wooded banks below the house . [Elinor]21-elinor was delighted : [the space]236-the space , the depth below , [the vast summer hall made by the wood]237-the vast summer hall made by the wood , and the pavement of ferns , flowers , and briar , over which the shadows of the leaves scattered their moving patterns ; the silence which seemed to come from far , and go afar , charmed [her]21-elinor opening imagination . As [they]231-each lady proceeded , a vague feeling of fear mingled with [her]21-elinor pleasure . [She]21-elinor had never known the sense of distance before . “ Shall [we]231-each lady know how to go back , ”[21-elinor] said [she]21-elinor ; “ but no doubt [you]26-laura will . ”[21-elinor] “ No fear of that , ”[26-laura] said [Laura]26-laura , looking behind at the walk [they]231-each lady had come along ; “ the way is not difficult . ”[26-laura] “ And may [you]26-laura go here as far as [you]26-laura like ? ”[21-elinor] said [Elinor]21-elinor , thinking of [her]21-elinor Convent restrictions . “ Who can doubt that ? ”[26-laura] said [Laura]26-laura , scornfully ; “ or that [you]21-elinor may do so likewise ? In [a Convent]1138-a convent [they]1239-they are [children]1240-children all [their]1239-they lives ; but [you]21-elinor must take off [your]21-elinor leading‐strings . ”[26-laura] [Elinor]21-elinor , till now , had never ceased to lean on some one for every action of [her]21-elinor life . Yet [she]21-elinor got a lesson then which went straight [home]139-home , not to betray [her]21-elinor want of help to [those who could scoff [her]21-elinor for it]239-those who could scoff her for it . [Leslie]24-leslie thought that the sooner [she]21-elinor learned to doubt [[her]21-elinor former teachers]240-her former teachers the better . [He]24-leslie had an idea [he]24-leslie could give [her]21-elinor lessons [himself]24-leslie . [They]241-they went on , therefore , on and on till [Elinor]21-elinor , who had never known what it was to take a walk , was tired . [She]21-elinor longed intensely for rest ; [her]21-elinor limbs ached ; they required absolutely the new stringing of repose . [Leslie]24-leslie observed it , and proposed to sit down , but [Laura]26-laura poured forth [her]26-laura playful scorn upon [a girl who pretended not to be up to a mile‐and‐a‐half walk]242-a girl who pretended not to be up to a mile‐and‐a‐half walk . As for [herself]21-elinor , [she]21-elinor must confess to strength — half‐a‐dozen miles were nothing to [her]21-elinor . [Elinor]21-elinor felt ashamed ; but was unconscious that [Laura]26-laura meant to insinuate that the fatigue was affected . “ [I]26-laura wish [I]26-laura could do like [you]26-laura , ”[26-laura] [she]26-laura said ; “ but [I]26-laura have not learned to walk . ”[26-laura] “ [Dear baby]1241-dear baby , ”[26-laura] said [Laura]26-laura ; “ still at nurse ? [I]26-laura wish [I]26-laura could carry [you]1241-dear baby ! ”[26-laura] [Elinor]21-elinor looked at [each companion]243-each companion , with the mournful simplicity of [a child who has committed a fault it does not comprehend]244-a child who has committed a fault it does not comprehend . [Leslie]24-leslie was enchanted . “ It is a science [you]21-elinor must practise , ”[24-leslie] said [he]24-leslie . “ It was a fault not to have attended to [your]21-elinor education in that respect . ”[24-leslie] [Elinor]21-elinor was quite ready to acknowledge [herself]21-elinor wrong , and to feel inwardly that [her]21-elinor bringing up was not so faultless as [she]21-elinor had thought . At this moment , however , [her]21-elinor wishes were all limited to rest , and gladly did [she]21-elinor sink upon the seat at which [Leslie]24-leslie prevailed on [Laura]26-laura to stop ; but [Laura]26-laura was so restless , that [Leslie]24-leslie at last started up with a new project in [his]24-leslie head , and proposed that [they]245-they two alone should make for the point at which [Laura]26-laura had intended to reach , and should leave [[their]245-they companion]246-their companion to enjoy a little repose before [they]245-they returned for [her]26-laura to go [home]139-home . “ Unless [you]21-elinor are afraid , ”[26-laura] said [Laura]26-laura , turning round on [Elinor]21-elinor . “ No , [I]21-elinor am not afraid , for [you]26-laura say there is no danger , ”[21-elinor] said [Elinor]21-elinor . And now [Leslie]24-leslie hurried [[his]24-leslie companion]180-his companion away , and pushing [himself]24-leslie into the highest spirits , rallied [her]26-laura on [her]26-laura activity , [her]26-laura delightful health and strength , till [Laura]26-laura , quite deceived , quickened [her]26-laura pace to the very utmost , and went over hill and [dale]35-dale at [his]24-leslie side , with no idea but that of keeping up the contrast between [herself]26-laura and the timid [Elinor]21-elinor . It was not till [he]24-leslie had carried [her]26-laura along with [him]24-leslie to a point much nearer to [the house]152-the house than to [Elinor]21-elinor , that [he]24-leslie suddenly affected to remember [their]250-their charge . “ Meantime , what have [we]250-their done with [[your]24-leslie ward]1242-your ward , [[your]24-leslie nursling]1243-your nursling ? Is not it time to go back for [her]251-the young nun ? ”[24-leslie] [He]24-leslie was well aware at this moment that [Laura]26-laura was most thoroughly wearied [herself]26-laura , and that by a little contrivance [he]24-leslie was secure of going alone to conduct [the young nun]251-the young nun [home]139-home again . “ What ! had [you]24-leslie forgotten [her]251-the young nun ? ”[26-laura] said [Laura]26-laura . “ Could [I]24-leslie think of more than one ? ”[24-leslie] said [Leslie]24-leslie , with a look of gentleness . “ And that one was of course absent , ”[26-laura] said [Laura]26-laura . “ Ah ! [I]24-leslie see , ”[24-leslie] said [Leslie]24-leslie , affecting a little pique , “ that [I]24-leslie am little understood . But at this moment , ”[24-leslie] [he]24-leslie added , quieting [his]24-leslie voice , “ however that may be , [we]1244-we must run back to take up [our]1244-we charge , for do [you]26-laura know what o’clock it is ? ”[24-leslie] [Laura]26-laura looked at [her]26-laura watch . “ Why did [you]24-leslie allow [me]26-laura to forget time in this way ? ”[26-laura] said [she]26-laura . “ Was [I]24-leslie likely to remind [you]26-laura ? ”[24-leslie] said [Leslie]24-leslie . “ But at all events [I]24-leslie will repair [my]24-leslie error , at whatever sacrifice . [I]24-leslie will force myself”—“from[24-leslie] [you]26-laura , ” [he]24-leslie thought of saying , but that was rather too strong an expression to come easily , so [he]24-leslie began again—“I[24-leslie] will force [myself]0-i through [the world of briars by [the brook side]254-the brook side]253-the world of briars by the brook side , which will take [me]0-i back to [Miss Ladylift]21-elinor more quickly than the path [we]255-we have followed , and [I]0-i will bring [her]21-elinor to join [you]26-laura by [the garden road]256-the garden road , which is , [I]0-i suppose , the nearest way to [the house]152-the house . Even [your]26-laura delightful intrepidity would shrink from [the brook side]254-the brook side , and , indeed , should it be otherwise , [I]0-i would not permit [you]26-laura to hazard [yourself]26-laura so perilously . ” [He]24-leslie was on [his]24-leslie feet as [he]24-leslie said this , and [Laura]26-laura , heated and wearied , could do nothing but agree ; [he]24-leslie looked back as [he]24-leslie plunged into the thicket , and waving [his]24-leslie hand , saw , and smiled to see , that [she]26-laura was waiting for some such token , and then sank upon the bench almost as weary as [Elinor]21-elinor had been . It was very easy for [him]24-leslie to force [his]24-leslie way along [the brook]1245-the brook , over great stones , and among tangled creepers and underwood ; and indeed , [his]24-leslie desire to reach [the place where [he]24-leslie had left [Elinor]21-elinor]1246-the place where he had left elinor , made these obstacles almost unperceived , and brought [him]24-leslie , in a very short time , straight to [the root‐house in which [they]1248-they had parted from [her]21-elinor]1247-the root‐house in which they had parted from her . [He]24-leslie hoped [she]21-elinor would be panting with alarm , and crouching almost weeping for the want of [some one]1249-some one to reassure [her]21-elinor ; certainly [she]21-elinor would not have ventured back alone . Could [he]24-leslie see [her]21-elinor white dress ? not yet , trees were in the way ; [he]24-leslie could not see it — [she]21-elinor was not there — yes , yes , quite in the corner , there was [some one]1249-some one . Now , how gently [he]24-leslie would [he]24-leslie comfort [her]21-elinor , and [she]21-elinor would cling to [his]24-leslie arm . But there was no such scene in store for [him]24-leslie . [Elinor]21-elinor , as though confiding in the assurance of safety [she]21-elinor had received , had laid [her]21-elinor cheek upon [her]21-elinor arm and had fallen asleep . The shadow of [the root‐house]1251-the root‐house had probably fostered the inclination of [her]21-elinor eyes to close ; [her]21-elinor lips were parted , [her]21-elinor hair pushed off [her]21-elinor face , [her]21-elinor colour heightened by the heat ; [she]21-elinor lay or reclined there , at rest , and [Leslie]24-leslie paused suddenly as [he]24-leslie perceived [her]21-elinor sleeping figure . But the presence of [a human being]1252-a human being , the involuntary motions of life near [her]21-elinor broke [her]21-elinor slumber ; [she]21-elinor opened [her]21-elinor eyes , and the habitual associations of [her]21-elinor education , caused [her]21-elinor a burst of alarm as [she]21-elinor perceived who was so close to [her]21-elinor . [She]21-elinor sprang up and a step or two away from [him]24-leslie . “[0-i] Oh , do not harm [me]0-i ! ” [she]21-elinor cried , involuntarily ; then [she]21-elinor collected [her]21-elinor senses , and a deep blush spread over [her]21-elinor face . “[0-i] [I]0-i would die sooner than harm [you]0-i ! ” cried [Leslie]24-leslie , fervently ; but approaching no nearer than where [he]24-leslie stood when [she]21-elinor sprang up . “[0-i] [I]0-i came , ” [he]24-leslie added , after a pause , “[0-i] [I]0-i came to be of use , if possible . [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson is gone [home]139-home , and [I]0-i will take [you]0-i to [her]29-miss chanson . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i need not , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , “[29-miss chanson] [she]29-miss chanson told [me]0-i the way was very easy to find — [I]0-i can find the way . ” “[29-miss chanson] But , why should [I]0-i not ? ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . “[0-i] [I]0-i left [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson on purpose to be of use to [you]0-i . [She]29-miss chanson did not despise [my]0-i services , and [she]29-miss chanson thought [you]0-i would not . ” “[29-miss chanson] Oh , [I]0-i do not even think of such a word , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , coming a step nearer . “[29-miss chanson] That is the only feeling that can make [you]0-i refuse so very common a service , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , trying to wear an air of proud humiliation . “[29-miss chanson] Indeed , indeed , not ! but [I]0-i did not know — [I]0-i thought — [I]0-i had better go [home]139-home alone . ” So [you]0-i had , innocent [Elinor]21-elinor , but [he]24-leslie cared not for that . “[0-i] If [you]0-i so much dislike [me]0-i as [a companion]1166-a companion , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , “[0-i] [I]0-i will go . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i can not dislike [you]0-i , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor ; “[0-i] it would be wrong to dislike [anybody]262-anybody . ” “[262-anybody] [I]0-i thought [you]0-i did , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[0-i] still , in order to be of any use to [you]0-i , [I]0-i came to see whether [you]0-i were still [here]1135-here . ” “[0-i] That was good of [you]0-i , very good , thank [you]0-i , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor ; “[0-i] it was doing [me]0-i good even when [you]0-i thought so ill of [me]0-i — when [you]0-i thought [I]0-i was so unjust . Pray forgive [me]0-i . ” “[0-i] Yes , surely , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , holding out [his]24-leslie hand . [She]0-i looked [him]24-leslie steadily in the face for a few seconds , and then took [his]24-leslie hand . “[0-i] [You]0-i can not think [I]0-i would harm [you]0-i now , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[264-your reverend mother] what [[your]0-i Reverend Mother]264-your reverend mother said in [the Convent]127-the convent , did not mean [me]0-i . ” “[264-your reverend mother] No , [you]0-i are not what [she]264-your reverend mother meant . [She]264-your reverend mother said [I]0-i should be told of merits [I]0-i had not , but [you]0-i tell [me]0-i of [my]0-i faults . ” “[264-your reverend mother] [You]0-i see , then , that [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson and [others]266-others , [every one]267-every one , in fact , is right in making [me]0-i [a companion]1166-a companion . Till [you]0-i came [here]1135-here [nobody]1225-nobody guessed it could be wrong . [You]0-i have brought [your]0-i own ideas among [us]271-we . ” “[0-i] Oh , no , do n’t say that ; [I]0-i did not mean it . [I]0-i did not know what [people]272-people did [here]1135-here , that is all . ” “[0-i] Exactly , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[0-i] and now shall [we]271-we go [home]139-home ? ” “[0-i] Yes , if [you]0-i please , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . [She]21-elinor took up [her]21-elinor parasol and [they]271-we walked leisurely along . “[0-i] [You]0-i never , ” said [[her]21-elinor companion]1253-her companion , “[0-i] saw [forests]275-forests , and great open skies , and [plains]276-plains , in [the Convent]5-the convent ? ” “[0-i] Never , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[0-i] But [we]271-we walked in [the garden]146-the garden , and might sow flower seeds , and have beautiful flowers , and sometimes [we]271-we went to [the common]278-the common , and [the hill]279-the hill . ” “[271-we] Did [you]0-i read sometimes of other fine things , such as [these woods]280-these woods ? ” “[0-i] Yes . ” “[0-i] Are they like what [you]0-i expected ? ” “[0-i] No , [I]0-i did not know how beautiful they are . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i should like to show [you]0-i what [I]0-i saw as [I]0-i came up [the brook]1245-the brook , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[0-i] [you]0-i are not tired now , are [you]0-i ? Will [you]0-i come a little out of the way ? ” [Elinor]21-elinor assented , eagerly , wishing to atone for having been tired once to‐day . [Leslie]24-leslie went off [the path]1254-the path , and [she]0-i followed , till [the bank]1255-the bank became steep and very inconvenient . Then [he]24-leslie held out [his]24-leslie hand and [she]0-i leaned upon it as if it had been a helping stick ; [she]0-i wanted it again , up a few steep stones in [the bank]1255-the bank , and when [she]0-i was at the top of those [she]0-i came upon a sight which made [her]0-i pluck away [her]0-i hand altogether to fold both in speechless delight . [The brook just in front of [her]0-i]1257-the brook just in front of her came down under rocks which nearly met above [it]1257-the brook just in front of her , and leaped about twenty feet from the edge of [its]1257-the brook just in front of her bed to [the pool below]1258-the pool below . The white foam , the graceful motion and shape , the sweet confusing sound , the freshness , took [her]0-i very soul by surprise , and [she]0-i was melted to tears . “[0-i] There — [I]0-i knew [I]0-i should give [you]282-you pleasure , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[0-i] that is why [I]0-i brought [you]282-you [here]1135-here . ” “[0-i] But so much pleasure is wrong , is not it ? ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[0-i] [I]0-i learned in [my]0-i lessons that [St. Francis]36-st. francis , when [he]36-st. francis crossed some mountains which were very beautiful , kept [his]36-st. francis eyes always on the ground not to see them . ” [Leslie]24-leslie did not say aloud , “[36-st. francis] [Abject fool]284-abject fool ! ” [he]24-leslie said it only to [himself]24-leslie ; to [Elinor]21-elinor [he]24-leslie said , “[284-abject fool] [I]0-i should think that very wicked , because [[his]36-st. francis Creator]285-his creator offered [him]36-st. francis the pleasure , and [he]36-st. francis would not take it . ” “[36-st. francis] What do [you]0-i mean ? ” . said [Elinor]21-elinor , aghast . “[0-i] It is [the waterfall]286-the waterfall gives [me]0-i pleasure . ” “[0-i] Still , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , “[0-i] it has got no pleasure of its own . ” “[0-i] Has not it ? yes — no — yes , it pleases [me]0-i , it delights [me]0-i . ” “[0-i] But it runs on day and night without being happy . ” “[0-i] That is because it is not alive . ” “[0-i] It runs over [the rock]287-the rock because water must fall when it comes to a height , and it makes a noise because any one thing filling on another must make a noise , and the trees grow over it , because there were seeds from which they sprang ; but they are all dead , as [you]288-you say , and not happy . The pleasure is something different from all those things . It is in [your]288-you mind . It is a gift to [you]288-you , conveyed by things which have it not , and , therefore , a gift for which [you]288-you ought to be grateful and use it . ” “[36-st. francis] Could [St. Francis]36-st. francis be wrong ? ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[36-st. francis] Nay , [I]0-i really think if [you]0-i were to refuse to look at all this , [you]0-i would be ungrateful to [me]0-i , who brought [you]0-i [here]1135-here , in the first place , and much more [you]0-i ought to enjoy it , when [you]0-i are so made that [your]0-i nature is to enjoy . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i think [I]0-i may like it as much as [I]0-i can ? ” “[0-i] Ay , freely , freely ; whatever is pleasant is in [your]0-i nature to enjoy . ” “[0-i] Whatever is pleasant ? ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , reflecting on the many things , the late rising , the neglected task , the idle play , the lingering over [her]21-elinor toilette , which were pleasant but which [she]21-elinor had been told were wrong , and warned against the pleasure of them . [Leslie]24-leslie enjoyed the confusion into which [she]21-elinor was running . “[0-i] Why , so it seems to [me]0-i , ” said [he]24-leslie , with a candid tone . [Elinor]21-elinor was silent ; [he]24-leslie was no longer in haste to proceed , [he]24-leslie lingered with [her]21-elinor , teaching [her]21-elinor that pleasure was [her]21-elinor lawful guide ; and when , at last , [they]1259-they went forward , moved as slowly as [she]21-elinor was inclined to move and wore away the time , so that when [they]1259-they got back to [the house]152-the house , [Laura]26-laura had , long before , been compelled to give up waiting for [them]1259-they ; had gone in alone , had been forced to preside over luncheon and to eat with [the rest]1261-the rest , or affect to eat , and after delaying to the utmost , had been driven from all excuses , and forced to bid [the servants]1262-the servants bring round , [the carriage]1263-the carriage , previously ordered for an expedition . Just as [she]26-laura and [[her]26-laura guests]1264-her guests were going through [the hall]187-the hall to set out , [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie appeared alone coming up to the door . A sudden hope shot through [Laura]26-laura ’s heart that [he]24-leslie had been alone since [she]26-laura left [him]24-leslie . [Elinor]21-elinor might have lost [her]21-elinor way in the wood , but of course [she]21-elinor would soon be found ; and with all this unworded [she]21-elinor accosted [him]24-leslie . “[0-i] So ; have [you]290-you been looking for [her]291-her all this time ...... ” “[290-you] For [Miss Ladylift]21-elinor ? oh , no ’ ; [I]0-i brought [her]291-her [home]139-home very slowly , for [she]291-her was so much tired . [She]291-her went through [the breakfast parlour]293-the breakfast parlour to [[her]291-her own room]294-her own room ” “[291-her] Slowly , indeed ! ” said [Laura]26-laura , disdainfully ; “[291-her] [you]290-you have been two hours and a half on the way . ” “[290-you] To [me]0-i it seemed twice that , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , in a very low voice . [Laura]26-laura ’s lips relaxed by a line , no more . “[290-you] [You]290-you will come with [us]295-us ? ” said [she]26-laura , looking at the phaeton which followed the great barouche , and in which , if [he]24-leslie liked , [he]24-leslie might offer to drive [her]26-laura . “[290-you] That would be most delightful , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , “[290-you] but [I]0-i had not time for [my]0-i letters this morning . [I]0-i must write them to‐day — besides [I]0-i must get a crust of bread ; besides [I]0-i am in no condition to sit by the side of delicate silks . No , [I]0-i must sacrifice that happiness . ” [Laura]26-laura tossed [her]26-laura head , and turned away ; and [Leslie]24-leslie was very glad to have got off this tax upon [him]24-leslie . [LAURA]26-laura ’S anger and jealousy were almost more than [she]26-laura could bear . [She]26-laura learned to know that beating heart , that dry mouth , that distaste to food , that early waking and no more falling asleep , which make up the personal sufferings of mental anguish . [She]26-laura had to talk , to listen , to make music , while intensely preoccupied ; and [she]26-laura had the pain of perceiving that [Leslie]24-leslie grew more and more indifferent to keeping up the appearances of devotion to [herself]24-leslie , and became , like [her]26-laura , absorbed by one object , but that object was not [Laura Chanson]26-laura . Little incidents of this kind altered the position of [the three persons whom [we]1267-we have presented to [the reader]1268-the reader]1266-the three persons whom we have presented to the reader . From [a forlorn stranger]1269-a forlorn stranger , [Elinor]21-elinor began to feel [herself]21-elinor familiarised with [persons]1270-persons and things , and to be aware that many were more favourable to [her]21-elinor than [the mistress of [the house]152-the house]1271-the mistress of the house , whom [she]21-elinor had looked upon as about to take the place of [the Superior in [[her]21-elinor Convent]1219-her convent]1273-the superior in her convent . [Leslie]24-leslie , who had thought of nothing but amusing [himself]24-leslie for a month or so , gradually found [himself]24-leslie interested in a pursuit , which , at present , had the charm of novelty in the object , besides its difficulty . [He]24-leslie reflected as little on the suffering [he]24-leslie might inflict on [the person to whom [he]24-leslie had hitherto devoted [himself]24-leslie , as on those which in future [he]24-leslie might leave with [the defenceless girl whom [he]24-leslie at present worshipped]1276-the defenceless girl whom he at present worshipped]1275-the person to whom he had hitherto devoted himself , as on those which in future he might leave with the defenceless girl whom he at present worshipped ; meantime , the suffering which [Laura]26-laura endured was very real , whether [she]26-laura were justified in having exposed [herself]26-laura to it or not . [The young girl who had unconsciously taken [her]1277-the young girl who had unconsciously taken her place place]1277-the young girl who had unconsciously taken her place was hateful to [Laura]26-laura ; it was difficult to keep up the appearance of interest and tender protection which had been [their]1278-their first relation to [each other]1279-each other . [She]26-laura justified [her]26-laura altered feelings to [herself]26-laura by saying that severity was necessary to teach [Elinor]21-elinor something of the ways of [the world]1134-the world [she]21-elinor had to move in , and to correct the mistakes into which [her]21-elinor Convent life led [her]21-elinor ; and , in fact , [Elinor]21-elinor had great need of superintendence ; for with all [her]21-elinor early impressions wrecking around [her]21-elinor , [she]21-elinor did not know to what to cling , or where to stop , or how go back . [They]1278-their had laughed at [her]21-elinor prudery , and in the innocence of [her]21-elinor nature [she]21-elinor did not now know what difference to make between [Leslie]24-leslie and [Laura]26-laura ; between [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson , [[her]21-elinor elderly guardian]1281-her elderly guardian , and [Leslie]24-leslie , [[her]21-elinor young adorer]1282-her young adorer . That [Leslie]24-leslie was more good‐natured to [her]21-elinor than anybody else [she]21-elinor was certain , and if [she]21-elinor wanted any advice or service , [she]21-elinor supposed that [she]21-elinor might as well ask [him]24-leslie for either ; not to ask [him]24-leslie would show that long‐taught horror of man which [she]21-elinor haft just recently been made ashamed of . In this embarrassment of perception [she]21-elinor , one morning , brought into [the library]229-the library a heavy packet , containing letters which [she]21-elinor had written to [[her]21-elinor Convent]1219-her convent ; and [the first person from whom [she]21-elinor made an inquiry how to effect its transmission]1285-the first person from whom she made an inquiry how to effect its transmission , was [Laura]26-laura . But [Laura]26-laura was supercilious . “[0-i] Leave it on the table , [child]296-child , with the other letters . There is no need to make a fuss about posting a letter . ” [Elinor]21-elinor coloured and did as [she]21-elinor was bid . But [she]21-elinor was not satisfied , and after a short , silent bit of doubt , [she]21-elinor looked round for [some kinder listener]1286-some kinder listener , and turning [her]21-elinor shy eyes to [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie , saw that though [he]24-leslie had a book in [his]24-leslie hand , and [his]24-leslie head was bent towards it , [he]24-leslie was , in fact , looking at [her]21-elinor . [Elinor]21-elinor ’s colour rose again , for shame that [she]21-elinor had been ashamed to appeal at once to [him]24-leslie ; and avoiding the appearance of mistrust for which [she]21-elinor had been laughed at , [she]21-elinor smiled directly that [she]21-elinor caught [his]24-leslie glance , and went up to [him]24-leslie as if [he]24-leslie had been [Sister Françoise]38-sister françoise or [Sister Jeanne]39-sister jeanne , and in a very low voice asked [him]24-leslie what [she]21-elinor should do . [He]24-leslie was fully disposed to make it a serious affair , that [he]24-leslie might be able to confer an obligation by arranging it , and rising , took it ( [Elinor]21-elinor following [him]24-leslie ) into the recess of the window and there examined the packet . “[297-it] [It]297-it will not go by the post without a little trouble , ” said [he]24-leslie ; “[297-it] it weighs , [I]0-i should think , six ordinary letters . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i dare say ; for [I]0-i have written to so many of [them]297-it , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[0-i] It must be paid before it leaves [England]6-england , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . “[0-i] [The postman]298-the postman will not know how much to charge . [We]299-we ought to put it into [the office]300-the office [ourselves]299-we . ” “[299-we] How can [I]0-i do that ? It is so far to [the town]301-the town , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[0-i] Is not it possible [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson may intend to drive or ride [there]1176-there ? ” suggested [Leslie]24-leslie . “[29-miss chanson] Shall [I]0-i ask [her]29-miss chanson ? ” “[0-i] Do ; ” and [he]24-leslie watched [her]29-miss chanson timid advance to [Laura]26-laura , whom [she]29-miss chanson instinctively began to feel was not likely to look very benignantly on a request of [[her]26-laura ’s]1287-her ’s . “[0-i] No , it ’s not possible , ” [he]24-leslie heard [Laura]26-laura say , and [he]24-leslie concluded that [she]26-laura had heard the words which [he]24-leslie [himself]24-leslie had used . [Laura]26-laura said nothing more , for or against , and went on reading [her]26-laura book , the pages of which [she]26-laura turned tempestuously . [Elinor]21-elinor said nothing , but again looked to [Leslie]24-leslie , who , by a gesture , invited [her]21-elinor to return to the window . “[0-i] If [you]303-you will trust [me]0-i , ” said [he]24-leslie , “[303-you] [I]0-i have thought how to manage it ; since there is no chance of [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson going to [the post town]304-the post town , [I]0-i will ride over there at once , and if [I]0-i go quickly , [I]0-i shall be in time for the foreign mail which goes out this morning . ” “[303-you] Does it ? ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[303-you] Yes , [I]0-i feel quite sure of that , and [I]0-i will post and pay [your]303-you letter , and make it quite sure of reaching the hands of [these dear Sisters]305-these dear sisters . ” “[303-you] Oh , will [you]303-you ? ” said [Elinor]21-elinor ; “[303-you] how very good‐natured [you]303-you are . Only do [you]303-you not want to do something else ? [I]0-i am afraid this is so much trouble . ” “[0-i] No , a pleasure , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; then moderating [his]24-leslie tone , [he]24-leslie added , “[0-i] [I]0-i like an early ride ; [I]0-i want one to put [me]0-i in high force this morning . ” “[0-i] That ’s very lucky , ” said [the literal Elinor]21-elinor . “[0-i] Tell [me]0-i what it will cost , ” and [she]0-i took out [her]0-i purse . [Leslie]24-leslie ’s heart smote [him]24-leslie [he]24-leslie saw that slender purse so slenderly provided . It was too much in keeping with the defenceless state and nature of that fair piece of human porcelain . “[0-i] Oh , not much . [I]0-i will take care it goes safely . ” “[0-i] But [I]0-i must pay it , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , earnestly . “[34-the reverend mother] [The Reverend Mother]34-the reverend mother told [me]0-i never to run in debt , especially ...... ” “[34-the reverend mother] To [the monster man]306-the monster man , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , finishing the phrase [she]0-i broke off , and smiling . [Elinor]21-elinor again was ashamed of a good lesson . [She]21-elinor did not know what guidance to follow ; plainly [she]21-elinor felt [herself]21-elinor laughed at , and that was painful . [She]21-elinor slid back [her]21-elinor purse into the pocket of [her]21-elinor apron , and stood again like [a puzzled , penitent child]1288-a puzzled , penitent child . “[34-the reverend mother] Such a nothing of a debt , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , “[34-the reverend mother] only give [me]0-i the letter . ” [He]24-leslie took it , and moving away to [[Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson ’s room]1289-mr. chanson ’s room , which opened from [the library]229-the library , asked [him]24-leslie if [he]24-leslie could have a horse , and then returning , told [Laura]26-laura [he]24-leslie was going to [Cantleton]7-cantleton and inquired if [he]24-leslie could do anything for [her]26-laura . “[0-i] [I]0-i thought , ” said [Laura]26-laura , smiling painfully , “[0-i] [we]307-we were all to ride to [the Hollow Glen]8-the hollow glen . ” “[0-i] True , [I]0-i had forgotten ; but it will make no difference will it , if [I]0-i am absent ? ” “[0-i] None , ” said [Laura]26-laura , “[0-i] of course . [[One]1228-one ’s guests]309-one ’s guests , of course , amuse [themselves]309-one ’s guests if [[their]309-one ’s guests host]310-their host can not do it . ” [Leslie]24-leslie gave a deprecating “[1228-one] No , no ; ” and added , “[1228-one] [Guests who do that]311-guests who do that , are not worthy of being received ; but [I]0-i really have a little business . ” [Laura]26-laura laughed scornfully , [she]26-laura could not repress [her]26-laura irritation . “[312-purely] Selfish business , [purely]312-purely ? ” said [she]26-laura , interrogating . [Elinor]21-elinor heard all this and was very much grieved that [his]313-you good‐nature to [her]21-elinor should bring this reproach upon [him]313-you .
