[I]0-i am always willing — anxious — that [she]444-that poor child should come to [[my]0-i room]448-my room and be with [me]0-i ; but was not it strange , how [she]444-that poor child persecuted [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie to attend to [her?—not]449-her?—not unnatural certainly — [a man]1160-a man was [a marvel to [a girl from [a convent]1138-a convent]452-a girl from a convent]451-a marvel to a girl from a convent ; but [I]0-i explained to [her]444-that poor child the common forms of society , and [she]444-that poor child should have altered [her]444-that poor child conduct in consequence ; however , it was just the same , and [I]0-i ’m afraid , [I]0-i really am , that this walk of [hers]444-that poor child has something to do with an appointment — if not with [him]1160-a man , with [somebody else]383-somebody else . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i hope not , ” said [the Squire]1324-the squire ; “[0-i] though , indeed , [I]0-i saw that [Leslie]24-leslie was rather in love with [her]444-that poor child . ” “[24-leslie] Oh ! no , no ! ” cried [Laura]26-laura , anxiously ; “[24-leslie] [a man]1160-a man is always flattered if [a girl]456-a girl shows any liking for [him]1160-a man , but that ’s all . How could [he]1160-a man take a fancy for [a child like that]457-a child like that — uneducated yet artificial , not pretty nor amusing ? ” “[444-that poor child] [She]444-that poor child does not say much , ” answered [the Squire]1324-the squire . “[444-that poor child] Besides , [Lawrence]51-lawrence , ” went on [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson , “[51-lawrence] though [he]51-lawrence might have been pleased with [her]444-that poor child , if [he]51-lawrence had been wholly fancy‐free , yet — being as [he]51-lawrence is ...... ” “[26-laura] What ? is [Leslie]24-leslie in love with [anybody]262-anybody — hey ; [Laura]26-laura ! is that it ? is it possible , [[my]0-i dear]1127-my dear ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i have never said a word to [any human being]460-any human being before , ” said [Laura]26-laura , turning away [her]26-laura head . “[0-i] Is it possible ? The thing [I]0-i should like beyond all others ; why did not [I]0-i know ? ” “[0-i] Nay , [you]26-laura think more of it than [you]26-laura ought . Indeed , [Lawrence]51-lawrence , [I]0-i do n’t quite understand [him]51-lawrence ; something . is on [his]51-lawrence mind , which — which ...... in short , there has no word passed between [us]461-us . Has [he]51-lawrence any fortune ? Sometimes [I]0-i have thought , that knowing [me]0-i to have a large one , [his]51-lawrence own want of any may have held [him]51-lawrence back . ” “[26-laura] Oh ! [he]51-lawrence is not poor , but very proud . Are [you]26-laura civil enough to [him]51-lawrence , [Laura]26-laura ? ” “[26-laura] Nay , certainly , ” said [Laura]26-laura ; “[26-laura] it is for [him]51-lawrence to seek , not [me]0-i . ” “[26-laura] Yes , yes ; but at the same time , [I]0-i can tell [you]26-laura that [Fanny Wimbledon]52-fanny wimbledon would have been [Mrs. Chanson]53-mrs. chanson , if [she]52-fanny wimbledon had not thought it necessary to chaff and flout [me]0-i , when [I]0-i was looking for a kind word . ” “[52-fanny wimbledon] Did [she]52-fanny wimbledon like [you]26-laura , [vain man]462-vain man ? ” . “[52-fanny wimbledon] So [I]0-i heard afterwards ; but [I]0-i was in [Caithness]11-caithness , and it was too far to come back . So do n’t throw [him]51-lawrence away — that is , if [you]26-laura think [you]26-laura could like [him]51-lawrence . ” “[51-lawrence] [Lawrence]51-lawrence , [you]51-lawrence are [mother]138-mother and [brother]464-brother to [me]0-i ; ” and [she]0-i laid [her]0-i head on [his]51-lawrence shoulder . “[51-lawrence] [I]0-i do like [him]51-lawrence . ” “[51-lawrence] Is it so , dear [Laura]26-laura ? ” said [he]51-lawrence , fondly caressing [her]26-laura ; “[51-lawrence] then may [Providence]54-providence bring [you]26-laura and [him]51-lawrence together . If [I]0-i can help [you]26-laura .... ” “[51-lawrence] Only say nothing to [him]51-lawrence . Oh ! for heaven ’s sake ! do nothing rash . Proud [he]51-lawrence is , and a word might alarm [him]51-lawrence . But it is a comfort , [brother]464-brother , to have made [a confidant of [you]464-brother]466-a confidant of you , and to [you]464-brother [I]0-i am not ashamed of saying what [no mortal ear besides]467-no mortal ear besides must know . ” Thus talked [brother]464-brother and [sister]1529-sister ; it was a pity that [Laura]26-laura knew all the time that [she]26-laura was lying . Those words of [her]26-laura own , “[0-i] [I]0-i have never revealed it to [another human being]468-another human being , ” took [herself]26-laura in , for although they conveyed a great deal , [they]1530-they affirmed nothing . [Elinor]21-elinor was perplexed beyond measure what to do about [her]21-elinor next day ’s engagement . The utmost [she]21-elinor wished was to tell [Leslie]24-leslie that [she]21-elinor could meet [him]24-leslie no more ; but [she]21-elinor knew not by what means to effect this . [Laura]26-laura would not let [her]21-elinor go beyond [her]21-elinor sight . [The room]104-the room , which [she]21-elinor had declared [herself]21-elinor so anxious should be common between [them]1532-them , was for the first time opened to [Elinor]21-elinor ; [she]21-elinor took a pretext of some fine lace , which was in bad condition , and which [Elinor]21-elinor , profiting by a convent accomplishment , had once offered to put in order . [She]21-elinor had then told how a certain veil had been wanted for an image of [the Virgin]1533-the virgin , in a procession , and how it had been trusted to [her]21-elinor to put to rights , when [some others]1534-some others had refused through fear of its tenderness . [She]21-elinor had spread it on a thick bed of cambric , and then , by patient immersions in certain prepared waters , had removed every trace of dirt and stain , without the least violence to the frail fabric , so that when the image appeared in it next day , inquiries had been made who could so successfully have renovated the delicate fabric . This had been a tale of the early days of [her]21-elinor arrival , and [she]21-elinor was surprised to‐day at [Laura]26-laura ’s recollection of it , and not best pleased that the occupation should have been given [her]21-elinor just this morning . Then followed a drive in which [Elinor]21-elinor was included , the object of which was to meet [a young relation of [the Chansons]55-the chansons]1535-a young relation of the chansons , [Sir Peter Bicester]56-sir peter , who had just got orders to join [[his]56-sir peter regiment]1536-his regiment in [Ceylon]12-ceylon , and was coming for a farewell visit to [Chanson Wood]10-chanson wood . [He]1535-a young relation of the chansons was [a lively , thoughtless lad of eighteen]1537-a lively , thoughtless lad of eighteen , [a great admirer of [[his]1535-a young relation of the chansons cousin]1539-his cousin [Laura]26-laura , who was six years older than [he]1535-a young relation of the chansons , and in [his]1535-a young relation of the chansons intense attentions , during [their]1540-their after‐dinner saunter in [the garden]146-the garden]1538-a great admirer of his cousin laura , who was six years older than he , and in his intense attentions , during their after‐dinner saunter in the garden , [Laura]26-laura lost sight of [Elinor]21-elinor , and [Elinor]21-elinor , with the speed of [an Italian greyhound]1542-an italian greyhound , ran to [the waterfall]286-the waterfall to say one word , and but one , to [Leslie]24-leslie . In case of not finding [him]1535-a young relation of the chansons , [she]21-elinor had provided [herself]21-elinor with a little note , merely , “[0-i] [I]0-i can not come this evening . [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson forbids [me]0-i to go out.—ELINOR [LADYLIFT]21-elinor . ” This [she]21-elinor intended to lay on the fallen tree , and trusted it would be found by [Leslie]24-leslie , should [she]21-elinor not meet with [him]1535-a young relation of the chansons . [Leslie]24-leslie had been [there]1176-there early — as early as [he]24-leslie thought it possible the usual morning ride or drive of the others would set [Elinor]21-elinor at liberty — and the longer [she]21-elinor delayed , the stronger the fear became that [he]1535-a young relation of the chansons should not see [her]21-elinor , so much the intenser grew [his]1535-a young relation of the chansons desire to do so , and the regard in which [he]1535-a young relation of the chansons held the object of it . “[21-elinor] Innocent and artless [Elinor]21-elinor ! ” thought [he]1535-a young relation of the chansons ; “[21-elinor] with a whole heart to give , a whole nature to be made happy , is there anything better in life than to make and share [your]21-elinor happiness ? ” and then more dreamily [his]1535-a young relation of the chansons thoughts dwelt upon images of virtuous felicity , upon the meanness of betraying such guileless confidence , and upon the difficulty which [he]1535-a young relation of the chansons had not hitherto counted upon of converting [her]21-elinor quiet feeling into one of passion . It was already quite dusk , when [his]1535-a young relation of the chansons ear at last caught a footfall . It was of one running quickly ; and eagerly springing to meet [her]21-elinor , [he]1535-a young relation of the chansons at last beheld [Elinor]21-elinor , and felt an almost unknown pleasure in the reality that [she]21-elinor was there . “[0-i] [I]0-i am here for one minute only , ” said [she]0-i . “[0-i] [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson forbade [me]0-i to walk out in the evening . [I]0-i only wanted to tell [you]21-elinor not to wait . ” “[0-i] And why ? ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , holding fast [her]0-i hand . “[37-mr. chanson] [He]37-mr. chanson says it is wrong . [You]21-elinor did not tell [me]0-i so , or [I]0-i would not have done it . ” “[21-elinor] [I]0-i know no wrong ; but [you]21-elinor must not go yet . What ! will [you]21-elinor not stay to know what [I]0-i have been doing for [you]21-elinor ? All is settled now . ” “[469-kind friend] Oh ! [kind friend]469-kind friend , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , receiving the little bundle of papers which [he]469-kind friend had prepared so as to look business‐like ( taking care that in fact they should trouble [her]21-elinor no more ) , “[469-kind friend] how can [I]0-i thank [you]21-elinor ? [I]0-i can only say thank [you]21-elinor — thank [you]21-elinor — [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie , good — good [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie . Farewell ! [I]0-i must not stay ; let [me]0-i go . ” “[0-i] And it is this moment [I]0-i have been waiting for all day , ” said [he]24-leslie . “[0-i] Have [you]21-elinor , indeed ? [I]0-i am very sorry to have kept [you]21-elinor so long . How kind of [you]21-elinor not to have gone away . But [I]0-i am so glad [you]21-elinor did stay ; [I]0-i had got a note written for [you]21-elinor , but [I]0-i should have been uncertain whether [you]21-elinor received it . ” “[21-elinor] A note ! ” cried [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[21-elinor] let [me]0-i have it ; ” and perceiving it closed in [her]21-elinor hand , [he]24-leslie gently took that hand , to draw the paper from when a violent start from [Elinor]21-elinor made [him]24-leslie , too , start , and looking where [she]21-elinor looked , [he]24-leslie saw [Laura]26-laura standing but a few yards from [them]1545-them . [She]26-laura came forward directly that [she]26-laura perceived [she]26-laura was observed . “[21-elinor] [Elinor]21-elinor , ” said [she]26-laura , “[21-elinor] is it thus [you]21-elinor keep [your]21-elinor promise ? ” “[21-elinor] [I]0-i did not promise , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor ; “[0-i] besides , [I]0-i came only to say that [I]0-i could not come . ” “[0-i] Go [home]139-home , ” said [Laura]26-laura , in a low , trembling voice . [Leslie]24-leslie did not mean to be scolded like [a schoolboy]1546-a schoolboy ; [he]24-leslie approached [Elinor]21-elinor with the open , commonplace air of [an acquaintance]1547-an acquaintance , and offering [his]24-leslie hand , “[0-i] Good evening , then , [Miss Ladylift]21-elinor , ” said [he]24-leslie . “[21-elinor] It gives [me]0-i great pleasure if [I]0-i have been useful to [you]21-elinor , and [I]0-i trust [you]21-elinor will command [my]0-i services on any future occasion . ” “[21-elinor] Go [home]139-home , [Elinor]21-elinor , ” [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson repeated , and [Elinor]21-elinor , puzzled , moved away and disappeared , letting fall , as [she]21-elinor did so , the little twisted note , which by this time [she]21-elinor had forgotten . [Laura]26-laura , meantime , made several efforts to speak , while [Leslie]24-leslie politely waited , [his]24-leslie eyes averted , and only listening indifferently for anything [she]26-laura might wish to say . But [he]24-leslie was surprised and startled out of this indifference by a sudden outburst of tears from [Laura]26-laura , who , unable to withhold [her]26-laura emotion any longer , gave way , and wept like one most miserable . “[21-elinor] [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson , ” said [he]24-leslie , coming up to [her]29-miss chanson ; “[21-elinor] alas ! what is the matter ? Are [you]29-miss chanson ill ? can [I]0-i do anything ? Lean on [me]0-i , [I]0-i beseech [you]29-miss chanson . ” [Laura]26-laura ’s tears flowed only the more profusely , and it was in vain [she]26-laura used [her]26-laura utmost effort to restrain the sobs which burst from [her]26-laura breast . [She]26-laura did , in fact , put [her]26-laura hand on [his]24-leslie arm , but [she]26-laura turned away [her]26-laura head , and avoided , as much as [she]26-laura could , any support or assistance [he]24-leslie would have given [her]26-laura . “[0-i] Forgive [me]0-i . [I]0-i did not know [I]0-i was so weak . [I]0-i am ashamed , like [one on the rack]472-one on the rack . Pain and shame — pain and shame for [me]0-i who have been so proud , so sheltered from both ! ” “[29-miss chanson] What is it [you]29-miss chanson mean ? ” cried [Leslie]24-leslie , feeling the awkwardness of [his]24-leslie position , yet not displeased at its novelty , only quite resolved to commit [himself]24-leslie in no manner , and to no thing . “[29-miss chanson] Why , or how , can [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson be the subject of pain ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i shall not be , if [I]0-i can think [I]0-i am [[your]473-your sister]474-your sister , ” said [she]0-i , suddenly . “[474-your sister] [A sister]475-a sister prefers [[her]475-a sister brother]195-her brother ’s happiness to [her]475-a sister own — if [he]195-her brother is happy , so is [she]475-a sister . [I]0-i have just learned what are [your]473-your feelings . [I]0-i did not always know them , but [I]0-i do now ...... ” [Her]0-i voice broke off , and though [she]0-i tried to go on [she]0-i could not . “[473-your] What do [you]473-your know ? ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , not at all choosing that [Laura]26-laura should force [herself]26-laura on [him]24-leslie as [a confidant]1548-a confidant , nor be able to say that [he]24-leslie was [the lover of [Elinor]21-elinor]1549-the lover of elinor . “[473-your] [I]0-i have nothing to discover , beyond a casual circumstance in which [I]0-i have been of some slight use to [[your]473-your friend]477-your friend , but if it is true [I]0-i am to hope for the kindness of [a sister]475-a sister here”—and [he]24-leslie tried to take [her]26-laura hand , which [she]26-laura very hastily snatched away — “[475-a sister] [my]0-i happiness would be great in proportion to [my]0-i want since infancy , of every kindly home tie . ” [Laura]26-laura raised [her]26-laura large , fine eyes to [his]24-leslie , with a look interpreted by [him]24-leslie to mean , “[475-a sister] Is that indeed all [you]473-your can feel ? ” and then suddenly put out [her]26-laura hand , which [he]24-leslie took , and felt that it trembled . “[475-a sister] Be it so ! yes , ” said [Laura]26-laura , “[475-a sister] and now believe that [I]0-i will promote [your]473-your wishes in any way [you]473-your will direct [me]0-i . [I]0-i have no self any longer . ” “[0-i] How can [I]0-i thank [you]473-your , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[0-i] but do not mistake [me]0-i — [I]0-i want no service from [any one]215-any one . [I]0-i have no wishes , unless , indeed , [I]0-i might entertain that of again enjoying the pleasure of such society as made [my]0-i life happy under [your]473-your roof . ” [Laura]26-laura sighed deeply , and shook [her]26-laura head . “[473-your] Ah , yes ! [you]473-your use such words very lightly . Well , be it so ; come to [us]480-us again , [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie , and if ...... am [I]0-i not [[your]24-leslie sister]474-your sister ? ” [she]26-laura concluded , at last , in an eager , abrupt voice . “[0-i] [I]0-i feel , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie — not knowing what to say [he]24-leslie felt — “[0-i] [I]0-i , the most unworthy ...... ” “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ll explain that [I]0-i met [you]24-leslie , ” said [Laura]26-laura , breaking off what [he]24-leslie was saying very impatiently ; “[24-leslie] [you]24-leslie will be very welcome to [[my]0-i brother]482-my brother — [[my]0-i real brother]483-my real brother , ” [she]26-laura added , forcing a smile to [her]26-laura pale lips . “[24-leslie] To‐morrow , then , ” and [she]26-laura moved away ; but in all [her]26-laura violence of emotion , [she]26-laura had recollected the little twisted note , and had stooped and secured it , without attracting [Leslie]24-leslie ’s attention to it . “[24-leslie] What is all this ? ” thought [Leslie]24-leslie , looking after [her]26-laura as [she]26-laura hastily disappeared . “[24-leslie] [I]0-i am to understand that [she]0-i thought [me]0-i [[her]0-i lover]484-her lover ! and not only forgiven , but taken for [a brother]485-a brother . [Brother]464-brother , indeed ! There ’s something generous about [her]0-i — romantic enough . But how unlike [Elinor]21-elinor — that inquiring , innocent look , those confiding eyes ! Why should [this Laura]26-laura want [me]0-i to see more of [her]0-i ? Can it be real generosity ? But [I]0-i will have [nobody]1225-nobody force upon [me]0-i the character of [a lover]1429-a lover . [I]0-i am free ! ” [LAURA]26-laura had now entered on a desperate game , which [she]26-laura resolved at every hazard should end in making [her]26-laura [the wife of [Leslie]24-leslie]1550-the wife of leslie . Right is so much the essential point in [our]1551-our actions , that scarce any villany is deliberately done without justifying it to [ourselves]1551-our ; and so [Laura]26-laura , when not abandoned to passion , found good reasons in the advantages to [Leslie]24-leslie , and in [her]26-laura own superior powers of making [him]24-leslie happy , to carry [her]26-laura along the path from which [she]26-laura could not think of turning . Every instrument must be laid hold of ; [she]26-laura had already made [[her]26-laura brother]195-her brother [an unconscious volunteer]1553-an unconscious volunteer , and [she]26-laura next prepared [[her]26-laura cousin]1554-her cousin to assist in the cause . The same fiction which had served with [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson [she]26-laura made use of to [Sir Peter]56-sir peter . [His]56-sir peter flame for [Laura]26-laura was not such as to make [him]56-sir peter stand in the way of any serious matrimonial project ; on the contrary , [he]56-sir peter would have been proud to see [her]26-laura chosen by [some cavalier of high merit]1555-some cavalier of high merit , an alliance with whom would have made everything splendid and jovial , and creditable to [his]56-sir peter own admiration . That [[his]56-sir peter cousin]1539-his cousin [Laura]26-laura should be neglected , or laid aside for another , was as impossible as it would be humiliating ; and [Laura]26-laura , who had a good insight into motives and character , availed [herself]26-laura of this feeling . [She]26-laura had only to sigh a little , and cast [her]26-laura eyes once or twice to the ceiling , before [Sir Peter]56-sir peter inquired whether anything on [earth]1557-earth , that [he]56-sir peter could affect , had vexed [[his]56-sir peter darling]1558-his darling [Laura]26-laura ; and then , with a graceful show of candour , and of that confidence which [a woman]1161-a woman may show to [a boy]1560-a boy , but [a boy already worth trusting]1561-a boy already worth trusting , did [Laura]26-laura partly hint , and partly tell the same lie [she]26-laura had told [[her]26-laura brother]195-her brother , and which [she]26-laura was beginning to believe [herself]26-laura . [Sir Peter]56-sir peter ’s indignation was boundless — [his]56-sir peter desire to approve [himself]56-sir peter [her]26-laura true knight zealous — [he]56-sir peter would fight [Leslie]24-leslie to‐day if [she]26-laura pleased . [Laura]26-laura had only to temper [his]56-sir peter ardour , and to insinuate that at the , point matters were arrived at between [herself]26-laura and [Leslie]24-leslie , anything which injured [him]56-sir peter , or drove [him]56-sir peter into a shyness of [the family]1405-the family , would be fatal to [her]26-laura interests . No , the only thing [Sir Peter]56-sir peter could do , was to occupy [Elinor]21-elinor ’s attention . a little , keep [her]21-elinor from such “[0-i] open flirtation ” with [Leslie]24-leslie . “[57-pet] There is no harm in that , is there [Pet]57-pet — is there [Peter]56-sir peter ? ” “[56-sir peter] [I]0-i should think not , indeed — little coquette that [she]57-pet is — and fool that [he]56-sir peter is , not to see through such feminine arts . [She]57-pet [a nun]103-a nun , indeed ! ” Accordingly , the day when [Leslie]24-leslie thought proper to accept the invitation forwarded by [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson , upon hearing from [[his]56-sir peter sister]1508-his sister that [she]21-elinor had accidentally met [him]56-sir peter , [Sir Peter]56-sir peter went up to [Elinor]21-elinor the moment [she]21-elinor came into [the drawing‐room]194-the drawing‐room , and forced [her]21-elinor into talk , which [he]56-sir peter continued as [he]56-sir peter took [her]21-elinor into dinner , and sat [himself]56-sir peter down beside [her]21-elinor . [Leslie]24-leslie had given [his]24-leslie arm to [Laura]26-laura , as [mistress of [the house]152-the house]1566-mistress of the house , and had quite determined to pay no attention to [Elinor]21-elinor , such as could justify [Laura]26-laura in “[103-a nun] talking secrets ” with [him]56-sir peter ; but [he]56-sir peter was not prepared to see [Elinor]21-elinor an object of attention to [another]1568-another ; and apparently well pleased to be so . And so , in fact , [she]21-elinor was , for [her]21-elinor whole being was at ease now that [Leslie]24-leslie was returned , and [she]21-elinor had leisure to listen to [[her]21-elinor companion]1253-her companion , who was as young as [herself]21-elinor , and very gay and droll , and made [her]21-elinor laugh , as [girls]1570-girls will at nonsense . [Leslie]24-leslie had habits of perfect self‐control , though [he]24-leslie was so young , and [he]24-leslie forced [himself]24-leslie to be at ease so successfully , that [Laura]26-laura could not determine in [her]26-laura own mind whether [he]24-leslie observed what was going on or not . Careless as [he]56-sir peter seemed , however , [he]56-sir peter was watching [them]1571-them , and a jealous pang shot through [Leslie]24-leslie ’s heart , as to whether it was possible that [this young soldier]1572-this young soldier should ever have indeed had an opportunity of seeing [Elinor]21-elinor as [he]24-leslie had done in [that deep wood]1573-that deep wood , by that fair fall of waters ; and though [his]24-leslie consciousness said no , still the question made [him]24-leslie watch uneasily the progress of [their]1571-them intercourse . After dinner , [Sir Peter]56-sir peter , intent on the interests of [[his]56-sir peter cousin]1539-his cousin , still kept up the attempt to monopolise [Elinor]21-elinor . [He]56-sir peter had provided for so doing by engaging [her]21-elinor beforehand to sing a particular song for [him]56-sir peter , which , by a great effort of [his]56-sir peter memory ; [he]56-sir peter had succeeded in remembering to have heard from [her]21-elinor the evening of [his]56-sir peter arrival , and when [the party]1575-the party was settling to the employments of the evening , [he]56-sir peter followed [Laura]26-laura to the piano‐forte , near which [Elinor]21-elinor was working , and while [Laura]26-laura played , began to request the execution of the promise [he]56-sir peter had obtained . “[29-miss chanson] If [you]490-you like , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , “[29-miss chanson] by and by ; but will [you]490-you be so kind as to let [me]0-i sing later ? [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson wishes [those ladies]491-those ladies to sing , [she]29-miss chanson told [me]0-i . ” [Sir Peter]56-sir peter could not but comply with this modest request , so unlike the answer of [young ladies more in [the world]1134-the world]1576-young ladies more in the world , and moved away , while [Leslie]24-leslie abruptly took [his]24-leslie place , sitting down beside [her]0-i , and assuming that [he]24-leslie had that right to [her]0-i attention which a secret between [them]493-them brought with it . “[29-miss chanson] [You]0-i are happy now , are [you]0-i not ? ” said [he]24-leslie ; “[0-i] there are no more such tears as [you]0-i say [you]0-i shed over that little bundle of papers ? ” [Elinor]21-elinor looked up , frightened lest [any one]215-any one should hear . “[0-i] [No one]1434-no one is listening to [us]493-them , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , “[1434-no one] [no one]1434-no one can tell what [we]493-them are saying ; the insufferable drumming of the piano‐forte prevents the human voice from being heard . ” “[0-i] Drumming ! ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , with a sudden smile of surprise ; “[0-i] nay , is it not very good playing ? ” “[0-i] Do [you]0-i like it ? ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , suddenly . “[0-i] Oh , yes ! it is very good indeed . ” “[0-i] Do [you]0-i like it ? ” repeated [Leslie]24-leslie , smiling also , but urging [his]24-leslie question . “[0-i] [I]0-i think so , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor ; “[0-i] [one]1228-one ought to like what [other people]210-other people are so kind as to do , and it is very difficult music . ” “[0-i] Still [you]0-i do not answer . Do [you]0-i like that loud , hard drumming ? ” “[0-i] When [you]0-i say loud and hard , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , “[0-i] [you]0-i teach [me]0-i what to say . [Nobody]1225-nobody likes what [they]1225-nobody can call loud , hard drumming . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i prejudice [you]0-i ! That is very true , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . “[0-i] So [we]498-we will leave off talking about it , and [I]0-i will entreat [you]0-i , the moment it is over , to replace it , by singing the Spirit Song . Do [you]0-i remember , [you]0-i studied it for [me]0-i ? ” “[0-i] Yes ; and since [you]0-i have been away [I]0-i have studied it more , and can sing it better , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[0-i] Who would do that for [me]0-i , except [yourself]0-i ? ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . “[0-i] [Nobody]1225-nobody cares where [I]0-i go , or what [I]0-i like , or when [I]0-i shall be back , or whether [I]0-i die on [the road]169-the road , or live . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor ; “[0-i] and people who know [you]0-i better must care more than [I.]0-i ” “[0-i] If [you]0-i say so , never mind [the rest of [the world]1134-the world]501-the rest of the world , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[0-i] and now the piano‐forte is at rest . Come , dear [Miss Ladylift]21-elinor , let [me]0-i hear [my]0-i song . ” [Elinor]21-elinor rose , but hung back , while [Leslie]24-leslie obtained [Laura]26-laura ’s permission . [Laura]26-laura assented . “[0-i] Nay , why do [you]0-i ask [me]0-i ? [I]0-i am always delighted when [Elinor]21-elinor can be persuaded to let [us]503-us hear that lovely voice . [I]0-i merely played a little air to bring [people]272-people round the piano‐forte . ” And while [she]0-i spoke , [she]0-i looked round for [[her]0-i cousin]1554-her cousin , and summoned [him]1554-her cousin by a glance , which [he]1554-her cousin well understood , and rushed to the rescue , seeing which , [Laura]26-laura moved away , and left [the coming skirmish]1580-the coming skirmish to do what mischief it would . “[0-i] [I]0-i am so glad to see [you]0-i ready to sing , ” said [Sir Peter]56-sir peter ; “[0-i] [I]0-i was afraid [I]0-i should have to wait long for [Adeste]58-adeste . ” “[58-adeste] [Miss Ladylift]21-elinor is going to have the kindness to sing a song which [I]0-i have begged for , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , stiffly . “[21-elinor] But [mine]0-i first , [I]0-i hope ; [you]0-i promised [me]0-i first , ” said [Sir Peter]56-sir peter , in the blandest tone . “[0-i] [I]0-i think [you]0-i had the goodness to get up on purpose to oblige [me]0-i , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , “[0-i] did not [you]0-i ? ” “[0-i] Yes , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , frightened , and looking round for [Laura]26-laura . “[0-i] Then let [me]0-i find it ; here ’s the book [I]0-i know — yes , here is the song . ” “[0-i] Ah ! that ’s not fair , ” said [Sir Peter]56-sir peter , “[0-i] [you]0-i do n’t forget how very kindly [you]0-i granted [my]0-i petition , and [I]0-i have been depending upon [you]0-i . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i did promise [him]505-him , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , looking at [Leslie]24-leslie humbly and appealingly . “[0-i] Did [you]0-i , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , very coldly ; “[0-i] nay , do n’t allow [me]0-i to interfere with [your]0-i arrangements . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i ca n’t be so indifferent , ” said [Sir Peter]56-sir peter ; “[0-i] [mine]0-i , [mine]0-i first ; [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie , [you]0-i see , says it does not matter . ” “[24-leslie] Allow [Miss Ladylift]21-elinor to determine that point , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . “[21-elinor] May [I]0-i ? ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , joyfully , thinking if [she]0-i might settle it , the difficulty was over ; “[0-i] then let [me]0-i sing first Adeste , and [yours]0-i afterwards , [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie . ” [Leslie]24-leslie made no answer , except a bow , and stepping backward , withdrew from the circle round the piano‐forte ; nor returned to claim the song which [Elinor]21-elinor , when [she]21-elinor had got through [Sir Peter]56-sir peter ’s , at once looked round for [him]56-sir peter to hear . [[Her]21-elinor sham admirer]1581-her sham admirer did all in [his]56-sir peter power to take [her]21-elinor attention from [the real one]1582-the real one , but [Elinor]21-elinor could by no means regain the composure [Leslie]24-leslie ’s displeasure had taken from [her]21-elinor , and [she]21-elinor sought with [her]21-elinor timid eyes , all the evening , the opportunity of obtaining reconciliation , which [he]56-sir peter steadily withheld . Thus ended the first day of the visit , to which [she]21-elinor had looked forward as the time of such happiness . [Laura]26-laura next morning took [her]21-elinor to task . “[24-leslie] What makes [you]24-leslie walk about with such a mournful air ? ” said [she]21-elinor ; “[24-leslie] [you]24-leslie look like [a naughty child who wants to kiss and make it up]506-a naughty child who wants to kiss and make it up . What ails [you]24-leslie ? ” “[24-leslie] [I]0-i am not [a child]110-a child , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , in [her]21-elinor sweet , humble voice ; “[110-a child] but [I]0-i am what [you]508-you please to call naughty ...... ” “[110-a child] And want to kiss ? ” said [Laura]26-laura , scornfully . “[110-a child] No , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , hurt at being turned into ridicule , and at receiving reproof in a spirit that did not deserve that treatment . “[110-a child] What then , ” said [Laura]26-laura , “[24-leslie] and who is it [you]24-leslie have offended ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am afraid [I]0-i have offended [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie . ” “[24-leslie] Is it possible [you]24-leslie think enough of [a man of [his]509-a man of his age age]509-a man of his age , indeed any age , to trouble [yourself]24-leslie about offending [him]509-a man of his age or not ? ” said [Laura]26-laura . “[24-leslie] Why should not [I]0-i ? ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , aghast . “[0-i] Because , ” answered [Laura]26-laura , breaking out ; “[0-i] it is the most absurd thing for [a girl with any proper spirit]510-a girl with any proper spirit , [I]0-i ever heard of in [my]0-i life . ” “[0-i] But [I]0-i have no proper spirit , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , who felt that if [Leslie]24-leslie would forgive [her]0-i , [she]0-i would beg pardon from [him]509-a man of his age with all [her]0-i heart . “[0-i] [You]0-i do n’t know even what it is , ” said [Laura]26-laura ; “[0-i] upon [my]0-i word , [your]0-i conduct is perfectly indelicate . [You]0-i might almost as well go and ask [him]509-a man of his age if [he]509-a man of his age will be kind enough to accept [you]0-i for [[his]509-a man of his age wife]1171-his wife . ” “[1171-his wife] [[His]509-a man of his age wife]1171-his wife ! ” cried [Elinor]21-elinor , quickly ; “[513-wife] what has that to do with being sorry to have displeased [him]509-a man of his age ? [Wife]513-wife ! what can [you]0-i mean ? ” “[0-i] Nonsense ! [I]0-i do hate affected innocence , and all that stuff , merely to impose upon [a man]1160-a man . Heaven knows they are open enough to flattery ; but , really [you]0-i must allow [me]0-i to say , that [you]0-i persecute [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie , with [yours]0-i . [You]0-i follow [him]509-a man of his age about , and look at [him]509-a man of his age , and invite [him]509-a man of his age to [your]0-i side , and force [him]509-a man of his age , really force [him]509-a man of his age to pay [you]0-i attentions , which [he]509-a man of his age probably would willingly [he]509-a man of his age paying elsewhere , only [he]509-a man of his age ca n’t get rid of [you]0-i . ” “[509-a man of his age] Oh ! indeed , indeed , [you]0-i mistake ! ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , almost amazed to death ; “[509-a man of his age] [he]509-a man of his age can get rid of [me]0-i any moment . Think how [he]509-a man of his age went away yesterday evening , and would not even say good night , and indeed [I]0-i am afraid to seem to be intrusive , and [I]0-i never do put [myself]0-i in [his]509-a man of his age way , or do anything to speak to [him]509-a man of his age , unless it comes naturally from [him]509-a man of his age . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i mean , in short , ” said [Laura]26-laura , most disdainfully , “[0-i] that [his]509-a man of his age constant attendance proceeds solely from [his]509-a man of his age own wish for [your]0-i society . ” “[509-a man of his age] Yes , [I]0-i suppose so , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , bewildered ; “[509-a man of his age] [I]0-i do n’t know any other reason . ” “[509-a man of his age] Really , [you]0-i are [a perfect simpleton]515-a perfect simpleton , or choose to seem so , ” said [Laura]26-laura . “[0-i] [I]0-i dare say [he]509-a man of his age is sorry for [me]0-i , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , seeking excuses for [Leslie]24-leslie ’s kindness . “[0-i] [I]0-i am away from all [[my]0-i friends]1177-my friends , and [he]509-a man of his age is very , very kind in giving [me]0-i advice . ” “[509-a man of his age] And what right have [you]0-i to ask [him]509-a man of his age , rather than [me]0-i , ” said [Laura]26-laura ; “[517-most women] [most women]517-most women like to consult [women]1158-women , rather than [young men]519-young men , and [most people]520-most people will judge [those who do otherwise]521-those who do otherwise , to be as forward and as bold , as [I]0-i must say , [Elinor]21-elinor , [you]21-elinor seem to [me]0-i . ” “[0-i] Am [I]0-i bold ? ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , sadly , feeling so fearful , and so shy , that [she]21-elinor could not comprehend the reproach , and as [Laura]26-laura was habitually out of temper with [her]21-elinor , taking it as an instance of what [she]21-elinor must meekly bear from [[her]21-elinor hostess]200-her hostess , rather than as a true accusation against [herself]21-elinor . It influenced [her]21-elinor conduct however , towards [Leslie]24-leslie , for under [Laura]26-laura ’s eye [she]21-elinor could not act with the total unconsciousness of [her]21-elinor behaviour hitherto ; [she]21-elinor was obliged to act by rule , for [she]21-elinor had no feeling of having transgressed [a woman]1161-a woman ’s duty , and therefore no impulse to direct [her]21-elinor . There was , however , always such quiet maidenliness about [her]21-elinor , that it was only by a shade that [she]21-elinor was altered , and [Leslie]24-leslie being on [his]24-leslie high horse , did not so much as perceive it , but thought all the reserve , and all the withdrawal of friendliness was on [his]24-leslie own side . [Sir Peter]56-sir peter learned through [Laura]26-laura , that [his]56-sir peter plot had succeeded , and took a boyish delight in the mischief made , over which [he]56-sir peter laughed with [[his]56-sir peter cousin]1539-his cousin , as [two children]1586-two children do over a ringdove in a string , which [they]1586-two children are tormenting ; but [Elinor]21-elinor , if [she]21-elinor did not offer apologies to [[her]21-elinor kind friend]1587-her kind friend [Leslie]24-leslie , had no spirit or inclination to laugh or talk with [Sir Peter]56-sir peter , and was almost as silent to [him]56-sir peter as [she]21-elinor had been to [Leslie]24-leslie , the first time [he]56-sir peter sat by [her]21-elinor at breakfast . In this mood , the amusements of the day were arranged . [Men]1230-men have a way of employing [themselves]1230-men at amusements , which causes [their]1230-men feelings to become secondary to [their]1230-men sports , and thus [Leslie]24-leslie , angry , even anxious as [he]24-leslie was , yet took it as a matter of course that [he]24-leslie should join heart and soul in the pastime suggested by [Sir Peter]56-sir peter , and accepted by [the Squire]1324-the squire . This was a drag , which [an adept sportsman]1590-an adept sportsman was quickly sent forward to lead over [the country]318-the country , choosing [puzzling places]1592-puzzling places , and paths difficult to follow , in order to try the power of some young blood hounds belonging to [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson . The most perplexing pass thus selected , was a profound gap in [the country]318-the country , at the bottom of which ran [the brook which formed the waterfall in the wood]1594-the brook which formed the waterfall in the wood ; and [the rocky sides of which fringed with trees and bushes]1595-the rocky sides of which fringed with trees and bushes , rose very far above [the bed of [the stream]1448-the stream]1596-the bed of the stream . On one side of this , [Laura]26-laura promised to take [her]26-laura station , and [Elinor]21-elinor was to accompany [her]26-laura in order to witness the achievements of the hounds in these difficult circumstances . There is no faster running than a drag , and luckily for [the sportsmen]1598-the sportsmen , the day was a cool one , of the now declining autumn , and the slight frost made the scent puzzling enough to try the acumen of the eager hounds . [They]1598-the sportsmen had a long circuit to make before [they]1598-the sportsmen should reach the final point where [the ladies]1339-the ladies were to await [them]1598-the sportsmen , and [these latter]1600-these latter had arrived at the rendezvous some time before any sound of the chase broke upon the amber stillness of the autumn scene . [They]1598-the sportsmen sat down together on the stump of a tree , [Laura]26-laura holding a book , and [Elinor]21-elinor producing from the pocket of [her]21-elinor black apron a bit of curiously fine cambric , on which [she]21-elinor was working a cobweb pattern , the whole of which could have been rolled into a walnut shell . [They]1598-the sportsmen were quite silent . [Elinor]21-elinor was afraid of [Laura]26-laura , and [her]21-elinor spirits froze under the unsympathetic influence . To‐day , especially [she]21-elinor was shut into [herself]21-elinor , and [she]21-elinor mechanically pursued the occupation before [her]21-elinor , so far pleased that [Laura]26-laura did not disturb [her]21-elinor in it . At length the cheerfulest of sounds broke the silence , the distant tongue of hounds , rising and falling , bursting out and subsiding . It was a natural piano and forte exactly suiting woods and dingles , and inspiring the ear , which heard them for the first time , with the delight of an unexplored pleasure . [Elinor]21-elinor , finely strung to sounds , took in these with a curiosity and enjoyment which made [her]21-elinor fingers stay on [her]21-elinor work , and [her]21-elinor heart send a flush of blood into [her]21-elinor changeful cheeks . “[0-i] Are [they]522-they coming ? ” [she]21-elinor said , at last , half rising , and looking at [[her]21-elinor companion]1253-her companion . “[522-they] It seems so , ” said [Laura]26-laura , coldly , rising also ; “[522-they] [I]0-i suppose [you]523-you can hear the hounds ? ” “[522-they] Yes , and now [they]522-they are nearer ; [they]522-they seem going away again ; there ! do listen , there ’s an echo . ” “[1226-everybody] [Everybody]1226-everybody knows that , ” said [Laura]26-laura . [She]26-laura walked forward , and [Elinor]21-elinor by [her]26-laura side , [they]1602-they approached very nearly the rocky gap worn by [the water]1603-the water ; [they]1602-they could hear the boom of the waterfall far below and the unaccountable changefulness in the intensity of its sound which running water gives out . It was a wide gap , and presently the bay of the hounds increasing , [they]1602-they saw white spots glancing among the underwood , then the whole shape and colour of [the hounds , full of the tension of the pursuit]1604-the hounds , full of the tension of the pursuit , and puzzling out [their]1602-they way to the brink of [the chasm]1605-the chasm . Here [the foremost]1606-the foremost threw up [his]1606-the foremost head , and changed [his]1606-the foremost note to one of distress ; [others]266-others came up , scented the prey to the very edge , and then ceasing [their]1602-they cry of pursuit , seemed measuring the leap , and with distracted anxiety ran to and fro , tempting [themselves]1602-they to pass it . At this moment [a horseman]1608-a horseman arrived ; [he]1608-a horseman alighted , and cheered the hounds to persevere . It was [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson [himself]37-mr. chanson ; [he]37-mr. chanson knew the secret pass intended for [them]1602-they , but would only act like magical music , applauding [their]1602-they better guesses , but not explaining wherein the achievement lay . [They]1602-they were maddened to accomplish it , by [his]37-mr. chanson voice , and at last [the hound which first came up]1609-the hound which first came up put [himself]1609-the hound which first came up over the edge , where there seemed no hold , and whimpering at what [he]1609-the hound which first came up was about to venture , passed down [the rock]287-the rock a little way , seemed to find a point where the leap was possible , and presently breaking out into music again , was seen emerging almost perpendicularly on [the other side of the chasm]1611-the other side of the chasm , and away in full cry on [the opposite bank]1612-the opposite bank . Once taught the way , [the others]162-the others followed , and [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson as soon as [he]37-mr. chanson saw [they]1602-they were over , turned [his]37-mr. chanson horse up [the stream]1448-the stream , and gallopped away to a further point where was [a bridge]1615-a bridge . [He]37-mr. chanson met [Sir Peter]56-sir peter as [he]37-mr. chanson went , and turned [him]56-sir peter on [the same path]1616-the same path as [himself]37-mr. chanson ; a minute afterwards [the third horseman]1617-the third horseman came up , [Leslie]24-leslie , making straight to [the chasm]1605-the chasm . [His]24-leslie horse and [he]24-leslie had been down , as appeared by the mud [they]1602-they were covered with , and to make up for the time [they]1602-they had lost , were going [their]1602-they best pace on the track [the rider judged by the sound]1619-the rider judged by the sound , would bring [him]24-leslie straight to the hounds . As [he]24-leslie neared [the chasm]1605-the chasm , [he]24-leslie caught a glance of [the horsemen who were now on the other side]1621-the horsemen who were now on the other side ; [he]24-leslie checked the speed of [his]24-leslie horse a little , encouraged [him]24-leslie by [his]24-leslie voice and hand , and then rode steadily towards the leap . [Laura]26-laura , aware of the danger , cried to [him]24-leslie to turn up [the stream]1448-the stream , but though [he]24-leslie saw the difficulty , and though [he]24-leslie had no wish to be killed , [he]24-leslie was at the age , when it seems a matter of course not to be killed , and not to fail ; and disregarding [her]26-laura entreaties , put [his]24-leslie horse at the leap , and got safe over . [Laura]26-laura as pale as a corpse , shrieked loudly as [he]24-leslie leaped . [Elinor]21-elinor , quite ignorant there was any peril , was excited by the stirring sight , so that [she]26-laura clapped [her]26-laura hands , laughed , and leaped with delight . [Leslie]24-leslie saw [them]1623-them both , and when the impetus following the leap slackened , [he]24-leslie stopped [his]24-leslie horse , and giving up the pursuit turned [him]24-leslie , and dismounted beside [the ladies]1339-the ladies . “[1226-everybody] [They]525-they have run into it now , ” said [he]24-leslie ; “[525-they] [I]0-i may as well stop at once . ” [Laura]26-laura had been so thoroughly frightened , that [she]26-laura did not instantly recover . [She]26-laura remonstrated with [him]24-leslie on the rashness with genuine emotion , which [he]24-leslie easily distinguished from any affected nervous‐ ness , and was flattered by it ; but it amused [him]24-leslie much more to see [Elinor]21-elinor ’s excited look , which turned to perplexity , as [she]26-laura heard and saw [Laura]26-laura ’s alarm . “[526-he] [My]0-i horse did it gallantly , did not [he]526-he ? ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , looking cheerily at [Elinor]21-elinor , whose face caught and returned [his]24-leslie smile . “[526-he] Like flying , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor ; “[526-he] it was very pretty . ” “[526-he] How childish [you]0-i are ! ” said [Laura]26-laura ; “[0-i] [you]0-i know nothing of the danger . ” “[0-i] After all , there was none , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , “[0-i] and the appearance of it gave zest to the leap . ” “[526-he] It is very pleasant , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , “[526-he] to see danger , if one is safe . ” “[0-i] How do [you]0-i know that ? ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . “[0-i] Because in [the convent]127-the convent , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor ; answering quickly to [his]24-leslie quick question , “[0-i] the waves used to dash against [the garden wall]528-the garden wall , but could not come in , and [we]529-they all liked to be near [them]530-them . But once the waves broke over , and then [we]529-they all ran away . ” [Leslie]24-leslie laughed , and looked investigatingly at [Elinor]21-elinor ’s face which had blushed brightly , as [she]21-elinor replied to [his]24-leslie imperative question , and [he]24-leslie was thinking why [she]21-elinor blushed . [Laura]26-laura was little pleased at this effect of [Elinor]21-elinor ’s simplicity , and seeing [him]24-leslie inclined to turn [his]24-leslie attention entirely to [[her]26-laura young companion]1625-her young companion , suddenly declared [herself]26-laura tired , and said [they]529-they would go [home]139-home . [She]26-laura chose a path along [the rocky channel of [the brook]1245-the brook]1627-the rocky channel of the brook , where no horse could be even led , and could not refrain from turning [her]26-laura shoulder pettishly to [Leslie]24-leslie as [they]529-they parted . [He]24-leslie scarcely observed it , [he]24-leslie had forgotten also [his]24-leslie reigned anger with [Elinor]21-elinor , and [he]24-leslie rode gently away , thinking of the little scene that had passed . “[531-her] How moveable [her]531-her nature is , ” said [he]24-leslie . “[531-her] It was made on purpose , [I]0-i think , to complete [mine]0-i , cast in [my]0-i mould , when [a man]1160-a man had been completed , and it was fit only to form [a woman]1161-a woman . ” [ELINOR]21-elinor accepted peace with [Leslie]24-leslie gladly and gratefully . Nothing was said between [them]529-they , but [they]529-they resumed without words [their]529-they former position . [He]24-leslie did not want — from [her]21-elinor at least — any show of spirit , or assertion of the rights of [woman]1629-woman ; the meek glad cordiality of [the young gift]1630-the young gift was what enchanted [him]24-leslie . “[0-i] [I]0-i should have taken [Leslie]24-leslie for [[Elinor]21-elinor ’s lover]534-elinor ’s lover , if [you]535-you had not told [me]0-i , [Laura]26-laura , ” said [[her]21-elinor brother]195-her brother . The word went like a dagger through [her]21-elinor heart , but [she]21-elinor smiled as though the thing were beneath notice , and said merely , “[26-laura] Oh ! [that little girl]1234-that little girl ! [he]534-elinor ’s lover is good natured to [her]1234-that little girl . ” And [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson was willing to adopt [her]21-elinor view of the subject . Nevertheless [he]37-mr. chanson would have been glad the expected word should have been said , which plighted [[his]37-mr. chanson guest]1632-his guest and [[his]37-mr. chanson sister]1508-his sister ; and one morning as [they]1634-they stood together , after breakfast , in front of a great dahlia bed , [he]37-mr. chanson broke out into words . “[534-elinor ’s lover] This is all [[my]0-i sister]537-my sister ’s doing , the whole of [this garden]538-this garden ; [I]0-i know nothing of such matters , and it is very lucky for [me]0-i to have [a woman of so much taste and manner]539-a woman of so much taste and manner at the head of [[my]0-i establishment]540-my establishment . ” [Leslie]24-leslie had been profoundly meditating on [Elinor]21-elinor , but roused [himself]24-leslie to answer . “[539-a woman of so much taste and manner] Indeed it is ; [we]541-we are glad enough of the result , but [we]541-we do n’t like the trouble of providing for it beforehand . ” “[26-laura] [Laura]26-laura is uncommonly clever about the management of [one ’s house]542-one ’s house , ” said [[her]21-elinor brother]195-her brother , “[26-laura] indeed about everything . [She]26-laura looks well , do n’t [she]26-laura , at the head of one ’s table ? [I]0-i am proud of [her]26-laura . ” “[26-laura] With great reasons , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson was warmed by this agreement . “[26-laura] And it is [my]0-i good luck that [a girl who might have [[her]543-a girl who might have her own house in london own house in [London]13-london]544-her own house in london]543-a girl who might have her own house in london , and do what [she]543-a girl who might have her own house in london likes — for [she]543-a girl who might have her own house in london has all [[[her]543-a girl who might have her own house in london mother]545-her mother ’s property]546-her mother ’s property — [she]543-a girl who might have her own house in london is only [[my]0-i half sister]547-my half sister , [you]548-you know , and [[her]543-a girl who might have her own house in london mother]545-her mother had [Kitsal]59-kitsal , [you]548-you know , at [[her]543-a girl who might have her own house in london brother]195-her brother ’s death . ” “[59-kitsal] [Kitsal]59-kitsal , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , absently , but with a kind of wise voice , as though that word explained the whole matter . “[59-kitsal] It was turned into money , ” said [the Squire]1324-the squire . “[59-kitsal] If [Laura]26-laura should ever marry , [I]0-i should try to keep [her]26-laura interested in [the county]551-the county by giving [my]0-i influence to bring [[her]26-laura husband]552-her husband into [Parliament]553-parliament ; [I]0-i could do it , [sir]372-sir . [They]555-they want [a Whig]556-a whig , and at the next election , [I]0-i could , and [I]0-i would do it . ” “[0-i] That ’s an object worth [every man]557-every man ’s ambition , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . “[0-i] [I]0-i wonder [you]372-sir never put [yourself]372-sir in , [you]372-sir would surely have liked it . ” “[0-i] No , no , it ’s not the place for [me]0-i ; [I]0-i was young once , but [I]0-i never could hear [anybody]262-anybody talk above ten minutes without falling asleep , and what should [I]0-i do therefore in [the House of Commons]559-the house of commons ? [I]0-i leave all that to [the clever men]560-the clever men and [the fine gentlemen]561-the fine gentlemen . It is not in [me]0-i . ” [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson was pleased with [himself]37-mr. chanson for this successful exposition of the advantages which an alliance with [Laura]26-laura held out , and when [he]37-mr. chanson saw [Leslie]24-leslie in the course of the day talking with [[his]37-mr. chanson sister]1508-his sister , [he]37-mr. chanson repeated to [himself]37-mr. chanson with inward self applause “[0-i] it works , it works ! ” [Sir Peter]56-sir peter also tried to put in a good word for [her]1508-his sister ; “[0-i] Desperately fine shoulders [[my]0-i cousin]562-my cousin has , ” said [he]56-sir peter , looking at [her]1508-his sister in a becoming evening dress ; “[562-my cousin] [she]562-my cousin is a fine creature , do n’t [you]0-i think so , [yourself]0-i ? ” “[562-my cousin] To be sure , [everybody]1226-everybody must ; good colouring too — bright and clear . ” “[0-i] Yes , very unlike that little pale sparrow , ” said [Sir Peter]56-sir peter , designating [Elinor]21-elinor . “[60-sparrow] [Sparrow]60-sparrow ! oh yes ! [she]562-my cousin chirps nicely , do n’t [you]0-i think so , [yourself]0-i ? ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . “[562-my cousin] What [her]562-my cousin singing ? [I]0-i am not very learned about music , but [I]0-i was much indebted to [her]562-my cousin for obliging [me]0-i so about that song the other night . ” [Nobody]1225-nobody ever caught [Leslie]24-leslie wincing under a sudden attack , [he]1225-nobody answered readily . “[562-my cousin] Ay , [she]562-my cousin was conscientious in keeping [her]562-my cousin first engagement . ” [Sir Peter]56-sir peter laughed ; “[562-my cousin] [I]0-i doubt , ” said [he]56-sir peter , “[0-i] whether that would be uppermost in [her]562-my cousin thoughts . Conventual as [she]562-my cousin has been , [she]562-my cousin has no objection to learn the polite art of flirtation ; [you]0-i see that [yourself]0-i ? ” “[0-i] Not [I]0-i , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ve something else to do ; and [I]0-i apprehend if [I]0-i had not , that little sparrow would only chirp defiance at [me]0-i . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i apprehend no such thing , ” said [Sir Peter]56-sir peter , “[0-i] [I]0-i mean to have a walk and a talk with [her]562-my cousin to‐morrow morning ; just keep [my]0-i secret , and do n’t spoil sport . ” “[0-i] It is no matter of [mine]0-i , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . “[0-i] [You]0-i have other views , perhaps , ” said [Sir Peter]56-sir peter . “[0-i] What ? ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , in a quite altered tone , which sounded very much like , “[0-i] Do n’t be impertinent . ” But [Elinor]21-elinor ! [Leslie]24-leslie felt [she]21-elinor did not love [him]24-leslie , that [her]21-elinor regard was one of respect and liking , such as [she]21-elinor felt for [the old Holy Mother in [the convent]127-the convent]1639-the old holy mother in the convent , only tempered by the unholiness of [his]24-leslie sex and conversation , and [he]24-leslie did not know but what the giddy and prattling [Sir Peter]56-sir peter might succeed in inspiring those feelings of which [she]21-elinor was hitherto ignorant . But [he]24-leslie could have no intentions except those of amusing [himself]24-leslie for the hour , and [Leslie]24-leslie felt quite indignant that [any man]1641-any man except [himself]24-leslie , should entertain views which could interfere with [her]21-elinor happiness . [He]24-leslie resolved to warn [her]21-elinor ; and at dinner when [a large party]1642-a large party were all talking , [he]24-leslie asked [her]21-elinor what were [her]21-elinor engagements for the next day . [Elinor]21-elinor did not know that [she]21-elinor had any . “[0-i] [I]0-i said [I]0-i would show [Sir Peter]56-sir peter where the stones with shells in them are to be found , ” [she]0-i added , after a pause . “[0-i] Why did [you]56-sir peter say [you]56-sir peter had no engagement , then ? ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , abruptly . [His]24-leslie tone made [her]21-elinor blush suddenly , for it alarmed [her]21-elinor with the feeling of having unconsciously said what [she]21-elinor ought not ; but after two or three seconds [she]21-elinor answered , “[56-sir peter] because [I]0-i forgot it . ” [Leslie]24-leslie did not believe [her]21-elinor , [he]24-leslie saw the rising blood , and interpreted it [his]24-leslie own way ; but the one truth told about [her]21-elinor intended walk was enough effort , without requiring a second about [her]21-elinor motive , and [he]24-leslie went on , “[0-i] Do n’t do as [you]56-sir peter promised . ” “[56-sir peter] No ? ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , astonished . “[0-i] Let [older people]564-older people show [him]565-you the stones with shells in them , ” said [he]24-leslie , “[56-sir peter] [you]56-sir peter had better not . ” “[56-sir peter] Why ? ” asked [Elinor]21-elinor , “[0-i] [I]0-i once showed them to [you]565-you . ” “[0-i] Yes — very true — but [you]565-you know that as soon as [you]565-you came to this new scene , [you]565-you thought [I]0-i could be useful in giving [you]565-you an insight into it , and in advising [you]565-you . [I]0-i have done so to the best of [my]0-i power , have [I]0-i not ? so that [you]565-you can be sure [[your]565-you fast friend]566-your fast friend . ” “[565-you] Indeed [you]565-you are , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[565-you] Now [you]565-you are not so sure of [everybody]1226-everybody — and unless [you]565-you wish it very much ...... ” “[566-your fast friend] Oh ! no ; besides [he]566-your fast friend can easily find the way if [I]0-i tell [him]566-your fast friend . ” “[0-i] Yes ; and never mind saying much about it to [anybody]262-anybody , that ’s [my]0-i advice . It will be better just not to do it . ” [Elinor]21-elinor instantly agreed ; and after this [they]1643-they talked on other subjects , about which , although [Elinor]21-elinor laughed a great deal less than with [Sir Peter]56-sir peter , [she]21-elinor was far more deeply interested , and forgot every one else , while [his]56-sir peter low voice , and [her]21-elinor lower rejoinder was suffered to continue uninterrupted . “[569-that inveterate flirt] Oh ! [that inveterate flirt]569-that inveterate flirt ! ” said [Sir Peter]56-sir peter to [Laura]26-laura , by whose side [he]56-sir peter sat ; and [Laura]26-laura with death in [her]26-laura heart , was cross to [[her]26-laura cousin]1554-her cousin , and conveyed in obscure language , which had a clear meaning for [him]56-sir peter , that [he]56-sir peter did not help [her]26-laura , and was either clumsy or careless . [The boy]1645-the boy was piqued at this , to strain [his]1645-the boy efforts for better success , and it was therefore with eagerness that [he]1645-the boy watched next morning , lest the promised walk should escape [him]1645-the boy ; but , [Leslie]24-leslie also had [his]24-leslie attention alive , and in order to give [Elinor]21-elinor a good excuse for not going out , [he]24-leslie made use of a means , which no object less interesting could have induced [him]24-leslie to bring into play . This was a literary effort of [his]24-leslie own , a poem which [he]24-leslie could willingly have read to [a severe judge]1646-a severe judge , who would have treated it according to its own faults or merits ; but very unwillingly to [an audience whose admiration was determined beforehand]1647-an audience whose admiration was determined beforehand , by the fact that it was [[their]570-their guest]1648-their guest and [friend who wrote it]1649-friend who wrote it . [Laura]26-laura ’s eagerness to accept [his]24-leslie offer was based on exactly this reason . “[569-that inveterate flirt] D’ailleurs tous nos parens sont sages , vertueux . ”BOILEAU . “[569-that inveterate flirt] Oh ! thanks , thanks , what a treat it will be ! [Peter]56-sir peter , here ’s such a pleasure for [you]56-sir peter , [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie is going to read a poem of [his]24-leslie own to [us]570-their . Oh ! [I]0-i am all impatience — such a treat . ” “[24-leslie] Nay , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , “[24-leslie] how can [you]56-sir peter know that beforehand . [I]0-i want [your]56-sir peter opinion whether the thing is good or not . ” “[0-i] Oh ! there can be no doubt of that . Come to [[my]0-i morning room]571-my morning room , where [we]570-their shall not be interrupted ; [I]0-i could not endure any interruption . [You]56-sir peter do n’t mind [Elinor]21-elinor , do [you]56-sir peter , [she]21-elinor is there already . ” “[21-elinor] Not in the least , ” said [the candid Leslie]24-leslie . Accordingly , to [this select committee]1650-this select committee , [he]24-leslie about half an hour after this time unfolded [his]24-leslie MS . , and told [them]1650-this select committee it was a few verses , which [he]24-leslie had a mind to send to a magazine then in fashion , to see whether they would be accepted or not . “[572-they] Of course [they]572-they must , ” said [Laura]26-laura , “[572-they] [they]572-they will be only too happy to print anything [you]56-sir peter may write . ” “[572-they] If [they]572-they do n’t , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , “[572-they] [I]0-i shall be mortified that [my]0-i verses should be worse than those which [they]572-they do print — but [a man]1160-a man can not judge for [himself]1160-a man . [I]0-i like them , but that is no test ; [I]0-i shall learn [their]572-they value from [your]56-sir peter decision . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i know THAT will be favourable , ” said [Laura]26-laura . “[0-i] And [you]0-i , [Miss Ladylift]21-elinor ? ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , to [Elinor]21-elinor . “[0-i] [I]0-i can tell if [I]0-i like them , or not ; but that ’s all , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . [Leslie]24-leslie smiled , and [Laura]26-laura flattered [herself]26-laura [he]24-leslie was comparing the childish simplicity of [the young girl]107-the young girl , with [her]26-laura own confidence in [his]24-leslie genius . It was a poem of some ten or twelve quatrains , beginning , “[0-i] [I]0-i stood within [the graves o’ershadow’d vault]574-the graves o’ershadow’d vault , ” verses which were afterwards sealed with public applause , and which delighted [Leslie]24-leslie [himself]24-leslie ; but , [he]24-leslie had no confidence that they would be approved by [others]266-others . The approbation on this occasion was unbounded on the part of [the mistress of [the house]152-the house]1271-the mistress of the house ; but [the author]1655-the author was not at all touched by it , except so far as [he]24-leslie considered it a homage to [his]24-leslie own personal merits ; indeed [he]24-leslie thought [none of [them]1657-them]1656-none of them able to form any useful judgment , but [he]24-leslie had a mind to hear what [Elinor]21-elinor would say . “[0-i] It is too long , [I]0-i think , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[0-i] Good heavens , too long ! ” cried [Laura]26-laura , “[0-i] [I]0-i only wish it were ten times longer . ” [Elinor]21-elinor coloured up to [her]26-laura eyes , at being thus convicted of misapprehension ; but [Leslie]24-leslie smiled brightly , and after a few seconds said [she]26-laura was quite right ; as [he]24-leslie read it , [he]24-leslie had [himself]24-leslie been struck by the necessity of cutting out some of the stanzas . “[0-i] It is very useful to read aloud what [one]1228-one has silently written , ” said [he]24-leslie ; “[1228-one] which do [you]576-you think [I]0-i must take away ? ” [Elinor]21-elinor answered nothing at all to this , and [Leslie]24-leslie had not expected [she]21-elinor could . The morning had worn on meantime , and when [the party]1575-the party seemed likely to disperse , [Elinor]21-elinor had withdrawn to [[her]21-elinor room]1295-her room , and it was plain to [Sir Peter]56-sir peter that [his]56-sir peter chance was over for the present . [He]56-sir peter took [Laura]26-laura into [the conservatory just outside]1660-the conservatory just outside , and here [their]1661-their conversation soon began to break into gleeful laughter , and exclamations of capital ! and then hush ! and [foolish boy]1662-foolish boy ! [Leslie]24-leslie paid no attention , but went [his]24-leslie way , with [his]24-leslie verses in [his]24-leslie hand , remodelling what [he]24-leslie thought faulty , and intent on showing the approving answer of the magazine when it should arrive , to [[his]24-leslie late audience]1663-his late audience . In no long time after , [he]24-leslie was summoned to luncheon , and then to an expedition which had been arranged to a neighhouring lion . When [the ladies]1339-the ladies had gone [upstairs]1665-upstairs to get [their]1339-the ladies cloaks and bonnets , hats and habits , [Laura]26-laura followed [Elinor]21-elinor into [[her]26-laura room]1295-her room , and in a friendly tone asked whether [she]26-laura particularly wished to go to [[Gilbert]61-gilbert ’s Glen]1667-gilbert ’s glen . “[576-you] [I]0-i should like it very much , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , not sure what answer the question meant to get . “[0-i] Oh ! then of course it is settled — it does not signify . ” “[0-i] What does not ? [I]0-i am quite willing to stay at [home]139-home . ” “[0-i] What , really ! ” said [Laura]26-laura ; “[0-i] are [you]0-i certain ? ” “[0-i] Quite , if [you]0-i prefer it . ” “[0-i] Nay , in that case , [you]0-i could do [me]0-i a service . [I]0-i meant to have gone [myself]0-i this morning , but [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie ’s interesting poem prevented [me]0-i . [I]0-i want some specimens from [the Neenshill quarry]578-the neenshill quarry to show [Mr. Goell]62-mr. goell to‐night , and if [you]0-i do n’t mind staying , [you]0-i could get them while [I]0-i am away . ” “[0-i] Is [Sir Peter]56-sir peter going to [Neenshill]14-neenshill ? ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , speaking suddenly the thought that instantly occurred . “[56-sir peter] [Peter]56-sir peter ! no — [he]56-sir peter is to ride with [me]0-i — what should take [him]56-sir peter [there]1176-there ? ” [Elinor]21-elinor coloured again , at [her]21-elinor mistake , and willingly undertook [Laura]26-laura ’s commission . Pleased at [her]26-laura success , [Laura]26-laura descended the staircase , and found [the party]1575-the party assembled in [the hall]187-the hall , some for riding , some for driving . “[56-sir peter] Is n’t [Miss Ladylift]21-elinor coming ? ” said [Sir Peter]56-sir peter . “[21-elinor] Well ! do [you]0-i know , [she]21-elinor has changed [her]21-elinor mind , ” said [Laura]26-laura ; “[21-elinor] [she]21-elinor says [she]21-elinor thinks the day too hot , though [I]0-i do n’t know that it is hotter than it was . [I]0-i ca n’t persuade [her]21-elinor , [she]21-elinor thinks [she]21-elinor had better stay quietly in [[her]21-elinor room]1295-her room — [her]21-elinor head aches [she]21-elinor says . ” Thus glibly lying , [Laura]26-laura got into [the phaeton]1670-the phaeton , and [the party]1575-the party set off . [Leslie]24-leslie had been appointed to drive [Laura]26-laura ; therefore [he]24-leslie saw nothing of the movements of [the rest]1261-the rest , till [they]1261-the rest arrived at [the destined place]1673-the destined place , and assembled to walk up [the glen]1674-the glen ; then both [he]24-leslie and [[his]24-leslie companions]150-his companions missed [Sir Peter]56-sir peter . “[21-elinor] Oh ! such a misfortune ! ” said one of [the girls who had come on horseback]1676-the girls who had come on horseback , “[21-elinor] that beautiful horse of [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson ’s , which [Sir Peter]56-sir peter was riding , fell lame . ” “[37-mr. chanson] Really , ” cried [Laura]26-laura , “[37-mr. chanson] how annoyed [[my]0-i brother]482-my brother will be . ” “[482-my brother] And [Sir Peter]56-sir peter thought best to ride it back gently , when [we]582-we were about half‐way . ” “[56-sir peter] The best thing [he]56-sir peter could do , ” said [Laura]26-laura . [Leslie]24-leslie meantime spoke to [the groom who had accompanied the riding party]1677-the groom who had accompanied the riding party . “[56-sir peter] What ’s the matter with the horse ? ” said [he]24-leslie , indifferently . “[56-sir peter] Do n’t think there ’s nothing , [sir]372-sir , ” said [the groom]1678-the groom ; “[372-sir] but [Sir Peter]56-sir peter took it quite on [his‐self]584-his‐self . ” [Leslie]24-leslie feared [Sir Peter]56-sir peter had taken more interesting matter on [his‐self]584-his‐self than conveying [home]139-home a lame horse , and instantly [he]24-leslie suspected [Elinor]21-elinor of being [a party to this pre‐arranged lameness of [Rampage]63-rampage]1680-a party to this pre‐arranged lameness of rampage ; and [he]24-leslie resolved to know what it all meant . [He]24-leslie followed [the party who had walked forward into [the glen]1674-the glen , and expressing [his]24-leslie admiration of the scene to [Laura]26-laura]1681-the party who had walked forward into the glen , and expressing his admiration of the scene to laura , said [he]24-leslie should like to climb [the right side of [the valley]1362-the valley]1683-the right side of the valley , where the rocks were steepest , and would join [her]26-laura again at [the farthest outlet]1685-the farthest outlet ; but , if [he]24-leslie should not be arrived by the time [they]1686-they reached [it]1674-the glen , [they]1686-they were not to wait . [Laura]26-laura gave an easy assent , which was more than [he]24-leslie expected ; but [he]24-leslie had been prepared to disregard any remonstrance [she]26-laura might make , and therefore at once struck away into [the wood]1169-the wood , and having lost sight of [the rest]1261-the rest , turned , and came straight to [the inn where the horses]1689-the inn where the horses were being put up . The present of [a sovereign]1690-a sovereign convinced [the groom]1678-the groom that it could do the horse [he]24-leslie had ridden no harm to turn round and carry [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie [home]139-home , and that [he]1678-the groom , [the groom]1678-the groom , was to return in [the vacated seat of [the phaeton]1670-the phaeton]1694-the vacated seat of the phaeton . Accordingly [Leslie]24-leslie mounted and riding gently away for the first quarter of a mile gradually increased [his]24-leslie horse ’s speed , till [he]24-leslie was going at a good hand‐gallop back on [the road]169-the road to [Chanson Wood]10-chanson wood . Had [Sir Peter]56-sir peter been cautiously riding a lame horse , [Leslie]24-leslie must have over‐ taken [him]56-sir peter , but [he]24-leslie did no such thing , and this convinced [him]24-leslie more and more that the sudden lameness was a mere fiction , fitting into the sudden headache which [he]24-leslie believed to be equally fictitious . When [he]24-leslie came to [the house]152-the house , [nobody]1225-nobody was [there]1176-there — [the servants]1262-the servants knew nothing — had not seen [Miss Ladylift]21-elinor go out or come in . [Leslie]24-leslie had met with [Rampage]63-rampage in [the stableyard]1701-the stableyard being led about quite cured of [his]24-leslie lameness , but not yet of [his]24-leslie perspiration ; [his]24-leslie own horse required similar cares , and [the head groom]1702-the head groom uttered anathemas upon [young gentlemen]1703-young gentlemen ’s “[56-sir peter] [hignorance of orses]585-hignorance of orses , ” such as often follow upon [young gentlemen]1703-young gentlemen ’s excited passions which [the grooms]1705-the grooms leave out of the account when [they]1705-the grooms attribute all to “[56-sir peter] hignorance . ” Turning at once to [the wood]1169-the wood , [Leslie]24-leslie strode along the path which led to [the quarry]1707-the quarry , with all the feelings of [an injured man]1708-an injured man , and in a very short time had reached [the hill]279-the hill , the highest point of which contained [the quarry]1707-the quarry . [It]279-the hill was dotted with trees in natural clumps , growing from rocky ledges which broke out over the surface from top to bottom , and among these [the path]1254-the path wound , appearing and disappearing in its descent to the level ground . [He]24-leslie stood a moment at the bottom , feeling that [his]24-leslie appearance in pursuit of [[his]24-leslie rival]1712-his rival would not wear a very dignified aspect , and while this occurred to [him]24-leslie , [two figures]1713-two figures emerged for a moment from the wood to an open space and again disappeared among the trees . [Leslie]24-leslie ’s eyes were fixed on the next opening , devouring the space beforehand ; again [the figures]1714-the figures came and vanished , but nearer and plainer , and near and plain enough to know [they]1714-the figures were [Elinor]21-elinor and [Sir Peter]56-sir peter . [Leslie]24-leslie ground [his]24-leslie teeth — to be deceived was one of the bitter feelings‐that a creature so guileless as [she]1715-she seemed should have deceived , and been believed by [him]24-leslie , was another . [He]24-leslie thought at first [he]24-leslie would meet and confound [her]21-elinor by mere silence — then [he]24-leslie would have given much not to have returned , and not to be found out by [her]21-elinor in such interest as to watch [her]21-elinor . Under this sudden thought [he]24-leslie dashed into the thick of the wood , and there , from safe distances , again fixed [his]24-leslie eyes on the path along which [they]1714-the figures must go . [They]1714-the figures passed very near , [Sir Peter]56-sir peter carrying [her]21-elinor basket , and talking with great animation . [Elinor]21-elinor ’s face was hidden by [her]21-elinor great hat and veil ; [she]21-elinor was saying nothing as [she]21-elinor passed , but how could [she]21-elinor when [[her]21-elinor companion]1253-her companion was so loquacious ? enough , enough , [she]21-elinor was walking with [him]24-leslie ! [They]1714-the figures passed on , and [Leslie]24-leslie strode away , burying [himself]24-leslie in [the woods]1421-the woods till nearly dinner time , and then dressed furiously , and came down to [the drawing‐room]194-the drawing‐room as placidly and calmly as if not one disturbed thought raged within . “[585-hignorance of orses] What became of [you]586-you , [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie ? ” said [Laura]26-laura ; “[24-leslie] did [you]586-you lose [your]586-you way in [the glen]1674-the glen ? ” “[586-you] No , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[586-you] but [I]0-i got so entirely away from the place where [we]588-we were to have met , that [I]0-i resolved to borrow [[your]589-your groom]590-your groom ’s horse , and ride [home]139-home without waiting for [you]589-your . ” [Laura]26-laura let the subject drop . “[0-i] Look here , ” [she]26-laura said , turning to the table ; “[21-elinor] [Elinor]21-elinor has been so kind as to get [me]0-i some fossils to show [Mr. Goell]62-mr. goell this evening , and after all [that tiresome man]592-that tiresome man is not come . [They]593-they are beautiful , are they not ? ” “[593-they] Very , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , and turned to [Elinor]21-elinor . “[593-they] [You]21-elinor got as far as [the stone quarry]594-the stone quarry then , ” said [he]24-leslie , in the blandest tone , “[593-they] this hot day ? ” Irreproachable as the voice was , it made [her]21-elinor colour . “[21-elinor] Yes , ” [she]21-elinor said , in a low voice ; “[21-elinor] but ...... ” the disjunctive conjunction was indicated , not spoken through , and [Leslie]24-leslie , taking up two or three in [his]24-leslie hand , said “[21-elinor] [You]21-elinor must have had a great weight to carry . [Your]21-elinor arm must ache , does it not ? ” “[21-elinor] No , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor ; “[21-elinor] for [[Si ...... ”]1719-si ...... ”]1719-si ...... ” “[0-i] [I]0-i had the honour of sparing [Miss Ladylift]21-elinor that trouble , ” said [Sir Peter]56-sir peter . “[0-i] Oh — yes ! ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , as if the explanation were most satisfactory , and [he]24-leslie would not catch the eyes of [Elinor]21-elinor , which [he]24-leslie felt sought [his]24-leslie , to explain or deprecate , or deceive — [he]24-leslie thought the latter . And now for the next few days [Leslie]24-leslie behaved like [a brute]1721-a brute to [Elinor]21-elinor ; [a polished brute]1722-a polished brute , bringing [her]21-elinor shawl , setting [her]21-elinor chair , opening the door with frigid politeness , but never once looking [her]21-elinor in the face ; never coming near for a word of explanation , never entering into what [she]21-elinor said or did ; never including [her]21-elinor in any project or employment . All the time [he]24-leslie felt [he]24-leslie was straightening , rather than loosing the bond between [them]1723-them , for [he]24-leslie was aware [she]21-elinor was intent upon explanation , and that at any moment by a return to kindliness [he]24-leslie could open all the pent‐up feelings of that guileless heart ; yes , guileless , for in [his]24-leslie most secret thought [he]24-leslie was convinced there was no guile in [Elinor]21-elinor , though [he]24-leslie chose to say , even to [himself]24-leslie , there was . Meantime , [she]21-elinor was so unhappy that [she]21-elinor sometimes rebelled against it ; [she]21-elinor seriously thought [she]21-elinor would return to [[her]21-elinor convent]1219-her convent , and hide [herself]21-elinor from [a world where plainly [nobody]1225-nobody cared for [her]21-elinor]1725-a world where plainly nobody cared for her . When all [her]21-elinor efforts to speak to [Leslie]24-leslie , and to conciliate [him]24-leslie , failed — when [he]24-leslie persevered in mortifying [her]21-elinor , and in affecting unconsciousness of [her]21-elinor presence , [her]21-elinor heart rose quite full of tears , and seemed too swollen for [her]21-elinor bosom . “[0-i] What right has [he]595-he to make [me]0-i so unhappy , ” [she]21-elinor said to [herself]21-elinor , but [Leslie]24-leslie did not melt , though [he]24-leslie saw [her]21-elinor eyes cloud with what [he]24-leslie knew were tears , suppressed though they might be . [Laura]26-laura saw all this and was delighted ; [she]26-laura thought [her]26-laura plans were working their full effect ; and [Leslie]24-leslie ’s attention to [her]21-elinor , which was mostly aimed at vexing [Elinor]21-elinor , [she]21-elinor readily deceived [herself]21-elinor into thinking was wholly to please [herself]21-elinor . [She]21-elinor was in great spirits ; [she]21-elinor looked very handsome , and did all that [she]21-elinor could imagine would best please [[her]21-elinor favoured guest]1727-her favoured guest . [His]24-leslie poem [she]21-elinor continually brought forward till [he]24-leslie dreaded the very mention of it .
