Every post , [she]21-elinor remembered not to forget [her]21-elinor interest about the expected answer , and each time [she]21-elinor expressed [her]21-elinor conviction that [the editor]1728-the editor would only not know how to give it sufficient welcome . [Leslie]24-leslie felt confident enough of that also , but the pudeur of composition ( when [the author]1655-the author has written what [he]24-leslie felt ) made [him]24-leslie shrink from so much talk about it . It was the fourth morning after [his]24-leslie estrangement from [Elinor]21-elinor that the letters as usual being brought round at breakfast , [Laura]26-laura ’s inquiry again broke in on [Leslie]24-leslie ’s glance over those laid beside [him]24-leslie . “[595-he] Is there an answer yet?”—and [he]24-leslie , breaking open the seal of [a business‐like looking one]1730-a business‐like looking one , ran [his]24-leslie eye down the page , and replied in rather an unnecessarily indifferent tone , “[595-he] Yes , [they]596-they refuse it . ” [Laura]26-laura had not much tact ; instead of dropping so distasteful a subject , [she]26-laura could not let it alone . “[596-they] Impossible ! how absurd ! and the things [they]596-they do take , yet refuse yours!—for [my]0-i part [I]0-i thought [they]596-they would have seized upon it like a gold mine ! Well [they]596-they do n’t know [their]596-they own interest . ” “[596-they] That is just what [they]596-they do know , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[596-they] what is likely to please , [they]596-they are certain to adopt , ” and [he]24-leslie folded each fold of the paper , and put it into [his]24-leslie pocket . “[0-i] [I]0-i only wish [you]597-you would give it [me]0-i , ” said [Laura]26-laura ; “[597-you] [I]0-i would print it , and show [the world]1134-the world what poetry is . ” So [she]26-laura went on , not conscious how this effort to show [the author]1655-the author was not mortified , pressed on [him]24-leslie the assurance that [everybody]1226-everybody saw [he]24-leslie was . [Leslie]24-leslie , however , turned the matter into laughter , wished [[his]24-leslie enemy]1733-his enemy might write a book ; and , in fact , took the rejection to heart very little after the first moment of making it public . But [Elinor]21-elinor had seen that [he]24-leslie was vexed for some instants , and when [the ladies]1339-the ladies were lingering in the morning‐room before separating for [their]1339-the ladies several avocations , [she]0-i had heard [Laura]26-laura making much of it to the circle round [her]26-laura . “[24-leslie] [Poor Mr. Leslie]24-leslie , ” [she]0-i said ; “[24-leslie] [I]0-i ’m sorry for [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie , [he]24-leslie bore it pretty well . ” In the innocence of [her]0-i heart , [Elinor]21-elinor deduced that [he]24-leslie had suffered a great fall , that [he]24-leslie was humbled , [he]24-leslie who had been so proud and lofty in every way . [She]0-i glided away , unnoticed ; and with a beating heart reached the door of [the library]229-the library , where [Leslie]24-leslie was reading , forgetful , probably of the whole matter ; or , if [he]24-leslie thought of it at all , merely resolving to annihilate [the editor]1728-the editor some day or other , by giving all [his]24-leslie support to the rival magazine . [He]24-leslie did not look up , though [he]24-leslie saw in a mirror opposite that it was [Elinor]21-elinor , and [his]24-leslie heart quickened its throb in consequence ; but [he]24-leslie would not relax from [his]24-leslie unkindness . [She]0-i had laid [her]0-i little plan for doing [him]24-leslie a sort of homage , in what [she]0-i looked upon to be adverse circumstances , and in pursuance of it had already sought for , and found a book , the only circumstance about which that interested [her]0-i , was that the text in one page was mixed with a certain number of Latin verses , which verses [she]0-i meant to be [[her]0-i allies]1737-her allies in [her]0-i harmless stratagem . Yet [she]0-i hesitated for a minute before carrying [her]0-i plan into execution , and in the mirror [he]24-leslie contrived to watch [her]0-i , without attracting [her]0-i observation . [He]24-leslie saw [her]0-i timid approach , [he]24-leslie marked the pause [she]0-i made , and how [she]0-i lightly pressed [her]0-i small white teeth upon [her]0-i under lip , like one in perplexity about the thing [she]0-i was going to do . Presently [she]0-i resolved to come forward , and did so hastily ; upon which , [Leslie]24-leslie rose , and was ceremoniously placing a chair for [her]0-i , when [she]0-i broke in . “[24-leslie] No , [I]0-i do n’t want to sit down , [I]0-i want to ask [you]599-you if [you]599-you will explain this Latin for [me]0-i . ” [He]24-leslie took the book a little surprised at [her]0-i request , and read into English four lines beginning — “[599-you] Pannonis haud aliter post ictum sævior Ursa . ” “[599-you] Thank [you]599-you , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , looking [him]24-leslie in the face , “[599-you] [you]599-you know everything , [you]599-you can do everything . How pleasant to be so clever as [you]599-you are . ” [Leslie]24-leslie returned [her]0-i look , trying to comprehend what this little scene meant . “[599-you] What book is it , ” said [he]24-leslie , “[599-you] where [you]0-i have found this passage ? ” and [he]24-leslie turned to the title page of the little volume . [Elinor]21-elinor did not know ; [she]21-elinor held out [her]21-elinor hand for it . “[0-i] It is , ” said [she]21-elinor , “[34-the reverend mother] it is ...... ” and [she]21-elinor tried to catch the title at the top of the page , [Leslie]24-leslie saw in a moment that [she]21-elinor knew nothing about it . “[34-the reverend mother] Have [you]0-i read it through , as far as this ? ” said [he]24-leslie . “[0-i] Not quite , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[0-i] It is a volume of [Montaigne]64-montaigne ’s Essays , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . “[34-the reverend mother] What would [the Reverend Mother]34-the reverend mother say , if [she]34-the reverend mother knew [you]599-you had such a book in [your]599-you hands ? ” “[34-the reverend mother] Would [she]34-the reverend mother be angry ? ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , in sincerest alarm . “[34-the reverend mother] Nay , does not it strike [you]599-you as [you]599-you read , especially now this twentieth Essay , ” ( [he]24-leslie knew perfectly well [she]34-the reverend mother had not read a word of it)—“that[34-the reverend mother] [she]34-the reverend mother would hardly have thought it a fit study for [[her]34-the reverend mother pupil]600-her pupil ? ” “[34-the reverend mother] Would not [she]34-the reverend mother indeed , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , “[34-the reverend mother] Oh ! indeed [I]0-i did but just look at it a very little . ” “[0-i] If [you]599-you had looked a very little more , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , “[599-you] [I]0-i should not have had the pleasure of being [[your]599-you interpreter]601-your interpreter , for here is the Latin done into French at the bottom of the page . ” “[599-you] Is there ? ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , more embarrassed , “[0-i] [I]0-i did not think — that is [I]0-i thought ...... ” “[599-you] [You]599-you thought , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , [his]24-leslie whole manner changing to tenderness , “[599-you] that [I]0-i was vexed , and [you]599-you came to raise [my]0-i self‐esteem . ” “[599-you] No , no , not vexed , ” [she]21-elinor murmured . “[599-you] Yes , indeed ; do not deny it . [I]0-i see it , like a glimpse of [Paradise]15-paradise . How gentle , how womanly — all [I]0-i could have aspired to , would have been forgiveness , for [I]0-i have done very ill , but [you]599-you no sooner fancy [me]0-i humbled , than [your]599-you generosity comes to put [me]0-i higher than [I]0-i was before . ” “[599-you] Indeed , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , “[599-you] [I]0-i wanted to know the meaning . ” “[0-i] Indeed no , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[599-you] [you]599-you had something better in view . [You]599-you acted from the impulses of [your]599-you noble heart . How inferior [I]0-i am — despicable . If [I]0-i might ever reach to [your]599-you height — nay , do hear [me]0-i , [Elinor]21-elinor — [I]0-i begin to know [myself]0-i . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i know [you]599-you are good and clever , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[599-you] Good ? alas ! but [I]0-i may become so . All good is possible in contact with such lovely goodness . [Elinor]21-elinor ! [I]0-i can not tell whether there is any feeling in [your]21-elinor heart for [me]0-i , beyond that which [you]21-elinor would have for [[your]21-elinor father]602-your father confessor ; but in [mine]0-i , there is a perfect love for [you]21-elinor , which [I]0-i did not know [I]0-i was capable of . Love [me]0-i ! love [me]0-i ! Oh ! [Elinor]21-elinor , say [you]21-elinor can love [me]0-i enough to be [[my]0-i wife]603-my wife . ” [Elinor]21-elinor stood speechless , puzzled by [his]602-your father change of manner , uncertain whether [he]602-your father was displeased at first , amazed at [his]602-your father earnest expressions , and perfectly bewildered by the prayer to which it all led . “[21-elinor] How can [I]0-i tell , ” [she]0-i said , at last , and [Leslie]24-leslie ’s earnestness increased with [his]602-your father uncertainty . “[0-i] Is there no answer for [me]0-i but that , ” [he]602-your father said ; “[0-i] what does it mean , [Elinor]21-elinor , am [I]0-i such [a stranger to all [your]21-elinor thoughts]604-a stranger to all your thoughts , am [I]0-i so indifferent to [you]21-elinor , that [you]21-elinor can not tell whether [you]21-elinor think kindly of [me]0-i ? ” . “[21-elinor] Oh yes ! [I]0-i can tell that , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , “[21-elinor] [you]21-elinor know [you]21-elinor are [[my]0-i only friend]1484-my only friend . ” “[21-elinor] And is not [[your]21-elinor only friend]606-your only friend fit to ask [you]21-elinor for [[his]606-your only friend only friend]607-his only friend , [the nearest , dearest friend]608-the nearest , dearest friend — [[his]606-your only friend wife]1171-his wife ? ” “[1132-your guardian] That [only Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson can tell , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[37-mr. chanson] Oh ! [[your]21-elinor guardian]1132-your guardian ? yes , [I]0-i understand [you]21-elinor now ; but it is [your]21-elinor answer , not [his]1132-your guardian , that [I]0-i want ; [Elinor]21-elinor , [I]0-i am not asking [[your]21-elinor guardian]1132-your guardian to be [[my]0-i wife]603-my wife . ” [Elinor]21-elinor smiled , and [her]21-elinor bright , shy eyes were kindled almost to laughter , but [she]21-elinor answered with a grave voice . “[1132-your guardian] It is only [he]1132-your guardian , who can determine for [me]0-i about such things . ” “[1132-your guardian] So [they]613-they say in [[your]21-elinor convent]614-your convent , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , “[613-they] but consider how many things were told [you]21-elinor there , which differ from what [you]21-elinor have learned in [the world]1134-the world . Think , most precious [Elinor]21-elinor , is it [he]1132-your guardian who can tell , or [you]21-elinor , whether [you]21-elinor would be pleased at dwelling always where [I]0-i dwell , at being as certain that [my]0-i heart is full of [you]21-elinor , as that [you]21-elinor say [your]21-elinor daily prayers , at making [my]0-i life , ( and [yours]21-elinor with [mine]0-i ) good and happy ; at knowing all [I]0-i know , no secret ever between [us]616-us , and if [we]616-us have any trouble , having it together , and knowing exactly the measure and weight of [each other]1279-each other ’s pain as well as pleasure ? ” [Elinor]21-elinor was silent , but [she]21-elinor was listening to every word ; [her]21-elinor eyes had fallen from [his]1738-his , but [her]21-elinor hand rested in the grasp of [his]1738-his two hands . “[21-elinor] Can any tell all this , except [yourself]21-elinor ? Can [you]21-elinor not tell it now ? answer [me]0-i , only answer may [I]0-i love [you]21-elinor . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i thought [I]0-i had made [you]21-elinor angry , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[0-i] Oh ! never think that again — be [[my]0-i wife]603-my wife , and such thoughts could never come — there would be but one thought between [us]616-us , neither [you]21-elinor could doubt [me]0-i , nor [I]0-i [you]21-elinor ; would not there be a pleasure in that ? ” “[619-he] Yes , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , thinking , “[619-he] [he]619-he will never suspect [me]0-i again , ” while through [Leslie]24-leslie ’s mind it glanced — “[619-he] [She]620-she played [me]0-i false about that rendezvous with [Bicester]56-sir peter , but never mind , [I]0-i wo n’t tempt [her]620-she to tell [me]0-i stories . ” Aloud [he]619-he said , “[620-she] Then tell [me]0-i [your]21-elinor own self [you]21-elinor are mine . Say there is so much happiness for [me]0-i in [this world]418-this world , land for [you]21-elinor too , happiness — is it not — will it not be ? ” and now [his]619-he hand unforbidden got round [her]0-i waist . [Elinor]21-elinor began to understand [him]619-he . “[620-she] Yes — it is more happiness than [I]0-i ever thought of , ” [she]0-i said ; “[620-she] but [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson must say if [I]0-i may . ” “[37-mr. chanson] No , no ; not yet , at least , [you]622-you have nothing to ask from [him]37-mr. chanson ; it will be enough that [he]37-mr. chanson should be told by and by . This is [our]623-our own concern , that [the world]1134-the world ’s . Why should [they]625-they meddle , and whisper , and smile ; to [us]623-our it is serious , it is sacred ? Why should [every fool]626-every fool know [our]623-our precious secret ? ” [Elinor]21-elinor was glad to be allowed silence , [she]21-elinor would have felt it a painful task , to say anything so interesting to [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson , to whom [she]21-elinor never talked ; or to [Laura]26-laura , of whom [she]21-elinor was afraid ; and [she]21-elinor went out of [that room]1739-that room full of a consciousness of the great thing that had happened , yet apparently as much the same quiet [Elinor]21-elinor , as it was possible to be . [Leslie]24-leslie was equally self‐controlled , [he]24-leslie wished beyond measure to keep [his]24-leslie secret , and therefore succeeded ; there was no covert thought prompting either of [them]623-our to let it be discovered , and therefore there was a perfect simplicity and good faith in [their]623-our manner of doing it . The days following were a time of incredible happiness to [Leslie]24-leslie . [He]24-leslie had been vanquished by generous and good feelings suddenly getting the mastery over [him]24-leslie , and [he]24-leslie was lifted above the base purposes which [he]24-leslie had entertained towards [Elinor]21-elinor . [He]24-leslie enjoyed [his]24-leslie own better feelings , the nobler part of [his]24-leslie nature took the place of the baser , and had an artistic attraction for [him]24-leslie ; [he]24-leslie felt [himself]24-leslie freer for great things than before , [he]24-leslie had the pleasure of loving what was not [himself]24-leslie , yet [his]24-leslie own ; and although [he]24-leslie was unable to conceive the guileless purity of [the young girl]107-the young girl , [he]24-leslie was more and more captivated by the degree of it , which [he]24-leslie could not help discerning , as [he]24-leslie became more intimate with [her]107-the young girl thoughts and ways . [Elinor]21-elinor was awakening to the hopes and happiness of life ; [the Being under whose influence these prospects unfolded themselves]1741-the being under whose influence these prospects unfolded themselves , became [her]21-elinor one interest , and identified [himself]24-leslie with all [her]21-elinor feelings . [She]21-elinor opened [her]21-elinor heart to [his]24-leslie love , and mused upon [[his]24-leslie home]1384-his home , [[his]24-leslie society]1743-his society , [their]1744-their position together as [dwellers under one roof]1745-dwellers under one roof , mused with the innocence of a child which hears many things , but has [no interpreter within , by which to understand them]1746-no interpreter within , by which to understand them . [She]21-elinor would have been contented with this state of things for an indefinite length of time , but [Leslie]24-leslie began to entertain some remorse as to the part [he]24-leslie was playing by [Laura]26-laura . “[627-her] [She]627-her must be told , ” [he]24-leslie said to [himself]24-leslie . “[627-her] It is due to [her]627-her generous behaviour towards [me]0-i , and [my]0-i position as [guest of [[her]627-her house]629-her house]628-guest of her house . [I]0-i will tell [her]627-her , if [nobody else]630-nobody else . ” Accordingly , one morning , when [he]24-leslie knew [her]627-her to be alone in [[her]627-her sitting‐room]1747-her sitting‐room , [he]24-leslie bade [Elinor]21-elinor make some pretence for going to [her]627-her [there]1176-there , and when [she]627-her had been in [the room]104-the room for a few minutes , [he]24-leslie also knocked at the door , and on hearing permission , went in . [Laura]26-laura rose hastily , with a look of sudden wonder , and of some other emotion which prompted [her]26-laura to get rid of [Elinor]21-elinor by all means . “[0-i] Have [you]631-you found what [you]631-you want , [dear child]632-dear child , ” [she]26-laura said ; “[631-you] there , yes , that ’s it , is not it ? ...... ” but [Leslie]24-leslie interrupted [her]26-laura . “[0-i] Nay , ” [he]24-leslie said , “[0-i] it was [I]0-i who told — begged , that is , [her]633-her to be [here]1135-here . [We]635-we want [your]633-her concurrence . ” [He]24-leslie observed , though without fixing [his]24-leslie eyes on [Laura]26-laura ’s face that there was a kind of horror in it , such as comes when an object of phantom‐like dread rises before one , and the mind refuses to believe it . [He]24-leslie immediately finished [his]24-leslie sentence . “[1196-this lady] [This lady]1196-this lady , ” [Leslie]24-leslie indicated [Elinor]21-elinor , “[1196-this lady] consents to be [[my]0-i wife]603-my wife . [I]0-i owe it to [you]1196-this lady that [you]1196-this lady should be [the first informed]638-the first informed . ” The blood forsook [Laura]26-laura ’s lips ; [her]26-laura heart it was plain had stopped , so far as a heart can stop which is to go again . The nerves relaxed , so that the strong will could hardly make instruments of them ; but [she]26-laura did force [them]1750-them to act . [She]26-laura smiled as [some one among [us]639-we]1751-some one among us may have seen [a dying man]1752-a dying man attempt to smile when the power over [his]1752-a dying man muscles was half departed ; [she]26-laura looked on both with eyes where were no tears , the conventionalities of society held them back . [Leslie]24-leslie went on speaking , without appearing to observe [her]26-laura . “[1196-this lady] And now [we]639-we shall look to [[your]1196-this lady kind offices]640-your kind offices for counsel and assistance in [our]639-we project , and for making known to [the world]1134-the world in general what [we]639-we thought it right to bring first to [the best friend of both]642-the best friend of both . ” “[482-my brother] Not yet , ” said [Laura]26-laura , speaking with a steadily , uniform voice ; “[482-my brother] [[my]0-i brother]482-my brother has so little thought of such a thing , that [he]482-my brother would , perhaps , throw obstacles in the way . ” “[482-my brother] [Obstacles]65-obstacles ! ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , carelessly . “[65-obstacles] No , not that , but [he]482-my brother might be angry with [her]644-her [I]0-i mean ; it would so disturb [him]482-my brother . ” “[482-my brother] Believe [me]0-i , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[482-my brother] [we]639-we are both willing to leave it to [you]1196-this lady to make the discovery when [you]1196-this lady like . Neither of [us]639-we shall interfere on that subject , if one way or another seems better to [you]1196-this lady . ” “[1196-this lady] It is merely [your]1196-this lady advantage [I]0-i think of , ” said [Laura]26-laura . “[1196-this lady] Of that [I]0-i am QUITE sure , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie : in order to convey some pleasant impression to [Laura]26-laura ’s mind . “[0-i] And now , ” [he]24-leslie said , “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ll leave [[my]0-i little betrothed]645-my little betrothed with [you]1196-this lady to get [some woman]646-some woman ’s talk about fringe and so on . [She]646-some woman wants [a friend]350-a friend on all matters as [you]1196-this lady well know , and [I]0-i humbly beg for one than whom [she]646-some woman could not anywhere find a better . ” [Leslie]24-leslie drew back , courteously applying [his]24-leslie compliment by a slight indication of [his]24-leslie head , and quitted [the room]104-the room , after an encouraging glance at [Elinor]21-elinor . When [he]24-leslie was gone , the agitation of the scene acted upon [Elinor]21-elinor , and [she]21-elinor could not restrain [her]21-elinor tears , while [she]21-elinor tried to possess [herself]21-elinor of [Laura]26-laura ’s hand , but [Laura]26-laura ’s efforts were exhausted ; [she]26-laura drew away [her]26-laura hand as if it had come in contact with a fester , or a nest of snakes , and forcing open the door to [[her]26-laura bed‐room]1754-her bed‐room flung it behind [her]26-laura , and fell on the floor by [her]26-laura bed , totally giddy and beside [herself]26-laura for a brief time . In [some people]1755-some people , [their]1755-some people first thought under a sudden shock is , that the thing is not ; or that it will cease to be . In the worst of [her]26-laura anguish this latter idea spread a gloomy light through the thick darkness , otherwise no strength of [hers]26-laura could have supported it . It was that which by degrees gave consistency to [her]26-laura thoughts , and upon which [her]26-laura mind as tenaciously laid hold , as [the falling man]1756-the falling man , on the bush which grows over [the edge of the precipice]1757-the edge of the precipice . [She]26-laura collected [her]26-laura senses and forced [her]26-laura mind into action , not with any view ever entertained for a moment of making the best for [herself]26-laura and [others of what had taken place]1758-others of what had taken place , but with the desperate purpose of destroying it at no matter what sacrifice . The first thing was to gain time , and this [her]26-laura instinct had already prompted [her]26-laura to do , when [she]26-laura besought [Leslie]24-leslie to keep the secret for awhile . What was to follow [she]26-laura ran over in [her]26-laura head , and sate in [[her]26-laura tranquil room]1759-her tranquil room , among all , the pretty luxuries of toilette and draperied mirror , of flaçons and flowers , leaning [her]26-laura rounded cheek on [her]26-laura hand , while the natural folds of rich silk fell around [her]26-laura figure , and all this time was brooding the project which should immolate [the innocent girl]1760-the innocent girl , and [the beloved man to the idol enshrined in [her]26-laura own person]1761-the beloved man to the idol enshrined in her own person . To this end [she]26-laura laid [her]26-laura plan , and with farsighted anticipation [she]26-laura soon after sought [[her]26-laura brother]195-her brother , and engaged [him]195-her brother by gentle degrees in a conversation on [his]195-her brother political interest , which had always a certain charm for [him]195-her brother . There was [some property at a little distance lately acquired by [him]195-her brother , where the votes of [the tenants]1764-the tenants]1763-some property at a little distance lately acquired by him , where the votes of the tenants were less [[their]1764-the tenants landlord]1765-their landlord ’s than those which had longer felt [his]195-her brother subject of discourse , and suggested the propriety of “[646-some woman] at some future time , any leisure day , ” cultivating [their]1764-the tenants acquaintance and gaining a hold on [their]1764-the tenants opinions . [[Her]26-laura brother]195-her brother assented , but complained of the tediousness of the operation . [Laura]26-laura hinted that [he]195-her brother should lighten the disgust by taking [a companion]1166-a companion ; some one , [she]26-laura said , who would do credit to the cause , and whom [he]195-her brother might recommend to [them]1764-the tenants whenever there was occasion . “[646-some woman] Why not speak out , ” said [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson ; “[646-some woman] there is one [I]0-i should be glad enough to recommend , if [you]648-you can tell [me]0-i [you]648-you wish it . ” “[0-i] Nay , [you]0-i know all [I]0-i know about [him]649-he , ” said [Laura]26-laura . “[0-i] All ? ” “[0-i] Yes , and far more than [any other human being]650-any other human being ever can know . ” “[652-the woman to be trifled with] Then [I]0-i wish it were more , for [[my]0-i dear little [Laura]26-laura]651-my dear little laura is not [the woman to be trifled with]652-the woman to be trifled with . ” “[26-laura] No , no , do n’t say such a word . [I]0-i understand [him]649-he , and so [he]649-he does [me]0-i . Only be best friends with [him]649-he , and give [him]649-he an interest among [us]653-us . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i will do anything for [you]26-laura , [sister]1529-sister , ” said [he]649-he ; “[0-i] [you]26-laura are as clever as [you]26-laura are hand‐ some , and deserve [the very best man]655-the very best man wit and money can gain . [I]0-i shall be sorry to part with [you]0-i , that is all . But if [you]0-i gain by it , [I]0-i wo n’t think of [myself]0-i . ” “[0-i] Thank [you]0-i , [Lawrence]51-lawrence , ” said [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson , and the kindness breathed over [her]29-miss chanson heart like dew upon [some burning , arid plain]1768-some burning , arid plain . The tears came to [her]29-miss chanson eyes , and [she]29-miss chanson hid them on [his]649-he shoulder . “[51-lawrence] [You]26-laura are happy , [Laura]26-laura ? ” said [he]649-he , inquiringly ; “[51-lawrence] [you]26-laura are satisfied ? ” “[26-laura] Yes , ” said [Laura]26-laura ; “[26-laura] oh , yes , [I]0-i am . ” It was very hard to form those words , but [she]26-laura succeeded . [She]26-laura had provided in this manœuvre for securing the absence of [Leslie]24-leslie whenever [her]26-laura plans should require such a movement to work out the present details . [She]26-laura had only [[her]26-laura cousin]1554-her cousin [Peter]56-sir peter to help [her]26-laura , and in the late circumstances of apparent estrangement between [Leslie]24-leslie and [Elinor]21-elinor , [he]649-he had been laid aside as not wanted . Now , however , [he]649-he was [her]26-laura chief hope ; and the day of [his]649-he departure drawing very near , what [he]649-he had to do must be done without delay . “[56-sir peter] [Peter]56-sir peter , ” [she]26-laura said , “[56-sir peter] [we]656-we are all going to walk after luncheon . Now [that little flirt]657-that little flirt will enjoy a tête‐à‐tête with [you]56-sir peter . [I]0-i really think [she]657-that little flirt begins to get an appetite for it . ” “[657-that little flirt] Do [you]0-i think so , ” said [[her]26-laura cousin]1554-her cousin ; “[0-i] well [she]657-that little flirt shows it in an odd way . How uncommonly silent [she]657-that little flirt is , except to [Leslie]24-leslie . ” “[657-that little flirt] Oh ! [she]657-that little flirt torments [him]24-leslie to death , ” said [Laura]26-laura , “[24-leslie] [he]24-leslie was saying to [me]0-i this morning that [he]24-leslie wished — wished — that is ...... ” “[26-laura] What , [Laura]26-laura ? ” “[24-leslie] [He]24-leslie came , [Peter]56-sir peter , to [[my]0-i room]448-my room to speak to [me]0-i ; and [she]657-that little flirt was [there]1176-there , and would not go away . ” “[657-that little flirt] [[My]0-i dear]1127-my dear [Laura]26-laura ! ” “[26-laura] No , no , nonsense ; [I]0-i do n’t know what [he]24-leslie had to say , but with [her]657-that little flirt in [the room]104-the room , and so determined to stay ...... ” “[26-laura] Yes , yes ; but during the walk this afternoon there may be a better opportunity . Well , [cousin Laura]26-laura , [you]26-laura know it will break [my]0-i heart , but [I]0-i devote [myself]0-i , [I]0-i cover [my]0-i head with a white mantle , and stretch out [my]0-i hands to [the infernal gods]662-the infernal gods . ” “[0-i] What nonsense [you]0-i talk , dear [Peter]56-sir peter . ” “[0-i] Shall [we]663-we take a gentle walk in [the woods]1421-the woods ? ” said [Laura]26-laura , to the party after luncheon , “[0-i] the autumn colours are growing beautiful , and the day is neither too hot nor cold . ” [Everybody]1226-everybody agreed , and [they]1226-everybody assembled gradually under [the portico]1772-the portico , as [they]1226-everybody were ready , previous to the start . [Leslie]24-leslie had gently driven [Laura]26-laura into a corner , and in the fulness of contentment with [himself]24-leslie and [others]266-others , was asking questions sufficiently embarrassing . “[0-i] Have [you]0-i taught [her]665-her , [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson , how to cut out cloaks and gowns ; and what to do with [a housekeeper]666-a housekeeper ? ” [Laura]26-laura commanded [her]26-laura voice , and made some trifling answer . “[0-i] [You]0-i know it is to [you]0-i only [I]0-i can talk on the subject , ” [Leslie]24-leslie went on ; “[0-i] in the first place , [I]0-i have no mind to let [everybody]1226-everybody into [my]0-i affairs , and in the next , [you]0-i bid [me]0-i be silent for the present . ” “[0-i] Oh yes ! be silent , ” said [Laura]26-laura , “[0-i] [I]0-i have more reasons than one for that request . Pray say nothing yet . ” “[0-i] That [you]0-i command [me]0-i is sufficient reason , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , who felt that [he]24-leslie owed [her]26-laura some reparation . “[0-i] [You]0-i [yourself]0-i , perhaps , may find reason to thank [me]0-i , ” said [Laura]26-laura . “[0-i] Nay , [I]0-i thank [you]0-i already . The one point being gained , of security in the regard of [that little lady]668-that little lady , [I]0-i am grateful for every evidence of interest in either [her]668-that little lady , or [me]0-i . ” “[272-people] How happy [you]0-i are in a confiding , honest nature , ” said [Laura]26-laura . “[0-i] [People]272-people always despise those whom [they]272-people call confiding ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , “[272-people] and [those despised persons]670-those despised persons always presume on [their]670-those despised persons own particular clear‐sightedness , and say [others]266-others may be taken in , but as for [them]266-others it is impossible . ” “[0-i] Heaven forbid , that it should happen to [you]0-i ! ” said [Laura]26-laura , then hastily went on . “[0-i] [You]0-i talk so loftily about despising , and being despised , like one who knows there is no such word for [him]672-him ; but come , [the party]1575-the party is all assembled now [I]0-i think . ” [She]26-laura moved a step forward , and so did [Leslie]24-leslie , and saw that [Elinor]21-elinor was standing just within the door , and that [the officious Sir Peter]56-sir peter had offered [her]21-elinor [his]56-sir peter arm for the walk . [Laura]26-laura eagerly watching also , perceived that [Elinor]21-elinor lifted [her]21-elinor eyes to [Leslie]24-leslie , and that a slight glance of intelligence passed between [them]1774-them , after which [Elinor]21-elinor demurely took the offered arm , and proceeded with [Sir Peter]56-sir peter . That look wrenched the dagger round in [Laura]26-laura ’s heart ; it was the thing which [her]26-laura imagination had represented as most intolerable , the familiar token which both understood , and from which all others were shut out ; [her]26-laura insidious words had fallen useless , and now , friendly as [Leslie]24-leslie might be , faithfully as [he]56-sir peter kept by [her]26-laura side , [he]56-sir peter did but confirm [her]26-laura anguish by a behaviour which was so friendly , merely because [he]56-sir peter had made [her]26-laura the confidant of [his]56-sir peter successful love for another . [She]26-laura could not play out [her]26-laura part to the end to‐day . [She]26-laura was obliged to complain of a headache before the walk was over , and sank into silence , which this excuse justified , and which with [her]26-laura throbbing head and dry lips , it was impossible for [her]26-laura to avoid . When [they]1774-them reached [home]139-home again , [she]26-laura went straight to [[her]26-laura room]1295-her room , and appeared no more , accepting [Elinor]21-elinor ’s timid offers of service , in order to keep [her]26-laura away from [the society of [Leslie]24-leslie]1777-the society of leslie . For a time [she]26-laura preserved the impenetrable silence which [her]26-laura feelings dictated and which [Elinor]21-elinor , frightened at the repulses [she]26-laura met , shrank into [herself]26-laura to observe ; but at last , as [she]26-laura slowly won self‐command , [she]26-laura resolved to employ the time in preparing the ground for the scheme before [her]26-laura , and however odious to [herself]26-laura to enter into conversation with [the happy young girl]1778-the happy young girl . “[1575-the party] How was this all arranged , [dear]1133-dear ? ” [she]26-laura began , in an invalid tone , “[1575-the party] tell [me]0-i about it . ” [Elinor]21-elinor was as little inclined as [she]21-elinor to pour out confidences , but [she]21-elinor hesitated not to answer . “[1575-the party] [I]0-i was afraid [he]675-he was angry , ” [she]21-elinor began ...... “[0-i] Well , ” said [Laura]26-laura , impatiently . “[0-i] [I]0-i was afraid [he]675-he was unhappy , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[675-he] What do [you]0-i mean ? ” again said [Laura]26-laura , hastily . “[0-i] [He]675-he seemed angry . ” “[675-he] Oh ! nonsense — what stuff — what made [him]675-he angry ? ” “[676-your cousin] [[Your]0-i cousin]676-your cousin ...... ” [Elinor]21-elinor began , but was glad to be interrupted by [her]0-i imperious sympathizer . “[0-i] By the by , [I]0-i wanted to speak about [Peter]56-sir peter ; [he]56-sir peter is [a very young man]1431-a very young man , and [you]0-i must not make mischief . [You]0-i have been talking a great deal with [him]56-sir peter , [you]0-i know that surely ; and flirting , [the world]1134-the world would say , and now that [another man]679-another man is going to marry [you]0-i , [that man]680-that man may take fancies against [Peter]56-sir peter ; [you]0-i must say nothing against [Peter]56-sir peter , that ’s the only reparation [you]0-i can make . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i have never ...... ” “[0-i] Yes , [you]0-i have — never mind that . Have [you]0-i talked to [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie about that time when [you]0-i stayed at [home]139-home on account of a bad headache [you]0-i had , and then walked to [the stone quarry]594-the stone quarry ? ” “[24-leslie] Had [I]0-i a bad headache ? ” “[24-leslie] Yes , of course , [you]0-i ca n’t forget that . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t think ...... ” “[0-i] Yes , very bad , [you]0-i did not drive with [me]0-i to [the glen]1674-the glen on account of it . ” [Elinor]21-elinor was silent . “[0-i] Have [you]0-i talked to [him]56-sir peter about it ? [I]0-i say . ” “[0-i] No . ” “[0-i] Oh ! that ’s very well , then do not . [I]0-i know that [you]0-i and [Peter]56-sir peter went together . ” “[0-i] No ...... [he]56-sir peter ...... ” “[56-sir peter] Well , came back together , from [the stone quarry]594-the stone quarry , and if [you]0-i were to make a long story about it to [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie , there is no knowing what might happen . It was foolish , perhaps thoughtless that is , in [[my]0-i dear cousin]685-my dear cousin , but merely that , scarcely that ; and [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie is so proud , [he]24-leslie might take the greatest offence , [he]24-leslie might shoot [him]56-sir peter dead , [[my]0-i poor cousin]686-my poor cousin . ” “[56-sir peter] Might [he]56-sir peter really ? ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[56-sir peter] So promise [me]0-i one thing , never to say one word about that walk — now promise . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i never will , if [I]0-i can help it . ” “[56-sir peter] Oh ! [you]0-i can help it of course . Promise . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i promise , as far as [I]0-i can , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[0-i] Can ! ridiculous ! however , that will do , and now pray let [me]0-i be quiet . [I]0-i really can not talk any more , [my]0-i poor head in such a state . ” And now putting [her]0-i hand to [her]0-i head , [she]0-i leaned it down against the back of [her]0-i easy chair , and there in anything but ease , [she]0-i acted [the motionless invalid]1779-the motionless invalid , in which character [she]0-i could escape further conversation , yet retain [the young girl]107-the young girl as [nurse]1781-nurse , and watch in [[her]0-i room]1295-her room . This lasted till bed time , and a severe trial it was . When at last [she]0-i had dismissed [Elinor]21-elinor , with severe directions to go at once to [[her]0-i chamber]1783-her chamber , and had got rid of the importunate services of [[her]0-i maid]1784-her maid , [she]0-i was at liberty to start up , and walking through [[her]0-i room]1295-her room , to give vent to the bodily expressions of the tempest in [her]0-i mind . The one fixed purpose was that the marriage of [Elinor]21-elinor and [Leslie]24-leslie should be prevented . [She]0-i had ceased to justify that purpose to [herself]0-i , and had reached the point when the right or wrong was cast aside , and the end only , kept resolutely in view . When all [the house]152-the house was quiet , when [[her]0-i brother]195-her brother had come , and tenderly stroked [her]0-i hair , asking how [his]195-her brother little [Laura]26-laura did now ; when [he]195-her brother was gone , carefully closing the door without noise behind [him]195-her brother , [Laura]26-laura unlocked [her]26-laura desk , pressed the spring of the secret drawer within , and took out a slip of written paper , poor [Elinor]21-elinor ’s note to [Leslie]24-leslie , which had fallen on the ground the night of [their]1788-their interview in [the wood]1169-the wood . And there in the early hours , between night and morning , when [she]26-laura ought to have been stretched in maiden slumber on [her]26-laura bed , when [she]26-laura ought to have been profiting by the safety and the indulgence of [her]26-laura prosperous position , [Laura]26-laura sat cold and weary , yet absorbed from such feelings , patiently effacing by the smallest advances one letter after another from the harmless billet , in order to replace them by others which should carry condemnation to [the guiltless writer]1790-the guiltless writer . [[Her]26-laura brother]195-her brother ’s name was the word [she]26-laura rubbed out ; and then with a pen , prepared with the most delicate touches of the knife , and tried twenty times before it suited [her]26-laura , [Leslie]24-leslie ’s was the one [she]26-laura put in . Now it stood — “[0-i] [I]0-i can not come to‐night . [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie forbids [me]0-i to go out.—ELINOR [LADYLIFT]21-elinor . ” This note thus altered , [she]26-laura purposed to convey to [Sir Peter]56-sir peter as coming from [Elinor]21-elinor , and from [him]56-sir peter it should pass either by [Sir Peter]56-sir peter , or by [Laura]26-laura [herself]26-laura to [Leslie]24-leslie , whom [she]26-laura trusted it would persuade of [Elinor]21-elinor ’s falsity , and by so doing wrench two hearts asunder . There were chances of an explanation between [them]1792-them , and that [Laura]26-laura saw with fearful distinctness ; should it take place , [her]26-laura plot was ruined , and [she]26-laura [herself]26-laura with it — where should [she]26-laura be then ? “[687-despised] Hated , [despised]687-despised ! ” [she]0-i cried to [herself]0-i ; “[687-despised] for ever parted from [him]688-him . But so [I]0-i am now . Can it be worse than to see [her]688-him in [[my]0-i place]689-my place . Oh ! nothing is worse . [Death]66-death were most dear in comparison ...... ” and as [she]0-i said so , tears of self‐compassion broke from [her]0-i eyes , and [she]0-i laid [her]0-i head on [her]0-i arms and wept . Presently [she]0-i rose from this position , and letting [her]0-i dressing‐gown fall from [her]0-i shoulders , put one knee on [her]0-i luxurious bed , and laid [herself]0-i down beneath the fine woollen , fine linen of the bed clothes . “[66-death] Alas ! ” [she]0-i said to [herself]0-i , “[66-death] if the felicity which [I]0-i labour through all obstacles to attain were [mine]0-i by the gracious course of fortune and fate , how good [I]0-i could be , how kind to [others]266-others , how grateful [myself]0-i ! ” THE next morning , after breakfast , [Leslie]24-leslie contrived to say to [Elinor]21-elinor , that [he]691-your affianced husband had been unjustly deprived of [her]29-miss chanson society the previous evening , and that [she]29-miss chanson must come out and walk with [him]691-your affianced husband . “[29-miss chanson] [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson can say nothing against it , ” [he]691-your affianced husband added ; “[29-miss chanson] for [you]29-miss chanson need only answer [her]29-miss chanson that [you]29-miss chanson are going with [[your]29-miss chanson affianced husband]691-your affianced husband , and [[her]29-miss chanson brother]195-her brother wo n’t think of [us]693-we one way or the other . ” “[195-her brother] Besides , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , “[195-her brother] [he]195-her brother will be at [the stable]176-the stable for the next half hour , and [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson will have [the housekeeper]695-the housekeeper almost directly . [I]0-i can come down [the turret stair]696-the turret stair and out by [the great Datura]697-the great datura . ” “[0-i] [We]693-we are doing all [we]693-we can to spoil the most guileless nature in [the world]1134-the world , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie to [himself]24-leslie ; “[29-miss chanson] when [she]29-miss chanson came [here]1135-here , [such a woman]700-such a woman ’s calculation as that was out of the reach of [her]29-miss chanson imagination . Well , well , [she]29-miss chanson is a creature of whom [I]0-i am most unworthy , be [she]29-miss chanson spoiled a little or not . ” In about a quarter of an hour [Elinor]21-elinor did as [she]29-miss chanson had proposed and joined [him]24-leslie in [the garden]146-the garden , and then seizing [her]29-miss chanson hand [he]24-leslie led [her]29-miss chanson into [the park]1299-the park and out thence to [the fields]1480-the fields , and soon [they]1796-they were quite away from [all frequented track]1797-all frequented track . It was an autumn day , the heavy mists were golden with the sun which was vigorously dispelling them from [the valleys]1798-the valleys and [brook courses]1799-brook courses , and lifting them up all gorgeously from [the glowing earth]1800-the glowing earth . The red berries of the wild convolvulus hung in long festoons upon the hedges , and its yellow leaves shone like pale gold in the sun . The wild cherry trees were glowing with bright red , the birch all amber ; the ferns dressed the hill sides with their rich shapes and colours , and [the hills]1801-the hills drew nearer than usual , with [every white house]1802-every white house and spire distinct on their intense blue . A fragrance of vegetation came and went on the breeze ; perhaps it was the breath of dying Nature , but it pleased the lungs with its exciting draught . “[0-i] [I]0-i feel [my]0-i heart beating ” said [Elinor]21-elinor ; “[0-i] at seeing everything so beautiful . Why does it beat ? ” “[0-i] Because everything is so beautiful , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , smiling . “[701-you] And [you]701-you told [me]0-i [I]0-i might enjoy the pleasure , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[701-you] Yes , it is fitted to give enjoyment . It is innocent ; [you]701-you feel no regret afterwards . ” “[701-you] No , [I]0-i do n’t , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor ; “[0-i] but [I]0-i should have done so in [[my]0-i convent]702-my convent , because [I]0-i was taught to fear the things [I]0-i liked . It was [you]701-you who taught [me]0-i differently . ” “[701-you] Yes ; but at all events do whatever [you]701-you think is right , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . “[701-you] [I]0-i only meant to say that whatever is good and pleasant [you]701-you may do . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i think ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , “[0-i] that walking through [this autumn country]703-this autumn country , and [my]0-i hand held by [yours]701-you is both . ” “[0-i] Both , both , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[0-i] and it will soon be [our]704-our right for ever . [We]704-our shall be never parted , [Elinor]21-elinor ; never , not at all , together always , and it will be right to be so ; do [you]701-you understand ? ” “[701-you] Yes , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , [her]21-elinor calm , maidenly face looking straight forward ; “[701-you] there will be [no stranger]705-no stranger to interrupt [our]704-our talk , no necessity to ask [anybody]262-anybody ’s leave to walk with [you]701-you . [I]0-i may sit in [the room where [you]701-you write , and work without talking]707-the room where you write , and work without talking ; when [you]701-you like , [I]0-i may sing what [you]701-you only like ; if [you]701-you are tired [you]701-you can sleep without caring whether [I]0-i am there or not , and [I]0-i shall be there watching that neither the sun nor the flies disturb [you]701-you . [I]0-i have been thinking of all those things . ” [Leslie]24-leslie was silent . It was a new , strange pleasure to hear the meditations of that innocent heart . [He]24-leslie believed at that hour what [so very few men]1803-so very few men have the enjoyment of believing , the purity and guilelessness there can be , and is , in [many young girls]1804-many young girls . [His]24-leslie pleasure was like that of [a man who gets sight of an unsunned treasure , which the earthly air and light [he]24-leslie lets in will soon crumble away]1805-a man who gets sight of an unsunned treasure , which the earthly air and light he lets in will soon crumble away ; but which is there and has been there in perfection , for all the time before [he]24-leslie discovered it . The loveliness of the day , the accidents of the scene gave scope to the easy happiness [they]1806-they were enjoying . It grew hot , and [Elinor]21-elinor untied [her]21-elinor bonnet in the shade , and [Leslie]24-leslie took it from [her]21-elinor to carry , maltreating the ribbons as [he]24-leslie talked and walked , and then laughing with [Elinor]21-elinor at [his]24-leslie male ignorance of [their]1806-they nature and wants . [They]1806-they came to a steep slope , and beginning to move quicker and quicker down it , ended by running at the top of [Elinor]21-elinor ’s speed , so that laughing , and the blood mounting in [her]21-elinor cool cheek , [she]21-elinor came to the bottom holding tight by [Leslie]24-leslie ’s arm , while [he]24-leslie kept [her]21-elinor safely on [her]21-elinor feet , and laughed with [her]21-elinor at nothing but [their]1806-they own spirits , and [their]1806-they own active frames . There , as [they]1806-they coasted along a high bank with an irregular hedge on the crest , [Elinor]21-elinor ’s eye was caught by something hounding about in the fern , and in a moment [they]1806-they saw it was a leveret which seemed at play so near [them]1806-they . [Elinor]21-elinor paused to look , but [Leslie]24-leslie saw how it was , and said it was caught in a noose , and the string was tightening round its neck . “[0-i] Oh ! how cruel , how wicked ! ” said [Elinor]21-elinor ; “[0-i] who could ! loose it do , pray . ” [Leslie]24-leslie , to obey [Elinor]21-elinor , went up [the bank]1255-the bank and tried to lay hold of the leveret , which , half dead as it was , still sprang about to avoid [him]24-leslie . “[0-i] It will die , ” cried [Elinor]21-elinor , the tears almost running over ; “[0-i] oh ! do catch it , ” and [she]21-elinor also scrambled up , and helped [Leslie]24-leslie to try to lay hold of it . At last [they]1806-they succeeded . Then [Leslie]24-leslie , with one hand upon the suffocated little beast , searched [his]24-leslie waistcoat pocket for a knife , and gave it to [Elinor]21-elinor to open , and to insinuate it between the leveret ’s neck and the string in order to set it free . [He]24-leslie watched [her]21-elinor earnest face , all given over to pity and interest ; [her]21-elinor fear to give pain , [her]21-elinor resolution to venture it , [her]21-elinor disgust at suffering inflicted ; and [she]21-elinor , thinking of nothing but the leveret , most delicately , most skilfully got in the knife , and drawing the sharp edge across the string released it . The poor leveret , under the sudden revulsion of blood to its natural course , lost all active power , and lay motionless . “[0-i] [Poor brute]708-poor brute , it ’s all over , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , putting it on the grass ; but [Elinor]21-elinor was not so indifferent . [She]21-elinor raised its head upon a little tussock , stroked it gently , pitied it , while [[her]21-elinor lover]484-her lover stood by smiling at the pretty picture ; and at last the leveret began to move , and [Elinor]21-elinor was relieved and delighted . “[708-poor brute] Oh ! [I]0-i ’ll carry [it]708-poor brute [home]139-home , ” [she]0-i said , breaking off a great burdock leaf , and placing the little body upon it ; then carefully set it on [her]21-elinor arms , and [Leslie]24-leslie held [her]21-elinor by the elbow , to get [her]21-elinor safely down [the bank]1255-the bank . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ll get what [they]710-they call a whisket for it , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , pleased like [a fresh child with the imaginary details of the leveret]1810-a fresh child with the imaginary details of the leveret ’s life ; “[710-they] and keep it in [[my]0-i room]448-my room , and give it leaves . What does it like best ? ” “[0-i] Flowers , [I]0-i think , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[0-i] any fresh , tender annuals out of [the garden]146-the garden . It will eat up the verbenas with the greatest pleasure . ” “[0-i] Do [you]0-i think [you]0-i can get some ? ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[0-i] Oh yes , every morning ; but [I]0-i must take care [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson does not see [me]0-i . ” “[29-miss chanson] Oh ! [you]0-i must not hurt [[her]29-miss chanson garden]713-her garden . ” “[29-miss chanson] Well , well ; [we]714-we will take the hare away with [us]714-we , when [you]0-i and [I]0-i go away [ourselves]714-we , and it shall have all the flowers at [the Tower]16-the tower to [itself]715-itself , if [you]0-i like . ” [Elinor]21-elinor looked at [Leslie]24-leslie , and smiled . “[0-i] Yes , thank [you]0-i ; it shall live on [the eastern terrace [you]0-i told [me]0-i of]716-the eastern terrace you told me of , and have [a wooden house of some kind to go into at night]717-a wooden house of some kind to go into at night . ” “[0-i] That will be [the very place]718-the very place , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . At this moment the leveret , which had recovered its senses , but kept the recovery to itself watching [its]715-itself opportunity , made so sudden a spring , that before [Elinor]21-elinor could utter the little cry its movement provoked , it was out of [her]21-elinor arms , and scudding away to [the copse]1811-the copse . “[0-i] Oh dear ! ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , looking at [her]21-elinor empty leaf . [Leslie]24-leslie laughed . “[0-i] Never mind , [I]0-i can have [your]0-i hand again ; so all is for the best , ” said [he]24-leslie . And thus [they]1812-they walked , by the hedgerow sides of [the corn fields]1813-the corn fields , across banky meadows cropped by sheep , along [woodland paths]1814-woodland paths , which descended to [the brook courses]1815-the brook courses ; where [they]1812-they were crossed by gray large stepping‐stones ; within the edges of the wood , where with trees for a natural colonnade , [they]1812-they looked out upon [the silent , sunny country]1816-the silent , sunny country ; hand in hand [they]1812-they walked , healthy , beautiful , good . It was [Adam]67-adam and [Eve]68-eve moving through [the Garden of Eden]1817-the garden of eden . [They]1812-they had scarcely met [a human being]1252-a human being , [the country]318-the country was thinly inhabited , and [they]1812-they had unconsciously sought [the least frequented parts]1820-the least frequented parts ; but some hours after [they]1812-they first began [their]1812-they walk , [the forest]1821-the forest silence was disturbed by a distant voice , uttering a loud “[0-i] mark ! ” and then was fired a gun as distant , and before long both sounds came nearer ; nay , [they]1812-they presently saw [a towering pheasant hit by the discharge from the loud gun , and tumbling over and over in the air , fall with hanging wings , and dropped head]1822-a towering pheasant hit by the discharge from the loud gun , and tumbling over and over in the air , fall with hanging wings , and dropped head , out of sight in the underwood . The next moment , [Sir Peter Bicester]56-sir peter , and [a gamekeeper]1823-a gamekeeper , and [couple of beaters]1824-couple of beaters came in view ; [he]56-sir peter immediately left off [his]56-sir peter pursuit , and came up to [Elinor]21-elinor , hoping [he]56-sir peter had not frightened [her]21-elinor , and so on . [Leslie]24-leslie had dropped [Elinor]21-elinor ’s hand ; till [she]21-elinor was declared [[his]56-sir peter promised wife]1825-his promised wife , [he]56-sir peter did not wish to claim any intimacy with [her]21-elinor ; but [Elinor]21-elinor was unconscious of such scruples , and replied in the simplest way to [the young man]191-the young man ’s apologies . “[0-i] But [we]719-we are going [home]139-home now , ” [she]0-i said , “[721-you] so do not stop [your]721-you amusement for [me]0-i . Thank [you]721-you for thinking of it . ” And [she]0-i moved on . “[721-you] Sha n’t [you]721-you come out , [Leslie]24-leslie ? ” said [Sir Peter]56-sir peter . “[24-leslie] No , not [I]0-i ; if there ’s anything better to do , [I]0-i do n’t care for a gun . ” “[0-i] And there is something it seems , ” said [Sir Peter]56-sir peter . “[0-i] Well ! that is as it may be , ” answered [Leslie]24-leslie , and followed [Elinor]21-elinor , whom [he]191-the young man speedily overtook . THAT evening , [Sir Peter]56-sir peter knocked at the door of [[[his]56-sir peter cousin]1539-his cousin ’s sitting‐room]1828-his cousin ’s sitting‐room , when [he]56-sir peter came in an hour before dinner . “[0-i] Have [you]722-you got some tea , [Laura]26-laura ? ” [he]56-sir peter asked ; “[0-i] let [me]0-i have a cup with [you]722-you , if [you]722-you are going to have any . ” “[0-i] Come in , come in ! ” said [Laura]26-laura , ringing the bell at the same time , and ordering tea for [him]56-sir peter and [her]26-laura . “[0-i] Well , what have [you]722-you shot ? ” “[722-you] Six pheasants , and a woodcock , ” said [Sir Peter]56-sir peter ; “[722-you] [I]0-i just went into that outside cover , [you]722-you know , below [the lime kiln]723-the lime kiln . ” “[0-i] And quite enough , ” said [Laura]26-laura , “[0-i] for a distant part , scarcely preserved . ” “[0-i] Yes , it is a good way off , ” said [Sir Peter]56-sir peter ; “[0-i] and do [you]722-you know , [Leslie]24-leslie had taken [your]722-you ward walking all that way . ” “[24-leslie] [He]24-leslie had ? ” “[24-leslie] Yes , and [they]724-they looked as like [real lovers]725-real lovers as ever [you]722-you saw [any two people]726-any two people . Now , [Laura]26-laura , [I]0-i want [you]26-laura to answer [me]0-i one question ; are [you]26-laura quite certain there is nothing between [them]724-they , quite certain ? Because if there is , [I]0-i would not put [myself]0-i in [their]724-they way for the generalship of [the Indian army]727-the indian army — no , not to be made [knight banneret on the field of battle]728-knight banneret on the field of battle . ” “[0-i] Have not [I]0-i told [you]722-you , ” said [Laura]26-laura , “[0-i] how matters stand . ” “[24-leslie] Yes ; but [he]24-leslie may be [a fool]729-a fool , and [he]24-leslie may have taken up with [the little idiot]730-the little idiot ; and if [the flirting]731-the flirting is not on [her]730-the little idiot side , [I]0-i will have nothing to do with making [her]730-the little idiot break [her]730-the little idiot little heart . ” “[730-the little idiot] It is all , all on [her]730-the little idiot side ; but for [her]730-the little idiot intrigues [I]0-i should be happy — and [I]0-i can be happy — [I]0-i am ; what is [that man]680-that man to [me]0-i ? ” “[680-that man] Nothing , [Laura]26-laura ; that ’s right , do n’t throw away a thought upon [him]680-that man , if [he]680-that man has been such [an ass]733-an ass . ” “[680-that man] But [he]680-that man has not ! ” said [Laura]26-laura , struggling mentally against the doom , as [one]1228-one does bodily against the great weight that is pressing the lungs together , so as to stop breath . “[680-that man] It is merely that [a child]110-a child is artful enough to deceive [him]680-that man , is thoughtless enough to hazard [her]110-a child own character , and ruins [my]0-i peace . ” “[110-a child] Nay , if it is so ...... ” “[0-i] [I]0-i tell [you]0-i it is . ” “[0-i] Swear ! ” said [Sir Peter]56-sir peter , crossing the forefingers of [his]56-sir peter two hands , playfully , yet in [his]56-sir peter heart looking seriously to such an appeal as safe to procure [him]56-sir peter the truth . [Laura]26-laura did not think nor hesitate for a moment . [She]26-laura laid [her]26-laura hand on [his]56-sir peter crossed fingers — “[0-i] [I]0-i swear ! ” [she]26-laura said . [She]26-laura hated [[her]26-laura cousin]1554-her cousin for making [her]26-laura do this , but [she]26-laura had no doubt , nevertheless , about doing it . “[0-i] Very well , then , [I]0-i will serve [you]0-i loyally and zealously to the extent of [my]0-i power , and that extent is limited , for [I]0-i must go on Thursday . ” “[0-i] Yes , yes , go on Thursday , ” said [Laura]26-laura , “[0-i] and before that time , let [Leslie]24-leslie merely see whether or not [her]735-her pretended passion for [him]24-leslie is true , only let [her]735-her show [herself]735-her in [her]735-her true colours , that is all [I]0-i ask . ” “[735-her] As how ? ” “[735-her] Well , if [she]735-her appoints [you]0-i to meet [her]735-her ? If [she]735-her tampers with [you]0-i , as [she]735-her does with [Leslie]24-leslie ? ” “[735-her] Oh ! in that case . ” “[735-her] [You]0-i will let [him]24-leslie know it ? ” “[0-i] No , [I]0-i shall not tell [him]24-leslie — that ’s quite impossible . ” “[24-leslie] [He]24-leslie can find it out then , ” said [Laura]26-laura . “[24-leslie] It would be better for [him]24-leslie if [he]24-leslie did ; would lose a trifle and gain a treasure . Oh ! [Laura]26-laura , [I]0-i wish [I]0-i were but older , wiser , or of more value in [the world]1134-the world , [I]0-i would fling [myself]0-i at [your]26-laura feet , though [Crœsus]69-crœsus and [Lycurgus]70-lycurgus were in the way . ” “[70-lycurgus] And [I]0-i would not have [you]26-laura , ” said [Laura]26-laura , peevishly , then correcting [herself]26-laura , [she]26-laura added , “[0-i] what a hoary pair to offer to [a young lady]737-a young lady ; [you]26-laura would have a much better chance [[my]0-i Pet]738-my pet . ” [Sir Peter]56-sir peter went on talking nonsense , which [he]56-sir peter much preferred to plotting against [Elinor]21-elinor , for of that employment [he]56-sir peter was getting rather tired , and [Laura]26-laura was afraid to weary [him]56-sir peter entirely of the subject , for upon [his]56-sir peter co‐operation all [her]26-laura remaining hopes depended . [She]26-laura therefore treated the subject as lightly as [she]26-laura could , only insisting on some display of despair on [his]56-sir peter part at [his]56-sir peter approaching separation from [Elinor]21-elinor , and contriving to amuse [him]56-sir peter with details , each of which [she]26-laura hoped would be a blow against the security in which [she]26-laura saw that [Leslie]24-leslie was fortified . [She]26-laura [herself]26-laura conducted the assault this evening . [Leslie]24-leslie gave [her]26-laura occasion ; [he]24-leslie told [her]26-laura that [he]24-leslie must very soon announce to [[her]26-laura brother]195-her brother the engagement into which [[his]24-leslie ward]1832-his ward had entered ; and [Laura]26-laura , now thoroughly on [her]26-laura guard assented , proposing that the end of the week should be the time chosen . [Leslie]24-leslie agreed , and [Laura]26-laura had gained one point , for did not the Thursday of [Sir Peter]56-sir peter ’s departure come between ? “[0-i] [I]0-i shall be glad when [he]739-he is gone for [your]740-your sake , ” said [Laura]26-laura to [Leslie]24-leslie . “[0-i] Why so ? ” “[0-i] Nay , [I]0-i think [you]740-your deserve all the walks and talks and little appointments to [yourself]740-your . ” “[71-king pericles] Oh , [I]0-i am not uneasy about that , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[71-king pericles] such fancies trouble [me]0-i not . As [King Pericles]71-king pericles says , ‘ Falseness can not dwell in [thee]741-thee ! ’ ” “[71-king pericles] Falseness in [me]0-i ? ” said [Laura]26-laura , startled . “[71-king pericles] In [her]742-her , [I]0-i ought to have said , but [I]0-i was too conscientious to misquote [Shakespeare]72-shakespeare . Oh ! no , that trouble is quite over . ” “[742-her] Then why did [she]742-her and [[my]0-i cousin]562-my cousin find [themselves]744-themselves at [the stone quarry]594-the stone quarry that day [she]742-her had the sudden headache , and could not drive with [us]744-themselves ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m sure [I]0-i do n’t know , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[0-i] the best way would be to ask [her]742-her . ” “[0-i] Do , if [you]0-i think the truth so easy to be had . ” “[0-i] Only [I]0-i do n’t care to know , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . “[0-i] Oh ! very well . [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i do n’t , ” said [Laura]26-laura . [She]26-laura turned away , and proposed music to [one of [the party]1575-the party]1833-one of the party , but [her]26-laura eyes did not fail to observe that [Leslie]24-leslie took advantage of the opportunity to stand talking with [Elinor]21-elinor at the open window , and [she]26-laura persuaded [herself]26-laura was asking the explanation [she]26-laura intended [him]24-leslie to seek . There was some little pre‐occupation in [his]24-leslie way of carrying on the beginning of the conversation , a shade of embarrassment , and a questioning air . [Elinor]21-elinor coloured deeply , and hesitated to answer [him]24-leslie , and [Laura]26-laura believed that the headache which [she]26-laura [herself]26-laura had ordered [Elinor]21-elinor to remember , and the silence which [she]26-laura [herself]26-laura had ordered [Elinor]21-elinor to keep about [the stone quarry walk]1835-the stone quarry walk , were throwing the appearance of double‐dealing over [the entangled girl]1836-the entangled girl . [Leslie]24-leslie ’s fond look at last [she]26-laura could not so well interpret . [She]26-laura did not think [he]746-he was satisfied with respect to the walk , yet “[0-i] perhaps ” ( thought [she]26-laura ) , “[746-he] [he]746-he believes [a woman]1161-a woman can not speak the truth , and forgives [her]1161-a woman — forgives [her]1161-a woman ; yes , but [he]746-he would not forgive [me]0-i . ” [Laura]26-laura was not much out in [her]26-laura interpretation of [Leslie]24-leslie ’s looks ; in fact , [he]746-he was disposed to believe and to excuse in [Elinor]21-elinor , the manœuvres which [he]746-he fancied [the inexperienced young girl]1837-the inexperienced young girl had been led to practise before [her]21-elinor present engagement with [him]746-he ; but at all events , as things were now , [he]746-he determined to put a stop to all proceedings of the kind , and would fain have warned and set [Elinor]21-elinor on [her]21-elinor guard , as [[her]21-elinor mother]545-her mother would have done , had [she]21-elinor ever known [[her]21-elinor mother]545-her mother . “[746-he] [Nobody]1225-nobody may interrupt [me]0-i now , ” [he]746-he said , “[1225-nobody] in the happiness of such walks as [we]749-we had yesterday . [Nobody]1225-nobody has any claim on [you]751-you now , when [I]0-i claim [you]751-you . [You]751-you have given [me]0-i that right , remember . ” “[37-mr. chanson] [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson said [I]0-i must go with [him]37-mr. chanson to see [his]37-mr. chanson greyhounds fed , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor ; “[37-mr. chanson] but [I]0-i will not . ” “[37-mr. chanson] Oh ! [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson . Yes , [you]0-i may go with [him]37-mr. chanson . ” “[29-miss chanson] [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson also said [I]0-i was to carry the hymn books to [the school]752-the school . [She]29-miss chanson wants to show [me]0-i how to teach [them]753-them to sing . [I]0-i will tell [her]29-miss chanson [I]0-i can not do it . ” “[29-miss chanson] No , no ; [you]0-i must do what [she]29-miss chanson asks till [you]0-i leave [her]29-miss chanson altogether . ” “[29-miss chanson] But [you]0-i said [I]0-i was to walk with [you]0-i only . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i mean it is not fit for [a young girl]754-a young girl to let [an idle young man like Bicester]755-an idle young man like bicester , meet and follow [her]29-miss chanson . ” “[0-i] So [[my]0-i Reverend Mother]756-my reverend mother told [me]0-i , and [I]0-i did not , till [you]0-i laughed , and made [me]0-i laugh too , about it . ” “[0-i] Well , well , yes ; but [a man]1160-a man says things [he]1160-a man does not mean ; [you]0-i should be aware that [he]1160-a man does not even remember many things [he]1160-a man says , and if [a girl]456-a girl does , and believes it is all true , [she]456-a girl gets into a very awkward position . ” “[456-a girl] [You]0-i are [a young man]133-a young man , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , smiling ; “[0-i] am [I]0-i to believe [you]0-i ? ” “[0-i] Oh ! it is quite a different thing with [me]0-i . What [I]0-i say now , does not apply to [me]0-i . Only [I]0-i do n’t want [you]0-i . to let [that puppy]760-that puppy talk to [you]0-i . [He]760-that puppy can , only mean mischief , and [you]0-i had better be on [your]0-i guard . ” “[98-the reverend mother] So [the Reverend Mother]98-the reverend mother said , ” repeated [Elinor]21-elinor ; “[98-the reverend mother] and [I]0-i will obey [her]98-the reverend mother and [you]0-i . ” “[98-the reverend mother] Next Thursday [he]760-that puppy goes away , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[760-that puppy] and do [you]0-i know , dearest and gentlest [Elinor]21-elinor , that [I]0-i am going too ? [Chanson]37-mr. chanson has got a project in [his]37-mr. chanson head about visiting [some property [he]37-mr. chanson bought not long ago]762-some property he bought not long ago ; and [he]37-mr. chanson says [[his]37-mr. chanson sister]1508-his sister thinks it will be a good opportunity to do so when [young Bicester]56-sir peter leaves [the house]152-the house , and before [fresh guests]765-fresh guests come in . [He]37-mr. chanson wants [me]0-i so very much to be [[his]37-mr. chanson companion]180-his companion , that [I]0-i have consented . [We]767-we shall not be away above a few days , and during those days [I]0-i will tell [him]37-mr. chanson that [[his]37-mr. chanson ward]1832-his ward is [[his]37-mr. chanson ward]1832-his ward no longer , but that it is [I]0-i who have to answer for [her]1508-his sister in future . ” “[0-i] Do , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . [Leslie]24-leslie looked at [her]21-elinor , and half laughed . “[0-i] [You]0-i will not tell [him]37-mr. chanson the contrary ? ” said [he]24-leslie . “[0-i] Oh ! no , no , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor ; “[37-mr. chanson] no more , surely , will [he]37-mr. chanson ? [I]0-i am sorry though that [I]0-i did not ask [him]37-mr. chanson first if [I]0-i might , for [the Reverend Mother]34-the reverend mother told [me]0-i it was [[my]0-i guardian]770-my guardian who must settle that . ” “[34-the reverend mother] And [I]0-i told [you]0-i not ; very true . But [you]0-i do not think [I]0-i told [you]0-i to do anything wrong ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i hope not , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , “[0-i] for [I]0-i have no right or wrong in [my]0-i head now , except what [I]0-i learn from [you]0-i . ” “[0-i] Ay ! trust [me]0-i , then ...... Oh ! [I]0-i could not mislead [you]0-i . ” “[0-i] No , [I]0-i am sure of that , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , lifting [her]0-i eyes to [his]1840-he . [He]1840-he thought of the morning at breakfast , when [he]1840-he could not get one glimpse of those shy eyes ; and [he]1840-he thought also of the many things between that moment and the one in which [her]0-i innocence had converted all [his]1840-he thoughts into pure projects like itself . In [his]1840-he heart [he]1840-he worshipped the creature who held so strong , yet so silken a dominion over [him]1840-he , and in [his]1840-he enjoyment of the prospect now before [him]1840-he , [he]1840-he instinctively tried to forget the cruel one which [he]1840-he had entertained and abandoned . [Laura]26-laura had no time to spare , or [she]26-laura would have let things work more gently than [she]26-laura could now afford . This was Saturday evening ; and the evening of Sunday [she]26-laura destined to commence a plot which must explode before Thursday , or all [her]26-laura schemes would be at fault . The course of Sunday contented [her]26-laura well enough . The usual duties of the day went forward , and however mechanically to [Laura]26-laura , there was no outward dereliction . [She]26-laura would have had a vague uneasiness at absenting [herself]26-laura from [the village church]1841-the village church , but no word that [she]26-laura heard there struck [her]26-laura as forbidding — no word [she]26-laura uttered there , struck [her]26-laura as renouncing — the secret purposes [she]26-laura meditated . Once , as [a very young child , instructed to lay by every secular employment on the Sabbath day]1842-a very young child , instructed to lay by every secular employment on the sabbath day , it chanted that [[her]26-laura mother]545-her mother , who led a usually secluded life , was invited by [a very great house]1844-a very great house to very great feast on a Sunday ; and [the mother]1845-the mother went , not because [she]1845-the mother thought and explained that there was no harm in it , but because the temptation was so strong . [Laura]26-laura had opportunities enough to melt down the impression which this fact made on [her]26-laura ; nor did it , probably , in itself produce much effect , but [her]26-laura nature had that bias which caused it to select and feed upon this and various similar incidents which the tide of things presented to [her]26-laura , until at length led away by selfishness and by uncontrolled passions , [she]26-laura had come to be , as one may say , [two Lauras]1846-two lauras , [the one who professed in theory whatever was good]1847-the one who professed in theory whatever was good , and [the one whose actions regarded simply what was convenient]1848-the one whose actions regarded simply what was convenient . It is a very common character . This Sunday , therefore , saw [her]26-laura in [the family pew with [[her]26-laura guests]1264-her guests]1849-the family pew with her guests ; saw [her]26-laura take the school report from the hand of [the curtseying schoolmistress]1851-the curtseying schoolmistress , and rebuke [the child who was shown up for inattention]1852-the child who was shown up for inattention . [She]26-laura let the horses and [servants]1853-servants rest to‐day , and proposed merely a walk by way of amusement . Before [she]26-laura could prevent [him]1852-the child who was shown up for inattention , [Leslie]24-leslie drew [Elinor]21-elinor away , and by the side of [the waterfall]286-the waterfall and up [the banks of [the brook]1245-the brook]1855-the banks of the brook , [they]1857-they passed the afternoon hours . [Laura]26-laura had got a present for [[her]26-laura cousin]1554-her cousin [Peter]56-sir peter , a travelling bag , fitted in the smallest compass with the most numerous articles , and called [him]56-sir peter to [[her]26-laura sitting‐room]1747-her sitting‐room to give it . [Sir Peter]56-sir peter was rather melancholy and sentimental . [He]56-sir peter was going to [the other side of [the world]1134-the world]1860-the other side of the world , and was pleased to do so , and yet it touched [him]56-sir peter to feel that [nobody]1225-nobody was much interested in [his]56-sir peter departure except [himself]56-sir peter ; [[his]56-sir peter place]1863-his place would close over at once , and it was [he]56-sir peter only who cared or reflected that [he]56-sir peter was going . [Laura]26-laura ’s care , therefore , to procure a present for [him]56-sir peter , gave [him]56-sir peter pleasure . [He]56-sir peter employed [himself]56-sir peter in examining and admiring every article , and in obtaining from [Laura]26-laura a few words in [her]26-laura own hand , declaring [herself]26-laura [the giver of the bag]1864-the giver of the bag , and [the well‐wishing cousin of [the recipient]1866-the recipient]1865-the well‐wishing cousin of the recipient . “[0-i] And [you]771-you will think of [me]0-i once or twice , will [you]771-you ? ” said [Sir Peter]56-sir peter ; “[771-you] when [my]0-i thoughts are travelling [homewards]772-homewards [they]773-they will now and then meet [yours]771-you coming out to [Ceylon]12-ceylon . ” “[773-they] To be sure [they]773-they will ; and [many others]774-many others will be on the same journey , anxious to know what [you]771-you are about . ” “[26-laura] No , [Laura]26-laura , no . [[My]0-i mother]1208-my mother , if [she]1208-my mother were alive , would have let [no post]776-no post go by without a letter . [I]0-i have a green bag stuffed with those [she]1208-my mother wrote to [me]0-i at [school]777-school , and so would [a sister]475-a sister , perhaps , if [I]0-i ever had one , but [nobody else]630-nobody else ever cares for [a young man]133-a young man more than for one grain of wheat rather than another in a sack full . ” “[781-the only one] Oh ! indeed , [I]0-i do , ” said [Laura]26-laura , “[0-i] and [I]0-i am not [the only one]781-the only one . ” “[0-i] Who else ? ” “[0-i] Nay , [I]0-i do n’t think [I]0-i shall tell [you]771-you . It is such nonsense . ” “[771-you] [You]771-you do n’t mean [the little nun]782-the little nun ? ” “[782-the little nun] No , no ; of course not . ” “[771-you] [You]771-you do , ” said [Sir Peter]56-sir peter , starting up , and forgetting [his]56-sir peter melancholy ; “[771-you] what did [she]782-the little nun say ? ” “[782-the little nun] Oh ! nothing — [I]0-i forget — nothing worth hearing . ” “[782-the little nun] Nay , [Laura]26-laura , [you]771-you shall tell [me]0-i , or [I]0-i will ask [her]782-the little nun . Where is [she]782-the little nun ? ” “[782-the little nun] In [[her]782-the little nun own room]294-her own room , [I]0-i should think . [You]771-you ca n’t go [there]1176-there and ask [her]782-the little nun . ” “[771-you] [I]0-i thought [she]782-the little nun was walking with [Leslie]24-leslie . ” “[782-the little nun] Not very likely after what [she]782-the little nun said to [me]0-i . If [she]782-the little nun is walking with [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie [her]782-the little nun coquetry passes all allowable bounds . ” “[782-the little nun] Why , what did [she]782-the little nun say ? ” “[782-the little nun] Nay , [you]0-i will be so vain . ” “[0-i] Not vainer than [I]0-i am , ” said [Sir Peter]56-sir peter , smiling gaily . “[0-i] True ; that ’s hardly possible , ” said [Laura]26-laura ; “[782-the little nun] well , well , [she]782-the little nun is very demure , and does not talk much [you]0-i know , to [me]0-i at least , but [she]782-the little nun said this morning in [her]782-the little nun sudden way , as if [her]782-the little nun words broke out of [her]782-the little nun thoughts , ‘ [Sir]372-sir . [Peter]56-sir peter smokes every evening , does not [he]56-sir peter ? ’ ” “[56-sir peter] What an unsentimental meditation ! ” said [Sir Peter]56-sir peter . “[56-sir peter] [I]0-i did not think so , ” said [Laura]26-laura . “[56-sir peter] As how , is it not ? ” “[56-sir peter] When [you]0-i smoke , [you]0-i walk out ; when [you]0-i walk out [you]0-i can be met . ” “[56-sir peter] Nay , is that it ? [nice little girl]786-nice little girl ! ” “[786-nice little girl] [I]0-i do n’t know that it is that , but it would be easy to make the experiment . If it is so , and [she]782-the little nun likes [you]0-i [Peter]56-sir peter , do take [her]782-the little nun with [you]0-i to [Ceylon]12-ceylon . [I]0-i use no concealment . [I]0-i should be glad if [she]782-the little nun were gone . ” “[0-i] Thanks , thanks , [dear cousin]787-dear cousin , but [I]0-i ca n’t be quite so convenient as that , for [I]0-i suppose [you]0-i would have [her]782-the little nun [[my]0-i wife]603-my wife . ” “[56-sir peter] [Peter]56-sir peter ! ” “[56-sir peter] But if [she]782-the little nun do think of morning walks with [Leslie]24-leslie , and moonlight walks with [me]0-i , at least [he]56-sir peter will never marry [her]782-the little nun . ” “[56-sir peter] Never , never , never ! ” said [Laura]26-laura . Dinner was not over till the evening was dark , for October was at the end of its first week . [The rooms]1867-the rooms were bright with lamps and candles , but the windows were open to the shadowy scene without , for the weather was very hot , even as though summer were abroad masquerading in the splendidly coloured robes of the aged year . “[56-sir peter] Let [us]789-us walk down [the garden]146-the garden , ” said [Laura]26-laura to [Elinor]21-elinor , who was [the only lady beside [herself]21-elinor of the party]1868-the only lady beside herself of the party ; “[56-sir peter] the air is oppressive , further from [the house]152-the house it will be cooler . ” [They]789-us went together along [the garden paths]1869-the garden paths , and reached [the avenue of great Scotch firs which terminated [it]1869-the garden paths]1870-the avenue of great scotch firs which terminated it , and which at [its]1869-the garden paths other extremity had a wicket opening into [the park]1299-the park . “[0-i] [I]0-i wonder , ” said [Laura]26-laura , “[0-i] whether [Eliza Mosterick]73-eliza mosterick has had the broth [she]73-eliza mosterick wanted ; did [you]792-you hear anything about it ? ” “[792-you] No , [I]0-i did not . ” “[0-i] But [you]792-you knew [she]73-eliza mosterick was ill . Did [you]792-you call to inquire about [her]73-eliza mosterick when [you]792-you were out this morning ? ” “[792-you] No , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[792-you] [You]792-you might just as well have done so , and put the Sunday to some better purpose than merely amusing [yourself]792-you , ” said [Laura]26-laura ; “[793-poor woman] [poor woman]793-poor woman , perhaps [she]73-eliza mosterick has been waiting vainly all day .
