[I]0-i wish [I]0-i could go as far before [[my]0-i brother]482-my brother comes into [the drawing‐room]194-the drawing‐room ; [he]482-my brother does not like [me]0-i to be absent . ” [Elinor]21-elinor was silent ; whatever [she]21-elinor might say [she]21-elinor felt would bring down a rebuke . “[482-my brother] Could [you]792-you go , [Elinor]21-elinor ? ” said [Laura]26-laura , at last . “[21-elinor] Certainly , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , who was accustomed at [the convent]127-the convent to wait on [the sick]1873-the sick , and to be employed about [their]1873-the sick errands . “[21-elinor] Shall [I]0-i ? ” “[0-i] Well , if [you]792-you will . [You]792-you know [the house]152-the house ; it is [the underkeeper’s]797-the underkeeper’s — [you]792-you know , just fifty yards from the end of [the avenue on the right]798-the avenue on the right — [she]799-she was very ill — unless [she]799-she is better — and [I]0-i meant to send [her]799-she some broth and things ....... Stay , take [her]799-she five shillings will [you]792-you , in case [she]799-she wants to buy anything . Here , put [my]0-i scarf over [your]792-you head . It is as good as a bonnet . ” [Elinor]21-elinor did all [she]21-elinor was bid , and [Laura]26-laura , when [she]26-laura was disappearing like a white spirit down [the gloomy avenue]1874-the gloomy avenue , turned hastily and ran to [the house]152-the house , where [she]26-laura gave thanks ( like [Shylock]74-shylock when [[his]74-shylock enemies]1876-his enemies ’ ships are lost , and [he]74-shylock says , “[75-god] Thank [God]75-god , [I]0-i thank [God]75-god ! ” ) to see that the time for evening Sunday prayers was not more than a quarter of an hour distant , at which epoch of the evening the absence of [any member of the party]1877-any member of the party must become conspicuous . Both [Leslie]24-leslie and [Sir Peter]56-sir peter glanced round [the room]104-the room as soon as [they]1879-they came in , for [Elinor]21-elinor . [Both]1347-both looked at [Laura]26-laura to account for [her]26-laura absence . A faint smile , and a slight elevation of [her]26-laura eyebrows informed [the latter]205-the latter that [Elinor]21-elinor would be found where [he]205-the latter expected , and [Sir Peter]56-sir peter vanished to keep [the imaginary rendezvous]1882-the imaginary rendezvous on [his]56-sir peter side . [Leslie]24-leslie asked in a low voice , where was [Elinor]21-elinor . “[75-god] Is not [she]800-she here ? ” said [Laura]26-laura , looking round ; “[800-she] [I]0-i have been in [the garden]146-the garden , but [she]800-she refused to come . [I]0-i think [she]800-she said [she]800-she was going to write a letter . ” [Leslie]24-leslie was obliged to content [himself]24-leslie ; and taking up a book , sat watching the door which , every time it opened drew [his]24-leslie eager eyes , till the appearance of [some uninteresting figure]1883-some uninteresting figure caused [them]1884-they to be impatiently cast down again . [Laura]26-laura ’s attention went nervously to the clock , which ticked on so composedly , and would not hasten towards half‐past nine . Nor even when the half‐hour had leisurely lifted up its voice twice , to denote that it was come , did the outer bell sound for prayers , till another full minute had gone by ; and yet further , several seconds , which seemed like hours ( as they do to [a man under the surgeon]1885-a man under the surgeon ’s hands , or hanging on the edge of a precipice while relief is coming ) , passed by , before [the butler]186-the butler threw open the door , and announced , after the manner of [butlers]1887-butlers , “[800-she] Prayers is ready . ” [Laura]26-laura rose at once , and with a bland smile , walked alone out of [the room]104-the room followed by [[her]26-laura brother]195-her brother , by [Leslie]24-leslie , and by [the few men who were guests in [the house]152-the house]1890-the few men who were guests in the house . Nothing could have answered better , for as [they]1884-they crossed [the ante‐room]1892-the ante‐room , which opened on [the garden]146-the garden , [Elinor]21-elinor came hastily in , the veil on [her]21-elinor head , and [Sir Peter]56-sir peter following closely . [Laura]26-laura saw [Leslie]24-leslie ’s start of displeased surprise ; [he]24-leslie went to [her]802-you and offered [his]24-leslie arm , regardless who observed [him]24-leslie , or what [they]1884-they thought . “[800-she] Where have [you]802-you been ? ” [he]24-leslie said , in a very low voice . “[29-miss chanson] [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson took [me]0-i into [the garden]146-the garden and sent [me]0-i on an errand . ” [Leslie]24-leslie had just heard that [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson bad been alone in [the garden]146-the garden , and that [Elinor]21-elinor had said [she]21-elinor was going to [[her]21-elinor own room]294-her own room . “[29-miss chanson] But [you]802-you are not alone , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . “[0-i] [I]0-i could not help it , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor ; “[804-he] [he]804-he came out to smoke and met [me]0-i . ” “[804-he] [He]804-he always smokes in [the garden]146-the garden at night . [You]802-you knew it ? ” “[802-you] Indeed , indeed , [I]0-i did not . ” “[0-i] Dear , dear [Elinor]21-elinor , do not ....... ” [They]1896-they had now crossed [the hall]187-the hall and entered [the parlour where [the servants]1262-the servants were assembled]1898-the parlour where the servants were assembled . The necessary outer decorum prevailed , but stormy was [Leslie]24-leslie ’s bosom , sad and frightened was [Elinor]21-elinor ’s , while holy words and pious attitudes alone appeared to the public ear and eye . [Laura]26-laura hastened [Elinor]21-elinor away with [her]26-laura after prayers , saying that [they]1896-they must be punctual to‐morrow at breakfast in order to be ready for an expedition which [she]26-laura had arranged , and however early it was [they]1896-they would now go to bed to prepare for it . [Leslie]24-leslie was so much in love that [he]24-leslie did not venture on being offended with [Elinor]21-elinor ; [he]24-leslie no longer assumed an authoritative manner with [her]21-elinor , that was too paternal , too like [a guardian]1900-a guardian , but [he]24-leslie had a grieved look and way towards [her]21-elinor , wholly natural and unpremeditated , which brought the tears into [her]21-elinor eyes . [He]24-leslie saw them , and [they]1896-they atoned for everything . “[806-she] [She]806-she is sorry , ” [he]24-leslie said to [himself]24-leslie ; “[806-she] [she]806-she knows [she]806-she has been wrong . No doubt it is [his]807-his fault more than [hers]806-she . Still , why did [she]806-she use the worn out plea to [Laura]26-laura of writing letters . Why did [she]806-she , to [me]0-i , invent the pretext of being sent on a message . And [she]806-she tells these little lies so innocently , [she]806-she would deceive [any man]1641-any man , if [he]1641-any man were fool enough to think there is [a woman in [the world]1134-the world]809-a woman in the world who does not lie . ” [He]24-leslie stamped the unoffending boards of [[his]24-leslie room]1901-his room as [he]24-leslie came to this conclusion , and walked up and down till [he]24-leslie reflected there was such a thing as going to bed . And now came Monday , the day on which the drawing , the needlework , the gardening , the professional duties , if there be any , or the gun and the dogs , the fishing rod and ride if there be none , are resumed after one day ’s suspension . There has been [the village church]1841-the village church changing the disposal of the morning and afternoon from the six days ’ course ; there has been , perhaps , a different style of books read , an abstinence from some favourite employment , and , at all events , there has been the sight of [the poor man]1903-the poor man ’s holiday ; twenty‐four hours , in short , in some way different from other similar periods , and a consequent mark left upon Time . [Laura]26-laura awaking , saw before [her]26-laura three wretched days , in which [she]26-laura had to fight against the natural order of things in order to bring about a base purpose of [her]26-laura own ; a purpose liable in a high degree to failure , [she]26-laura was disinclined to get up and do this iniquitous battle , although it was not that the iniquity struck [her]26-laura , but [her]26-laura own hard fate in being unable to obtain the object necessary to [her]26-laura happiness without such a struggle . “[806-she] And why is it ? ” thus [her]26-laura thoughts came over [her]26-laura , but not worded ; “[806-she] why is it that [I]0-i love [him]811-he thus?—he is not eager to please [me]0-i , as [others]266-others are . [I]0-i am obliged to cultivate conversation before it runs freely between [us]813-us . [He]811-he does not seek out [my]0-i wishes as [[my]0-i poor brother]814-my poor brother does , and as [William Mansfield]76-william mansfield and [the other man]815-the other man did whom [I]0-i could not bear . No ! [I]0-i must sacrifice plans and comforts to [him]811-he . If [he]811-he once loved [me]0-i , if [I]0-i once knew that [he]811-he would be sorry to go away , then [I]0-i could renounce [him]811-he — perhaps — but if [he]811-he went now , [he]811-he would forget [me]0-i to‐morrow . [I]0-i should think of [him]811-he , and [he]811-he would not think of [me]0-i ; [he]811-he is so commanding among [men]1230-men , [he]811-he cares so little what is thought of [him]811-he ; [he]811-he is so acceptable in society , so beautiful — if [I]0-i could but know [I]0-i had power over [him]811-he — shall another?—she ...... ? ” [Laura]26-laura sprang out of bed and took up [her]26-laura self‐imposed burthen . How carefully were all the minute cares of [[her]26-laura person]1904-her person attended to , and how mechanically ; but as for [her]26-laura mind , its habits were not those which led [her]26-laura to be true with [herself]26-laura ; hence all was slurred and burred within , and [she]26-laura had a most imperfect view of what [she]26-laura [herself]26-laura was doing . But at half‐past nine [she]26-laura descended clean as a white pebble from [a running brook]1905-a running brook , neat as a rose‐bud still bound by its unfolding calyx ; agreeable , attentive , handsome ; but within , there was a heart constantly conscious in its way of beating that something was wrong ; there was a dry mouth which disliked the business of talking , and hated that of eating ; there was the sense of hearing strained to catch one voice , and rebelling because that voice was not addressed to [her]26-laura . There was fear over all , that some of the many words might be said which would reveal those secrets which lay so near the surface , and which any chance might lay bare from the covering [she]26-laura was able to draw over them . Chance did not show itself favourable to‐day ; for [her]26-laura plan had been to keep [the lovers]1906-the lovers apart by dividing the party between [carriage and horseback]1907-carriage and horseback , and to visit a show place in [the neighbourhood]1908-the neighbourhood , of which [the possessors]1909-the possessors were friends of [hers]26-laura , and [their]1909-the possessors society and chaperonage round [[their]1909-the possessors house and [garden]1911-garden]1910-their house and garden , would prevent the formation of tête‐à‐têtes . But before breakfast was over , the clouds let fall [their]1909-the possessors long‐threatening torrents , and in a very short time [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson declared the expedition impossible . “[811-he] It will be too late , even if the rain stops by mid‐day , ” said [he]37-mr. chanson ; “[811-he] [you]817-you must do something else . Come , [we]818-we ’ll have a game of billiards first , and then , when [[you]817-you two women]819-you two women have written a dozen letters , and worked [your]817-you frills , or [your]817-you kettle‐holders , [you]817-you shall help [me]0-i to change the shells out of [the library]229-the library to the new cases . [I]0-i want the labels neatly written , and little card boxes made . [I]0-i am glad it rains . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i will be glad too , for [your]817-you sake , ” said [Laura]26-laura ; “[21-elinor] [Elinor]21-elinor , will [you]21-elinor help ? ” “[21-elinor] Oh , yes ! ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[21-elinor] [You]817-you ca n’t want to write more letters ! ” said [Laura]26-laura , availing [herself]26-laura of the shot which accident opened to [her]26-laura . “[817-you] No , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[817-you] Have [you]21-elinor finished all ? ” asked [Leslie]24-leslie , in a low voice . “[0-i] [I]0-i have not , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , in a voice still lower ; “[0-i] but say nothing . [I]0-i shall be so glad to do [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson a little service . ” “[0-i] [[His]37-mr. chanson sister]1508-his sister believed that [you]21-elinor were employed in writing last night , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . “[1508-his sister] How could [she]1508-his sister , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor ; “[1508-his sister] [I]0-i went to bed by [her]1508-his sister desire as soon as [we]822-our were [upstairs]1665-upstairs . ” “[0-i] Equivocator ! ” thought [Leslie]24-leslie . Evening came , and with it a change in the weather . Before setting , the sun shone brightly out , and it left [the autumnal garden]1912-the autumnal garden in a gentle haze of warm air , where the smell of the fresh earth and the excited flowers , and the air renovated with moisture , flattered every sense of eye and ear . “[0-i] How delicious , ” said [Laura]26-laura , when [she]26-laura and [Elinor]21-elinor stood again outside the window which opened on the walk ; “[0-i] let [us]822-our take [our]822-our bonnets and walk for ten minutes . ” [They]822-our did so , and at the end of that time , [Laura]26-laura said [she]26-laura must return to [the house]152-the house . “[21-elinor] [Elinor]21-elinor , will [you]21-elinor be so good as to go as far as [the clerk]824-the clerk ’s , and ask [him]824-the clerk to look in [[our]822-our pew]825-our pew for [my]0-i prayer book ? the one in vellum , [you]21-elinor know , which [[my]0-i brother]482-my brother gave [me]0-i . [I]0-i forgot to bring it away , and [I]0-i want to gum down the label on the back before it gets rubbed off . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i ca n’t do that to‐night , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . ; “[0-i] in the morning if [you]21-elinor like . ” “[0-i] Why not ? ” said [Laura]26-laura , turning full round upon [her]26-laura . “[0-i] [Sir Peter]56-sir peter does not allow [me]0-i to walk alone . ” [Laura]26-laura burst into laughter . “[56-sir peter] What , must [Sir Peter]56-sir peter shut [himself]56-sir peter up every time it pleases [you]21-elinor to take the air ? ” “[56-sir peter] [I]0-i do n’t mean that ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[0-i] Oh ! [you]21-elinor fancy [he]56-sir peter means to assassinate [you]21-elinor , or take hold of [your]21-elinor hand ...... or ...... ” “[21-elinor] No ! ” “[21-elinor] Or that [his]56-sir peter sole object in walking out is to share the delights of [your]21-elinor conversation , and wait upon [your]21-elinor presence . Upon [my]0-i word [his]56-sir peter sole object is , rather , to smoke [his]56-sir peter pipe . ” “[56-sir peter] Oh ! yes . ” “[56-sir peter] Which object [he]56-sir peter pursues in [the garden]146-the garden and the fir‐grove . Therefore , even though [that frightful young man]828-that frightful young man were to amuse [his]56-sir peter leisure with the sin of tobacco , [you]21-elinor would be quite safe [[my]0-i dear]1127-my dear in walking to [the church]1363-the church . Now go , will [you]21-elinor , [Elinor]21-elinor ? ” “[21-elinor] No , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , “[21-elinor] [I]0-i can not . [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie does not choose [I]0-i should . ” “[24-leslie] Oh ! now it comes out . [She]831-she ’s afraid of beiing scolded , is [she]831-she ? What ! [she]831-she has been scolded already , and has cried and said [she]831-she would never do so no more , no ! never . What [a good child]832-a good child ! ” [Elinor]21-elinor stood with tears in [her]21-elinor eyes . “[832-a good child] Yes , ” [she]21-elinor said , when [Laura]26-laura scornfully waited for an answer ; “[0-i] [I]0-i said [I]0-i never would do what [he]24-leslie disliked . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i never heard anything so babyish in [my]0-i life . Why [you]21-elinor are no more fit to be [a married woman]833-a married woman than [an infant]834-an infant . If [you]21-elinor let [a man]1160-a man tyrannize over [you]21-elinor in that way while [he]1160-a man is [[your]21-elinor lover]836-your lover , [he]1160-a man will be cruel as [a husband]837-a husband , and sick to death of [you]21-elinor in six months . ” [Elinor]21-elinor stood silent : [her]21-elinor colour rose under the hard words and fearful prophecy , but [she]21-elinor did not credit it , and yet would not contradict [the utterer]1914-the utterer . “[1160-a man] Now , [[my]0-i dear child]1192-my dear child , ” said [[Miss Chan‐]77-miss chan‐ son]1915-miss chan‐ son , “[1160-a man] for [your]21-elinor own sake let [me]0-i entreat [you]21-elinor to behave a little more like [a woman]1161-a woman . Have a little independence , just enough to make [him]1160-a man think [you]21-elinor [[his]1160-a man equal]840-his equal . If [he]1160-a man finds fault with things right and innocent , do n’t mind [him]1160-a man , go [your]21-elinor own way . Stand up to [him]1160-a man . [Men]1230-men like to be stood up to . ” “[1230-men] Very well , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , smiling , “[1230-men] [I]0-i will remember what [you]21-elinor say . ” “[21-elinor] And go to [the church]1363-the church for [me]0-i , ” said [Laura]26-laura , smiling also , “[21-elinor] there ’s [a good girl]843-a good girl . ” [Elinor]21-elinor shook [her]21-elinor head . “[21-elinor] [You]21-elinor will not ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i can not . ” “[21-elinor] Say will not at once , if [you]21-elinor mean it . Well ? ” “[21-elinor] Indeed [I]0-i can not , [I]0-i will not . ” “[21-elinor] That will do . Then will [you]21-elinor be so very obliging as to go in and tell [[my]0-i brother]482-my brother , that [I]0-i am obliged to go on an errand , because [you]21-elinor will not , and that [I]0-i ...... and that [you]21-elinor ...... what [you]21-elinor choose . ” [Laura]26-laura turned [her]26-laura back , and set out hastily ; but in a few seconds [she]26-laura stopped , and looked back , [she]26-laura had expected that [the gentle girl]1916-the gentle girl would have run after [her]26-laura , but there was [Elinor]21-elinor , standing quite still , watching [her]26-laura . [Laura]26-laura ran back — “[21-elinor] What ! will [you]21-elinor do neither one nor the other , do [you]21-elinor defy [me]0-i ? am [I]0-i to be defied in [[my]0-i own house]845-my own house ? ridiculed ? go to [the church]1363-the church directly , or let [me]0-i believe [you]21-elinor are [the most ungrateful of [women]1158-women]847-the most ungrateful of women . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i will not walk alone this evening , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[0-i] Will [you]21-elinor do this , then ? ” said [Laura]26-laura , commanding [her]26-laura voice to the lowest and calmest tone . “[21-elinor] Will [you]21-elinor pass this evening in [[your]21-elinor own room]849-your own room ? ” “[21-elinor] [I]0-i am very sorry [I]0-i have offended [you]21-elinor , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , “[0-i] [I]0-i will do whatever [you]21-elinor bid [me]0-i , ” and [she]0-i turned away , and went straight into [the house]152-the house , and [upstairs]1665-upstairs , while [Laura]26-laura dashed the tears of passion from [her]26-laura eyes , and inveighed against the cruelty of [the young girl]107-the young girl , for triumphing in [her]26-laura victory over [the lover of [her]26-laura benefactress]1920-the lover of her benefactress . When [she]26-laura reached [the drawing‐room]194-the drawing‐room [it]194-the drawing‐room was still empty . [She]26-laura opened a book of drawings on the table , and composed [her]26-laura agitated frame . A few minutes brought in [[her]26-laura brother]195-her brother and [[his]195-her brother guests]1923-his guests , and then the first inquiry was for [Miss Ladylift]21-elinor . “[850-she] [She]850-she told [me]0-i [she]850-she was going to write letters , ” said [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson , demurely . [Sir Peter]56-sir peter instantly glanced at [[his]56-sir peter cousin]1539-his cousin , and smiled . [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie caught the smile , and [his]24-leslie eye turned in the same moment upon [Laura]26-laura , but [she]26-laura was looking straight forward , as innocent as a bird . [He]24-leslie perceived , however , that [young Bicester]56-sir peter was swallowing a scalding cup of coffee , and that lounging apparently from one window to another , [he]24-leslie silently opened the door , and disappeared . [Leslie]24-leslie , with no attempt at mystery , went out directly after . The evening was growing very dusky , but [he]24-leslie saw [the man [he]24-leslie deemed [[his]24-leslie rival]1712-his rival]1925-the man he deemed his rival , entering [the avenue]1927-the avenue , and hastily followed [him]1925-the man he deemed his rival . [Sir Peter]56-sir peter was alone ; and that [he]56-sir peter was alone , surprised [Sir Peter]56-sir peter . But that [the person who joined]1928-the person who joined [him]56-sir peter should be [Leslie]24-leslie , thoroughly annoyed [him]56-sir peter , and [Leslie]24-leslie on [his]24-leslie part was equally angry at finding [the young soldier]1929-the young soldier thus apparently awaiting a rendezvous . [The one]1930-the one overtook [the other]1931-the other , and [they]1932-they walked together a few yards in silence . “[850-she] Are [you]851-you going into [the park]1299-the park ? ” said [Sir Peter]56-sir peter , at last . “[851-you] No ; are [you]851-you ? ” “[850-she] No . ” Again there was silence ; then [Sir Peter]56-sir peter began again . “[850-she] [I]0-i never knew [you]851-you choose this walk before . ” “[851-you] Did not [you]851-you ? ” “[851-you] No . ” [Sir Peter]56-sir peter shook the ashes from [his]56-sir peter cigar bitterly , and then turned suddenly , and walked in the opposite direction . [Leslie]24-leslie , who seldom smoked , took out a cigar , in order to give [himself]24-leslie some reason for being [here]1135-here , and puffing with undue vigour , excited a great smoke , and marched to the end of [the avenue]1927-the avenue ; here [he]24-leslie turned , and about mid‐way , [the two young men]1935-the two young men met , and crossed [each other]1279-each other , each sending out a large gale of tobacco , and looking as happy as [he]24-leslie could . How long this was to go on , [Leslie]24-leslie did not like to conjecture but at all events [he]24-leslie did not intend to leave [the ground]1937-the ground while [[his]24-leslie rival]1712-his rival occupied [it]1937-the ground , even though [they]1935-the two young men should walk thus till morning . [Sir Peter]56-sir peter it seemed was not so persevering , for before [they]1935-the two young men came across [each other]1279-each other a third time , [he]56-sir peter stepped on one side of [the path]1254-the path , and left [the avenue]1927-the avenue by a wicket which led by a back way to [the house]152-the house . [Leslie]24-leslie immediately stood still and flung [his]24-leslie cigar as far as its weight would carry it , and then collected [his]24-leslie thoughts with more form than the presence of [Sir Peter]56-sir peter had allowed . “[851-you] It is too plain , that [he]853-he expected [her]854-her , ” [he]56-sir peter said to [himself]56-sir peter ; “[853-he] then [he]853-he has already met [her]854-her . Yet [I]0-i warned [her]854-her — besought [her]854-her — but [he]853-he is [a villain]855-a villain , availing [himself]853-he of [her]854-her untaught , guileless , nature — inexperienced , bewildered , humble as [she]854-her is ! If [he]853-he knew [my]0-i claim upon [her]854-her , [she]854-her would be safe . Yet impossible ! shall [the silly coxcomb]856-the silly coxcomb know that it is [[my]0-i promised wife]857-my promised wife , whom [he]853-he has hoped would come at midnight to meet [him]853-he ? Impossible ! [He]853-he is going , thank heaven ! to [the other side of [the world]1134-the world]1860-the other side of the world ...... tempest , fever , sword , and shot , pursue [him]853-he ! ” Thus [he]853-he stormed within , standing beside one of the stern fir‐stems , which threw a steadfast shadow on the turf from its branches between the moonlight and the ground . Nearly half an hour passed , in which time [Sir Peter]56-sir peter felt fully persuaded that [[his]56-sir peter rival]1712-his rival must have been tired of [his]56-sir peter suspicion , and have left [the avenue]1927-the avenue . [He]56-sir peter [himself]56-sir peter had been to [the saloon]1945-the saloon , where still the fair [Elinor]21-elinor was not , and with some hope , rekindled from the malicious eyes of [Laura]26-laura , [he]56-sir peter returned again to try [his]56-sir peter fortune . Slowly [he]56-sir peter paced down [the avenue]1927-the avenue , and failed to perceive the dark figure beneath the fir‐tree . As [he]56-sir peter came on , it advanced suddenly from the shadow . [Sir Peter]56-sir peter started slightly . “[0-i] [I]0-i forgot something , ” said [he]56-sir peter . “[0-i] Did [you]0-i , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . “[0-i] Yes ! ” said [Sir Peter]56-sir peter , and again [they]1947-they passed [each other]1279-each other , and [Sir Peter]56-sir peter proceeding to the end of [the avenue]1927-the avenue , opened the gate , and went finally out . “[0-i] What right has [he]860-he to act dragon ? ” said [the young man]191-the young man , as [he]191-the young man returned [home]139-home . Next morning , [Tuesday]78-tuesday , [Leslie]24-leslie and [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson were walking together through [the garden]146-the garden to [the conservatory]1953-the conservatory . [Elinor]21-elinor looking from [her]21-elinor window saw [them]1947-they , and was pleased that [[her]21-elinor angry guardianess]1954-her angry guardianess should be in company with [one who [she]21-elinor felt would speak even better of [her]21-elinor than [she]21-elinor deserved]1955-one who she felt would speak even better of her than she deserved . So warbling some low notes with [her]21-elinor melodious throat , [she]21-elinor turned away to put in order part of [her]21-elinor simple wardrobe , with skilful fingers well versed in the arts of hemming and darning . “[861-she] [She]861-she told [me]0-i , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , to [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson , “[861-she] that [you]862-you sent [her]861-she to [[her]861-she room]1295-her room last night . ” [Laura]26-laura started , not knowing how much of [their]1956-their interview had been repeated , and looked [Leslie]24-leslie inquiringly in the face . “[861-she] If [I]0-i did ...... ” [she]0-i began , and paused . “[861-she] Tell [me]0-i one thing , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , “[861-she] did [you]862-you do so from any idea that it was better not to leave [her]861-she walking alone ? ” “[862-you] Why do [you]0-i ask [me]0-i ? ” said [Laura]26-laura , quite at ease again ; “[0-i] what does it matter ? ” “[0-i] No , no , it does not matter ...... very much , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[0-i] only is it possible , do [you]862-you think that [she]861-she intended to join ...... that is ...... to meet ...... ” “[862-you] Only that could have justified [me]0-i , ” said [Laura]26-laura , candidly . [Leslie]24-leslie was silent . “[0-i] [I]0-i told [you]0-i long ago , ” said [Laura]26-laura , at last , “[0-i] that [I]0-i hoped [your]0-i confidence was not misplaced . ” “[0-i] No , no , it is not , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , “[0-i] but [she]861-she has been in an unnatural atmosphere . [She]861-she came here full of innocent mistakes , and [we]864-we undeceived [her]861-she too hastily ; [she]861-she has lost the landmark for all minor proprieties . ” “[861-she] Then [I]0-i wonder , ” said [Laura]26-laura , “[861-she] that [she]861-she should think it necessary to conceal them , by such complicated statements . ” [Leslie]24-leslie again was silent . “[861-she] [She]861-she is bewildered , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , at last , “[861-she] by the admiration [she]861-she excites ; [I]0-i have not flattering words so freely at command as [others]266-others , and per‐ haps , [she]861-she is better amused by [those who have them]866-those who have them , than by [me]0-i . ” “[861-she] That ’s quite impossible , ” said [Laura]26-laura , very quickly ; then as if frightened at what [she]26-laura [herself]26-laura had said , [she]26-laura added hastily , “[861-she] perhaps [she]861-she wants character , [she]861-she is like [most women]517-most women ...... ” “[861-she] Oh no ! ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , sighing , “[861-she] [she]861-she has a firm purpose , hidden under [her]861-she soft exterior . [I]0-i will talk to [[your]868-your brother]869-your brother the moment [we]870-we are alone , on Thursday , and [I]0-i will make [her]861-she mine before [any other candidate]871-any other candidate dare come between [my]0-i treasure and [me]0-i . ” It was now [Laura]26-laura who was silent . To hear a purpose announced which directly contradicts the secret object of one ’s endeavours and desires , is like a blow struck right upon the heart . Why can not the blinded eye of [[our]870-we companion]1957-our companion see and choose the path which [we]870-we perceive so plainly is the one fit for [him]1957-our companion ? [Leslie]24-leslie was out of spirits , and when [he]24-leslie had gone through the flowers of [the conservatory]1953-the conservatory mechanically with [Laura]26-laura and [the gardener]1959-the gardener , [he]24-leslie walked back with [her]26-laura , till [they]870-we came in sight of [the house]152-the house again , and then turned into [the park]1299-the park , and wandered away alone , whither [he]24-leslie did not care . [Laura]26-laura proposed twenty things in order to entangle [Elinor]21-elinor with [[her]26-laura cousin]1554-her cousin , but was baffled in all . [Elinor]21-elinor would not take a lesson in billiards , would not learn to sit the pony , would not teach [Sir Peter]56-sir peter a duet , would not lend [him]56-sir peter a book of [her]21-elinor own — [she]21-elinor declined all , even before [they]870-we were fully proposed ; and at last , upon the arrival of [some morning visitors]1963-some morning visitors , attached [herself]21-elinor to [the mother of the party , who did not choose to walk far]1964-the mother of the party , who did not choose to walk far , and never left [her]21-elinor side the rest of the morning . [Laura]26-laura did not venture upon any scheme for the evening , but [she]26-laura saw with bitter pleasure , that [Leslie]24-leslie , by seeming accident sat by another than [Elinor]21-elinor at dinner , and that when [they]1965-they were all assembled in [the drawing‐room]194-the drawing‐room , [he]24-leslie and [Elinor]21-elinor seemed to want subjects of conversation , and were grave and embarrassed in place of that joyful glee which [Leslie]24-leslie ’s face had so often assumed , to [Laura]26-laura ’s anguish , when listening to , and talking with [Elinor]21-elinor . Wednesday was come , and now [Laura]26-laura had [her]26-laura last blow to strike , the one that must undo [her]26-laura if it did not succeed . There was a feeling in [the house]152-the house about seeing the last of [Sir Peter]56-sir peter , since after to‐day , [he]56-sir peter could be seen and heard no more . [He]56-sir peter was not to go shooting alone , nor to take a solitary gallop ; [he]56-sir peter was to walk with [Laura]26-laura and [the rest]1261-the rest , [he]56-sir peter was to visit [the stables]1969-the stables with [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson . Even if [those who were not to be travellers]1970-those who were not to be travellers had something better to do , there would be time for that to‐morrow , when there would be no more time available for [Sir Peter]56-sir peter . [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson , [Leslie]24-leslie , and [Sir Peter]56-sir peter , were all to set out early on the morrow . [They]1970-those who were not to be travellers were to drive together to [the neighbouring town]1971-the neighbouring town , and there to separate , the two first to pursue [their]1970-those who were not to be travellers way to [[Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson ’s property]1972-mr. chanson ’s property , and [the young soldier]1929-the young soldier to go on to [London]13-london where [his]56-sir peter final preparations would be made . [Leslie]24-leslie , in a doubtful state of mind , was looking out for offence and cause of unhappiness ; [Elinor]21-elinor , in an humble one , was unconsciously giving it . [She]21-elinor was accustomed to the discipline of a conventual school education , and had learned a degree of patience , which made [her]21-elinor take [Leslie]24-leslie ’s absence as an unavoidable trouble , of which [she]21-elinor must not complain . [He]56-sir peter also had been accustomed to the natural teaching of school , but had acquired a different lesson , for [his]56-sir peter spirit had been one of those which make [others]266-others yield to [them]266-others , and had gratified every wish as it arose . [Her]21-elinor meekness , therefore , in resigning [him]56-sir peter for a certain number of days seemed indifference in [his]56-sir peter eyes , mystified as [he]56-sir peter was by [Laura]26-laura ; and though [he]56-sir peter loved [her]21-elinor the more anxiously for [her]21-elinor coldness , [he]56-sir peter imagined that it gave [him]56-sir peter greater reason to suspect that another occupied part of [his]56-sir peter place in [her]21-elinor heart . [Elinor]21-elinor felt there was something wrong , though [she]21-elinor knew not what , and [Leslie]24-leslie was conscious of a restraint , unlike those happy days — the few days — when [he]56-sir peter and [she]26-laura wandered among [the fields and woods]1975-the fields and woods . “[0-i] So now it is come to the last evening , ” said [Sir Peter]56-sir peter , as [he]56-sir peter and [Laura]26-laura sat together an hour before dinner , in [[her]26-laura own apartment]1976-her own apartment . “[0-i] [I]0-i have had a very pleasant visit , and [I]0-i shall not forget it . ” “[0-i] And what remembrances do [you]0-i carry away from [[our]872-our nun]873-our nun ? ” said [Laura]26-laura . “[0-i] Oh ! hang [the little nun]782-the little nun , [I]0-i am tired of [her]782-the little nun ; [I]0-i can make nothing of [her]782-the little nun , and really [I]0-i believe [our]872-our meetings have all been either [my]0-i own doing , or accident . [She]782-the little nun cares for [nobody]1225-nobody but [Leslie]24-leslie . ” “[782-the little nun] [She]782-the little nun does not care for [him]24-leslie , ” said [Laura]26-laura ; “[24-leslie] [he]24-leslie is half offended , that [she]782-the little nun should take [his]24-leslie departure so quietly . ” “[782-the little nun] Did [he]24-leslie tell [you]0-i so ? ” “[24-leslie] No — not in so many words — but words are not always necessary to explain meanings . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i are so clever , [Laura]26-laura ! [you]0-i see everything . ” “[1158-women] [Women]1158-women have that faculty , [you]0-i know . Now , [I]0-i would venture to lay a wager , that if this last day , [you]0-i were to write , soliciting one last interview , the interview would be granted , or [you]0-i would get a kind excuse for not granting it . ” “[0-i] Oh ! it is too much trouble . ” “[0-i] Where is the trouble ? there is pen and ink , and [I]0-i will tell [you]0-i what to write . ” “[0-i] But it is hardly fair . ” “[0-i] Fair indeed ! as if any measures were to be kept with [her]782-the little nun . What has [she]782-the little nun done by [me]0-i ? ” “[782-the little nun] [You]0-i ! oh , [I]0-i ca n’t keep in [my]0-i head that [you]0-i can possibly have any regard for [a person who does not adore [you]0-i]877-a person who does not adore you . ” “[877-a person who does not adore you] No , it is most unworthy , ” said [Laura]26-laura . “[0-i] [I]0-i will do better ...... there , there ...... shake [him]877-a person who does not adore you off — forget [him]877-a person who does not adore you . But [that little girl]1234-that little girl [I]0-i should like to unmask , nevertheless ; come play out the play , write [her]1234-that little girl a little love‐letter . ” [Laura]26-laura now took [her]26-laura portfolio on [her]26-laura knees , drew the little writing table close , and laughing and coquetting , composed a note which amused [Sir Peter]56-sir peter , and which [he]56-sir peter copied at [Laura]26-laura ’s side , and promised to remit to [Elinor]21-elinor . [Laura]26-laura agreed that [he]56-sir peter should do so , but just as [he]56-sir peter was leaving [the room]104-the room , recalled [him]56-sir peter , and told [him]56-sir peter to trust it to [her]26-laura care , for that [she]26-laura could manage it much better than [he]56-sir peter . [Sir Peter]56-sir peter tossed [her]26-laura the note , which [she]26-laura caught in a very pretty attitude , and kissed the tips of [her]26-laura fingers to [him]56-sir peter as [he]56-sir peter paused at the door , to give [her]26-laura a last look . It was ten o’clock that night when [a woman]1161-a woman wrapped over [her]1161-a woman head and [whole figure in a cloak]1979-whole figure in a cloak , brushed by [Sir Peter]56-sir peter , as [he]56-sir peter walked in [the avenue]1927-the avenue , and as [she]26-laura passed thrust a note into [his]56-sir peter hand . [He]56-sir peter caught the hand that gave it , but it told nothing except that it was enveloped in a glove . Rather than be detained by [him]56-sir peter , the hand slipped out of the glove , and [the figure]1981-the figure darted into the thick shade , and disappeared . The glove was merely a concealment for the hand , for it had plainly been held loosely , as a measure prepared beforehand to avoid detention ; but it was [a woman]1161-a woman ’s glove , of delicate size , and was finished with a plaited ribbon , such as [Elinor]21-elinor frequently employed [herself]21-elinor in fashioning . [Sir Peter]56-sir peter laughed as [he]56-sir peter recognised it , and placing it in [his]56-sir peter bosom , proceeded by the light of the moon to decipher , though with great difficulty , these words — “[1234-that little girl] [I]0-i can not come to‐night , [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie forbids [me]0-i to go out.—ELINOR [LADYLIFT]21-elinor . ” Poor [Elinor]21-elinor ’s ill starred billet ! SEE [that man]680-that man walking up and down [[his]680-that man room]1901-his room all night , except when at times [he]680-that man flung [himself]680-that man on the sofa , burying [his]680-that man head in [his]680-that man clenched hands . The little shred of paper lay sometimes on the table , sometimes on the floor , trampled on , crumpled , torn ; again spread out , and read with unabating fury . Beside it lay the glove , which together with the note had been brought to [him]56-sir peter by [Laura]26-laura , and which with scarce any words [she]26-laura pressed upon [him]56-sir peter as the tokens of [Elinor]21-elinor ’s falsity . [He]56-sir peter saw them and believed ; they seemed to [him]56-sir peter to indicate that the meetings between [Elinor]21-elinor and [the young soldier]1929-the young soldier , which [he]56-sir peter had persuaded [himself]56-sir peter were the effects of accident , or of mere momentary thoughtlessness , were parts of a long‐continued understanding between [them]1986-them , and that to [Elinor]21-elinor [they]1986-them had become so habitual as to make an apology necessary , when [she]21-elinor was unable to keep the appointment . How could [Leslie]24-leslie doubt ? there was [her]21-elinor handwriting , there was the glove of [her]21-elinor fine hand — false hand , false heart!—her [he]56-sir peter had trusted then in vain ! the innocence by which [he]56-sir peter had remodelled [his]56-sir peter own intentions , did not exist . [Laura]26-laura had stabbed [him]56-sir peter with this poisoned dagger , and left it to work out [her]21-elinor own ends ; and frantic indeed was the effect of the wound [she]21-elinor had inflicted . As soon as day dawned , [Leslie]24-leslie left [the house]152-the house , and continued [his]24-leslie agitated walk up and down [the garden]146-the garden where [he]24-leslie knew , by many a morning ’s experience , it was [Elinor]21-elinor ’s practise to walk before the breakfast hour , and where of late [he]24-leslie had usually joined [her]21-elinor . The cold October air chilled [his]24-leslie frame , the heavy rime , almost frost , weighed down the remaining flowers and the dripping grass ; the sun , long hidden after it had left the horizon , struggled with the mist that filled the whole atmosphere . It was late before the day became as light as the hour warranted ; and the savage impatience of [Leslie]24-leslie grew almost to delirium . At last , a window which opened to the ground from one of the sitting‐rooms was heard to rise , [he]56-sir peter stood still , partly hidden by the trunk of a cedar , and saw shrouded in a gray cloak , and a hood concealing [her]21-elinor face , [Elinor]21-elinor step into [the garden]146-the garden , and move along the walk to [[his]56-sir peter place]1863-his place . [He]56-sir peter instantly came forward , and silently seizing [her]21-elinor arm , saying no word , answering no look , dragged [her]21-elinor forward with a hand which [she]21-elinor felt violently trembling , nor stopped till [they]1991-they were in the wood together , deeply hidden , as the words [they]1991-they had to say together required hiding . Then letting go [her]21-elinor arm from one hand , and opening the other , [he]56-sir peter showed [her]21-elinor the little note and the glove , which it had clenched as [they]1991-they came along . “[21-elinor] [Your]879-you ’s ? ” [he]56-sir peter said , fixing [his]56-sir peter bloodshot eyes on [her]21-elinor face . “[21-elinor] Oh , it is [my]0-i glove which [I]0-i had lost , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , holding out [her]0-i hand for it , and looking up at [Leslie]24-leslie , perplexed , whether to smile or yield to terror . “[0-i] And where , and how did [you]879-you lose it ? ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[0-i] tell [me]0-i , explain ...... confess that ...... ” “[0-i] How can [I]0-i tell ? ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , frightened , and with a trembling voice . “[0-i] No ; in one sense [you]879-you can not tell , shame forbids — [your]879-you false nature forbids — can [you]879-you tell [me]0-i this ? Did [that glove]880-that glove deliver that note ? look at it . ” [Elinor]21-elinor looked at the little paper in [his]24-leslie fierce hand , and recognised the first words of the billet [she]21-elinor had written months before . “[24-leslie] [Leslie]24-leslie , ” [she]21-elinor said , “[24-leslie] [I]0-i do not know , how should [I]0-i ? it is so long ago . ” “[0-i] Silence ! ” cried [Leslie]24-leslie , “[879-you] [you]879-you can deceive [me]0-i no longer ; no affected innocence , no well‐continued deceit can perplex or blind [me]0-i now . This is then [your]879-you writing ? ” “[879-you] Yes , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , earnestly looking in [his]24-leslie face , and saying the one true word , for [she]21-elinor had nothing else [her]21-elinor nature permitted [her]21-elinor to say . Then [his]24-leslie fury burst out — “[79-devil] [Devil]79-devil ! [angel]881-angel ! [woman]1629-woman ! ” cried [he]24-leslie . “[1629-woman] [You]879-you have failed then to deceive [me]0-i ! [you]879-you confess — [we]883-we are even again . [I]0-i was on the point of believing in virtue — [you]879-you fail — [I]0-i am free , [falsest , hardest , perfidious woman]884-falsest , hardest , perfidious woman ...... ” [Elinor]21-elinor interrupted [him]24-leslie . “[879-you] What harm have [I]0-i done ? did not [you]879-you tell [me]0-i [I]0-i might write to [you]879-you . ” “[879-you] To [me]0-i ! oh , well‐acted innocence ! yes , [I]0-i was so cunning . [I]0-i thought to have surpassed [you]879-you in cunning ; would [I]0-i had ...... any crime better than to have been smiled at till [I]0-i was [a fool]729-a fool , and for an instant to have been held in [your]879-you mocking snares — but it is over — seek [[your]879-you other victim]886-your other victim , if [you]879-you will , follow [[your]879-you soldier]887-your soldier if [he]887-your soldier will have [you]879-you ! [I]0-i have [my]0-i eyes open at last . ” “[0-i] As [I]0-i live and stand here , [Leslie]24-leslie , there is [no human being]888-no human being who cares for [me]0-i , or whom [I]0-i care for , but [you]24-leslie . ” “[24-leslie] Words ! sweetest words ! ” cried [Leslie]24-leslie , “[24-leslie] falser than sweet , and crueller than false , were [I]0-i not free . But they are nothing to [me]0-i now ; no , nor those ; tears , nor those clasped hands , nor that well‐acted fear — no , no , no . ” “[24-leslie] [Leslie]24-leslie ! ” cried [Elinor]21-elinor , laying [her]21-elinor hand upon [his]24-leslie arm . [He]24-leslie caught hold of [her]21-elinor hand , and crushed it in [his]24-leslie , like one whose nerves have escaped control , and are contracting upon the object that excites [them]1992-them with mechanical fury ; then [his]24-leslie hold relaxing , [he]24-leslie flung [her]21-elinor hand away , and uttering a groan , which at the same time [he]24-leslie struggled to repress , lie turned , and rushed from [her]21-elinor sight . [Elinor]21-elinor was changed to stone , by all that the few minutes just passed contained ; [she]21-elinor gazed on the blank space where [Leslie]24-leslie had been , and had said such killing words ; [she]21-elinor thought of [herself]21-elinor , entering [the garden]146-the garden but now , about , as [she]21-elinor believed , to converse with [[her]21-elinor lover]484-her lover , and part from [him]24-leslie for a few days , soon never to part again ; and could by no means realise that [his]24-leslie love had turned to fury , that [he]24-leslie had said [he]24-leslie was about to leave [her]21-elinor for ever . [Her]21-elinor mind and body seemed paralyzed , and when at last [she]21-elinor recovered strength of both , enough to move from the place where [she]21-elinor was , [she]21-elinor did but return with benumbed steps to [[her]21-elinor own room]294-her own room , and there sinking upon the floor , lay crushed and bowed together , sobbing as though [her]21-elinor comfortless heart must break . The guilty cause of all this woe , once more glittering in outside show , like some splendid serpent , was descending in apparent peace to the morning meal ; but [her]21-elinor bosom also burned with anxiety , and [she]21-elinor trembled internally at the thought of what aspects [she]21-elinor might meet . Might [she]21-elinor not there see , perhaps , [Leslie]24-leslie and [Elinor]21-elinor , with all explained between [them]1996-them , and united for ever against [her]21-elinor . Might [she]21-elinor not see [Leslie]24-leslie frowning and despising [her]21-elinor , [Elinor]21-elinor sheltered by [him]24-leslie against all future malice , or should [she]21-elinor see [them]1996-them alienated from each other , and [she]21-elinor [herself]21-elinor successful . [She]21-elinor opened the breakfast‐room door , with a hesitation unseen on [her]21-elinor serene face , and glanced round ; but [her]21-elinor conjectures were all wrong , for although all else were assembled , [the two]1997-the two were not there . Again [her]21-elinor heart bounded with fear , that [they]1996-them might be together , too angry to keep up any appearance of good will with [her]21-elinor ; and after enduring the doubt and anxiety for a few decent minutes , [she]21-elinor affected to be anxious what could have become of [Elinor]21-elinor , and left [the room]104-the room to look for [her]21-elinor . When [she]21-elinor beheld [the young girl]107-the young girl , [she]21-elinor knew that [her]21-elinor artifices had succeeded , and triumph filled [her]21-elinor heart . [Elinor]21-elinor , abandoned by what was all [the world]1134-the world to [her]21-elinor , and terrified at [her]21-elinor own solitude , no sooner saw a familiar face , than [she]21-elinor rose and flung [herself]21-elinor on [Laura]26-laura ’s shoulder , straining [her]21-elinor in [her]21-elinor embrace with inarticulate mourning . [Laura]26-laura thought of [her]26-laura own fine lace and muslin , which [Elinor]21-elinor was deranging ; and raising [her]21-elinor , so as to stand free of [the sorrowing girl]2001-the sorrowing girl , asked [her]21-elinor , with a voice as kindly as [she]21-elinor could make it , the cause of [her]21-elinor distress . [Elinor]21-elinor ’s explanation would hardly have made anything clear , had not [Laura]26-laura possessed already a more perfect knowledge of the circumstances than [she]26-laura could receive . The single point [she]26-laura cared about was , what had become of [Leslie]24-leslie , and [Elinor]21-elinor could only repeat that [he]890-he had flung [her]21-elinor off , and rushed away through the thick wood , where [she]21-elinor soon had lost that last sight of [him]890-he . “[24-leslie] Last indeed ! ” said [Laura]26-laura ; “[24-leslie] after such a parting , there can be no reconciliation . What have [you]889-you done [Elinor]21-elinor ? ” “[889-you] Indeed , indeed , [I]0-i have done nothing ! [he]890-he is too cruel to [me]0-i . ” “[890-he] Yes , too cruel ; [he]890-he has been very hard on [you]21-elinor ; [he]890-he should have overlooked what faults [your]21-elinor ignorance of [the world]1134-the world led [you]21-elinor into . Think of [him]890-he no more , give [him]890-he up as [he]890-he has given [you]21-elinor . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i must die before [I]0-i do that ! ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[0-i] Nay , nay , [dear child]632-dear child ; dying is not the thing in question . Here , [dear]1133-dear , take a little water ...... ca n’t [you]21-elinor ? well , lie down , or sit down , [I]0-i will come again to [you]21-elinor — but [they]894-they are all waiting now — [I]0-i will bring [you]21-elinor a cup of tea . ” And [Laura]26-laura departed , going down [stairs]2002-stairs elastically , and filled with the image of [[her]26-laura rival]2003-her rival , whom [she]26-laura had left behind humiliated , robbed of [her]26-laura beauty by tears , and abandoned by [the man who once abandoned [Laura]26-laura for [her]26-laura]2004-the man who once abandoned laura for her . [She]26-laura made the excuse of headache , and having over‐walked [herself]26-laura , about [Elinor]21-elinor , and now if [Leslie]24-leslie had but come in , would have been perfectly happy ; but [his]24-leslie absence raised new fears in [her]26-laura heart , that in giving up one , [he]24-leslie would not renew [his]24-leslie allegiance to the other , nay , might commit some rash act , [her]26-laura fear and [her]26-laura love began to dread what . Breakfast was nearly over when a note was brought to [[her]26-laura brother]195-her brother at the other end of the table ; [he]195-her brother opened and read it to [himself]195-her brother , and [Laura]26-laura all the time was obliged to keep smiling at [[her]26-laura cousin]1554-her cousin , who sat beside [her]26-laura , for [his]195-her brother last breakfast in [[her]26-laura society]2007-her society , but whose words at this time conveyed no meaning to [her]26-laura at all . “[0-i] What have [you]895-you got there , [Lawrence]51-lawrence ? ” [she]26-laura said , at last ; “[895-you] [you]895-you look perplexed ? ” “[895-you] [This fellow Leslie]24-leslie , ” said [he]24-leslie ; “[24-leslie] [he]24-leslie writes [me]0-i word that [a messenger]896-a messenger came for [him]24-leslie from [home]139-home , and [he]24-leslie is obliged to set off at a moment ’s warning . Who saw [any messenger]898-any messenger ? ” “[898-any messenger] No , [sir]372-sir , ” said [the servant]2008-the servant , who was waiting at breakfast . “[898-any messenger] Who saw [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie go ? ” said [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson . “[24-leslie] It was not [I]0-i , [sir]372-sir . ” “[0-i] Go to [[his]24-leslie room]1901-his room . Are [his]24-leslie things gone ? ” Nothing was gone . “[24-leslie] Nor does [he]24-leslie say anything about sending them , ” said [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson ; “[24-leslie] [he]24-leslie ’ll write again , [I]0-i suppose — but what a nuisance for [me]0-i . Now [I]0-i shall have to go alone ..... [I]0-i shall stay , [I]0-i think . ” “[0-i] Oh ! no , ” said [Laura]26-laura ; “[24-leslie] go , and perhaps [he]24-leslie will meet [you]372-sir . What can have happened . Perhaps [[his]24-leslie house]1519-his house is burned down ? ” “[24-leslie] Perhaps [he]24-leslie is arrested for debt ? ” said [another]1568-another . “[24-leslie] Perhaps [the bank [he]24-leslie deals with]903-the bank he deals with is stopped ? ” said [a third]2010-a third ; but both [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson and [Sir Peter]56-sir peter looked at [Laura]26-laura , suspecting a quarrel between [her]26-laura and [Leslie]24-leslie . [She]26-laura neither said nor looked any answer , but [she]26-laura was officious and obliging in promoting the arrangements of the party , and when [she]26-laura fancied [[her]26-laura brother]195-her brother still hesitated about [his]195-her brother journey in consequence of [Leslie]24-leslie ’s secession , [she]26-laura exerted [herself]26-laura to persuade [[her]26-laura cousin]1554-her cousin to accompany [him]195-her brother , and demonstrated that with a little extra , exertion [he]195-her brother might both perform this friendly office by [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson , and also get through [his]195-her brother business in [London]13-london before the time came for the sailing of [the ship]2013-the ship . [Sir Peter]56-sir peter , for [her]26-laura sake , at last consented . [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson was satisfied to exchange [Leslie]24-leslie for [him]195-her brother , and all seemed arranged to the general satisfaction . But five minutes before the time of departure , [Laura]26-laura , watching [her]26-laura opportunity , followed [[her]26-laura brother]195-her brother into [[his]195-her brother study]2015-his study , where [he]195-her brother was giving [his]195-her brother last directions to [a servant]1442-a servant , and sending [the man]2017-the man from [the room]104-the room , suddenly put [her]26-laura arms round [[her]26-laura brother]195-her brother ’s neck and appeared to be stifling the sobs which stopped [her]26-laura utterance . “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear child]1192-my dear child — [Laura]26-laura — [sister]1529-sister — what is it ? Speak to [me]0-i — can [I]0-i help [you]1192-my dear child ? Only tell [me]0-i who has grieved [you]1192-my dear child . ” “[906-him] Has [he]906-him not forsaken [me]0-i , [Lawrence]51-lawrence ? Shall [I]0-i ever see [him]906-him again ? ” “[906-him] Who is gone , [Leslie]24-leslie ! is that it ? [I]0-i was afraid something had gone wrong between [you]24-leslie . ” “[0-i] Oh ! [I]0-i have been so wrong ; [I]0-i have acted so foolishly . Only [that little girl]1234-that little girl ’s artful manœuvres bewildered [me]0-i . This very morning [she]1234-that little girl appointed to meet [him]906-him in [the garden]146-the garden , and [I]0-i could not bear it . [I]0-i ...... [I]0-i ...... ” “[24-leslie] [You]24-leslie quarrelled with [him]906-him , did [you]24-leslie ? and is it that which keeps [Elinor]21-elinor up stairs and drives [Leslie]24-leslie away ? But what right had [you]24-leslie to quarrel with [him]906-him ; tell [me]0-i , had [you]24-leslie any ? ” “[24-leslie] What right ! ” said [Laura]26-laura impetuously , “[24-leslie] except that of [a betrothed woman]909-a betrothed woman ? ” “[909-a betrothed woman] Is it so ? ” said [[her]26-laura brother]195-her brother seriously ; “[909-a betrothed woman] in that case [I]0-i have no business to go looking after [prospective votes]910-prospective votes . [My]0-i business is to stay at [home]139-home , and see that [[my]0-i sister]537-my sister has justice done [her]537-my sister . ” But [Laura]26-laura sank almost on [her]26-laura knees , [her]26-laura arms clasping [[her]26-laura brother]195-her brother all the time . “[51-lawrence] Oh ! no , [Lawrence]51-lawrence — no!—don’t ruin [me]0-i quite . Any interferences of that sort would destroy [my]0-i happiness for ever . [He]51-lawrence loves [me]0-i — [he]51-lawrence will return to [me]0-i , but it must be by [his]51-lawrence free will . Could [I]0-i deign to accept a hand that did not bring a heart ...... but the heart is there — it is [mine]0-i — [my]0-i own fault has alienated it for an instant , but if it be left to [itself it]913-itself it will not fail to return . If [he]51-lawrence departs at [my]0-i rash word , [my]0-i penitent word can recall [him]51-lawrence . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i thought [you]0-i implied it was [he]51-lawrence who had left [you]0-i ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i can not measure exactly what [I]0-i say . [I]0-i am distracted . [I]0-i came to tell [you]914-you all . ” “[0-i] Let [me]0-i remain with [you]0-i , [Laura]26-laura ; it will be best . ” “[0-i] No , no ! [I]0-i would not have [him]51-lawrence think [you]0-i know anything that has passed between [us]915-us . Go , dear [Lawrence]51-lawrence , [I]0-i will recall [you]51-lawrence if it prove necessary . All [I]0-i want is to have nothing concealed from [you]51-lawrence on [my]0-i own part , and to be able to trust [[my]0-i brother]482-my brother through good fortune and evil . ” Real tears came into [Laura]26-laura ’s eyes , as though [she]26-laura had been spectatrix of the same scene at a play . [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson was moved , and repeatedly pressed upon [her]26-laura [his]37-mr. chanson offers of assistance . [She]26-laura , however , continued steadily to refuse , and returning with [him]37-mr. chanson to [the hall]187-the hall , suffered [Sir Peter]56-sir peter to think [she]26-laura had been reddening [her]26-laura eyes with sisterly weeping for [him]37-mr. chanson , and at last saw [them]2023-them all depart , and was very glad when [the house]152-the house was finally cleared , and [she]26-laura was at liberty to put the finishing stroke to [her]26-laura plans . [LESLIE]24-leslie ’S anger and despair carried [him]24-leslie to the end of three days , and when those were elapsed , the mild image of [Elinor]21-elinor began to break through [his]24-leslie stormy passions like present moonlight in a sky thick with black clouds . [His]24-leslie own harshness , exercised upon so delicate a feature , shocked [himself]24-leslie ; [her]21-elinor fear , [her]21-elinor courage when [she]21-elinor laid [her]21-elinor soft hand upon [him]24-leslie , [her]21-elinor utter bereavement when [he]24-leslie left [her]21-elinor in the deep wood alone , wounded [his]24-leslie heart . [He]24-leslie believed in all the faults which [he]24-leslie had believed at that moment , but [he]24-leslie began to think [they]2025-they were immeasurably punished by [him]24-leslie ; [he]24-leslie felt [himself]24-leslie [the greater sufferer under that punishment]2026-the greater sufferer under that punishment , and when [his]24-leslie spirit revolted from the idea of receiving again the broken vows which [she]21-elinor had once made [him]24-leslie , [he]24-leslie yet felt impelled to implore [her]21-elinor pardon for the manner in which [he]24-leslie had resented [her]21-elinor perfidy . When [he]24-leslie had persuaded [himself]24-leslie that such was the object which made [him]24-leslie long to see [her]21-elinor again , [he]24-leslie at once gave way to [his]24-leslie desire to do so , and a very short time saw [him]24-leslie again in [the neighbourhood of [Chanson Wood]10-chanson wood]1393-the neighbourhood of chanson wood , haunting [every spot where [he]24-leslie could hope to meet with [Elinor]21-elinor]2028-every spot where he could hope to meet with elinor . But it was all in vain , the cold weather caused all the shutters to be closed with declining daylight , so that [he]24-leslie had no such chance as the summer had afforded [him]24-leslie of investigating the dwellers of [the rooms]1867-the rooms . [No old favourite haunt]2030-no old favourite haunt was visited by [her]21-elinor footstep , no morning or evening hour brought [her]21-elinor out to behold [its]10-chanson wood beauty . [Leslie]24-leslie wandered about for four and twenty hours , and then made [his]24-leslie way to [the house itself]2031-the house itself , and inquired for [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson . [He]24-leslie was not yet come [home]139-home . “[29-miss chanson] [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson ? ” [She]21-elinor was walking in [the flower‐garden]2033-the flower‐garden . [He]24-leslie had not words to ask for [Elinor]21-elinor , but followed [the servant]2008-the servant silently into [the garden]146-the garden , dreading more than wishing that [the two ladies]2036-the two ladies might be together . But no ; [Laura]26-laura only was [there]1176-there . While [the servant]2008-the servant was within hearing , [Leslie]24-leslie ’s tone and manner preserved [their]2036-the two ladies common‐place , but [they]2036-the two ladies were no sooner alone than [he]24-leslie broke out eagerly , “[29-miss chanson] Can [I]0-i see [Miss Ladylift]21-elinor ? ” [Laura]26-laura hesitated . “[21-elinor] What ! [she]21-elinor can not forgive [me]0-i ? ” “[21-elinor] Could [you]0-i forgive [her]21-elinor ? ” “[0-i] [A man]1160-a man has always a right to forgive [a woman]1161-a woman . Where is [she]21-elinor ? ” “[24-leslie] [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie ...... do n’t [you]0-i know ? ” “[919-my god] [[My]0-i God]919-my god ! ” cried [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[919-my god] [I]0-i have killed [her]21-elinor ! ” and [his]24-leslie wild eyes searched and commanded [Laura]26-laura ’s face for the fearful words [he]24-leslie expected . “[0-i] Not so , ” said [Laura]26-laura ; “[0-i] but [she]21-elinor is not [here]1135-here . Before [I]0-i could communicate with [[my]0-i brother]482-my brother , before [I]0-i could reflect what to do , [she]21-elinor insisted on setting out for [[her]21-elinor convent]1219-her convent . ” “[21-elinor] [[Her]21-elinor convent]1219-her convent ? ” “[21-elinor] After [you]924-you were all gone , and [I]0-i returned to [[her]21-elinor room]1295-her room , [she]21-elinor had already made [her]21-elinor preparations , and no efforts of [mine]0-i could detain [her]21-elinor . [I]0-i did what [I]0-i could ; [I]0-i sent to [Mr. Roundel]80-mr. roundel , [you]924-you know [him]80-mr. roundel , [[[my]0-i brother]482-my brother ’s man of business]927-my brother ’s man of business , and requested [him]80-mr. roundel to take charge of [her]21-elinor on [her]21-elinor journey , which [he]80-mr. roundel did . ” “[21-elinor] Tell [me]0-i , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , laying hold of [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson ’s arm , and speaking in a very low voice ; “[21-elinor] was [she]21-elinor willing that [he]482-my brother should go with [her]21-elinor ? ” “[21-elinor] Why ? ” said [Laura]26-laura . “[21-elinor] Was there not another whom [she]21-elinor expected to join [her]21-elinor . ” [Laura]26-laura ’s colour rose to scarlet in‐her face . “[21-elinor] It never occurred to [me]0-i till now , ” [she]26-laura said ; and in truth , [Leslie]24-leslie had suggested an event in the plot which [Laura]26-laura had overlooked in contriving it . “[21-elinor] Where is the companion [you]0-i gave [her]21-elinor ? ” cried [Leslie]24-leslie . “[482-my brother] [He]482-my brother returns to‐morrow ; but surely if what [you]0-i fear had occurred , [I]0-i should have heard it from [him]482-my brother . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i ca n’t tell , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , as if unable to argue , able only to fear and suffer . “[0-i] [I]0-i shall see [him]482-my brother the moment [he]482-my brother comes [home]139-home . Farewell ! [Ours]929-ours has been a troubled intercourse , [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson , ” [he]24-leslie said , offering [his]24-leslie hand ; “[29-miss chanson] forgive [me]0-i much that [you]29-miss chanson have against [me]0-i , and which [you]29-miss chanson will forget when [I]0-i no longer darken [[your]29-miss chanson happy home]930-your happy home . ” So saying , [he]482-my brother turned away and walked up [the garden]146-the garden , [Laura]26-laura pursuing [him]482-my brother with stedfast eyes . “[482-my brother] Does [he]482-my brother think to leave [me]0-i thus ? ” [she]0-i said to [herself]0-i ; “[482-my brother] is all over between [us]931-us , does [he]482-my brother suppose ? and [he]482-my brother goes without a look behind , unconscious that there is a spell upon [him]482-my brother , and of necessity [he]482-my brother must return . ” Then as [she]0-i saw [him]482-my brother ascend the steps of [the terrace]2040-the terrace , [her]0-i eye could not but mark that [he]482-my brother did so with a step very unlike the decided strong movement of [his]482-my brother general pace . “[482-my brother] [He]482-my brother is ill , ” [she]0-i said to [herself]0-i ; “[482-my brother] [I]0-i may lose [him]482-my brother even in trying to win [him]482-my brother . Better even that , than that [he]482-my brother should belong to another . ” The day was by this time dark , and [Laura]26-laura , whose general habits were luxu‐ rious , and who was to be found on cold evenings in [her]26-laura lounging‐chair at the side of a bright fire , [her]26-laura feet upon the warm hearth , abundance of wax light on [her]26-laura marqueterie table , [her]26-laura book , [her]26-laura work , [her]26-laura dress all in keeping , on this night muffled [her]26-laura person in a gray cloak , and going [herself]26-laura to [the stables]1969-the stables , at the time of the hall supper , when [she]26-laura knew [one lad only would be left there]2042-one lad only would be left there , caused [this boy]2043-this boy to prepare [[her]26-laura pony carriage]2044-her pony carriage with uncompromising haste , and , with [him]2043-this boy to drive [her]26-laura , set off in cold and darkness for [Cantleton]7-cantleton , [[the town]301-the town where [Mr. Roundel]80-mr. roundel lived]2046-the town where mr. roundel lived . [She]26-laura had readily answered [Leslie]24-leslie that [he]2043-this boy would return to‐morrow , [her]26-laura instinct being on all occasions to gain time ; but [she]26-laura was perfectly aware [herself]26-laura , that [he]2043-this boy had already been back a whole day , having in fact received from [him]2043-this boy the assurance that [he]2043-this boy had conducted [Elinor]21-elinor to [the convent]127-the convent whither all [Laura]26-laura ’s skill and power had been exerted to make [her]26-laura fly . [She]26-laura had , however , felt in a moment that [she]26-laura must see [him]2043-this boy before [Leslie]24-leslie could do so , and had gained twenty‐four hours by [her]26-laura ready lie . It was ten o’clock before [she]26-laura reached [the town]301-the town ; [she]26-laura had a humiliating part to play , that [she]26-laura felt , but at least [she]26-laura would do it in a grand , unquestionable way , and would come out of [the house]152-the house quite beyond being assailed in person by any remarks which might be made by [its indwellers]2050-its indwellers when [she]26-laura should be gone . Besides , [she]26-laura had brought a sum of money , so considerable ( under the name of paying [Mr. Roundel]80-mr. roundel ’s expenses on [his]80-mr. roundel journey ) that the acceptance of it — and [she]26-laura was quite sure it would be accepted — would constitute an acknowledgment that further services must be rendered in return . Still , while [she]26-laura waited for [him]2043-this boy in [[his]2043-this boy parlour]2051-his parlour , where the fire was out , and the chairs all set back against the wall , [she]26-laura had uneasy beatings at [her]26-laura heart which kept [her]26-laura standing ; and which [she]26-laura thought to subdue when [he]2043-this boy came in , by taking a seat with as much dignity as if [she]26-laura were in [her]26-laura usual position of command . [She]26-laura did not begin with any reference to the strange lateness of the visit , for the cause of it would soon , [she]26-laura knew , seem stranger than the visit itself , but without apology or explanation opened [her]26-laura business . “[932-you] [You]932-you have done [me]0-i a service , [Mr. Roundel]80-mr. roundel , ” [Laura]26-laura began , “[80-mr. roundel] in conveying [that young lady]933-that young lady back to [France]17-france . ” “[80-mr. roundel] Since it was for [your]0-i interest , as [I]0-i understand , ” began [Mr. Roundel]80-mr. roundel . “[933-that young lady] For [her]933-that young lady own , [I]0-i beg it to be understood , ” said [Laura]26-laura . “[0-i] Oh ! certainly , certainly . ” “[0-i] Did [she]933-that young lady seem delighted at returning to [the convent]127-the convent ? ” “[933-that young lady] [I]0-i can hardly say delighted , ” answered [Mr. Roundel]80-mr. roundel . “[933-that young lady] Indeed ! [I]0-i am surprised at that . What could then make [her]933-that young lady wish so much to return ? Did [anybody]262-anybody come to welcome [her]933-that young lady ? ” “[262-anybody] [A maid‐servant]936-a maid‐servant answered the bell when ...... ” “[80-mr. roundel] No ; before [you]80-mr. roundel reached [the convent]127-the convent ? In fact , [Mr. Roundel]80-mr. roundel , [I]0-i have cause to suspect that [her]933-that young lady eagerness for the journey — for the trouble of which , by the by , allow [me]0-i to offer [you]80-mr. roundel this note”—Mr . [Roundel]80-mr. roundel looked at it , and began to understand that [his]80-mr. roundel answers must take some shape which [he]80-mr. roundel did not as yet perceive—“her[933-that young lady] eagerness must be connected with the departure of ...... [you]80-mr. roundel knew [[my]0-i cousin]562-my cousin , [Sir Peter]56-sir peter ? ” [Mr. Roundel]80-mr. roundel bowed assent . “[56-sir peter] [You]80-mr. roundel must be aware that [her]933-that young lady fancy for [this gentleman]939-this gentleman could never be encouraged by [us]940-us ; but it is possible that infatuation on [his]939-this gentleman part ...... ” “[939-this gentleman] Very possible , ” said [Mr. Roundel]80-mr. roundel . “[939-this gentleman] What , [you]80-mr. roundel had reason to suspect ? ” “[80-mr. roundel] Nay , [I]0-i can not deny [I]0-i had [my]0-i suspicion , ” said [Mr. Roundel]80-mr. roundel , thinking that expression would suit whatever came next . “[0-i] Indeed ! and what followed ? ” “[80-mr. roundel] What followed ? ” said [Mr. Roundel]80-mr. roundel . “[80-mr. roundel] Well , to tell the truth , nothing very particular . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i trifle , [sir]372-sir ; if [that young man]942-that young man gave [you]0-i cause to suspect intentions which [she]933-that young lady favoured , [I]0-i conclude that [you]0-i were unable to conduct [your]0-i charge safely to [the convent]127-the convent . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i assure [you]80-mr. roundel , ” answered [Mr. Roundel]80-mr. roundel , hastily , “[0-i] [I]0-i safely delivered [Miss Ladylift]21-elinor into the hands of [the Superior]109-the superior ; what might happen afterwards , [I]0-i can not say . ” “[0-i] Unfortunately , [Mr. Roundel]80-mr. roundel , [I]0-i fear that [I]0-i can . ” “[0-i] Is it possible ? ” said [Mr. Roundel]80-mr. roundel . “[0-i] At all events , [I]0-i discharged [my]0-i duty . ” “[0-i] Undoubtedly , there is no fault of [yours]80-mr. roundel ; but however distressing to [myself]0-i to speak upon such a subject , [I]0-i feel it [my]0-i painful task to mention to [you]80-mr. roundel , that should [any one]215-any one inquire about [her]21-elinor from [you]80-mr. roundel , [you]80-mr. roundel had better put an end at once to any interest taken in [her]21-elinor , by stating that , on too good authority , [you]80-mr. roundel know [her]21-elinor to be unworthy of it . ” “[0-i] Upon [my]0-i soul ! ” said [Mr. Roundel]80-mr. roundel ; “[0-i] and if particulars are asked , [I]0-i can refer ...... ” “[0-i] It is not probable that [I]0-i should enter upon such subjects , ” said [Laura]26-laura , in the most dignified manner ; “[0-i] [I]0-i have already said , perhaps , too much ; and when [I]0-i came to [you]80-mr. roundel , [I]0-i did so as to [a friend]350-a friend , who , [I]0-i trusted , would relieve [me]0-i from the necessity of saying more . ” [Mr. Roundel]80-mr. roundel bowed , and [Laura]26-laura , rising , prepared to depart . “[350-a friend] But if [I]0-i am asked where [I]0-i left [the young lady]947-the young lady , ” said [he]80-mr. roundel , “[0-i] what must [I]0-i say ? ” “[0-i] The truth , [sir]372-sir , ” said [Laura]26-laura , very loftily . “[0-i] What [you]80-mr. roundel [yourself]80-mr. roundel know to have been true as to [her]947-the young lady arrival , and what [you]80-mr. roundel understand from [me]0-i to have been true with respect to [her]947-the young lady subsequent departure . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i understand , ” said [Mr. Roundel]80-mr. roundel , in a very low voice . [Laura]26-laura ’s eyes met [his]372-sir ; then , in a grand way , [she]26-laura requested [his]372-sir pardon for disturbing [him]372-sir at this late hour , and bidding [him]372-sir good‐night , sailed out of [the house]152-the house , [Mr. Roundel]80-mr. roundel following [her]26-laura to [the pony carriage]2053-the pony carriage , and when [she]26-laura was gone shrugging [his]372-sir shoulders , and muttering an epithet [I]0-i will not repeat . The next morning , [Leslie]24-leslie , who had passed the night in walking about [a bedroom of [the inn in [the town]301-the town]2055-the inn in the town]2054-a bedroom of the inn in the town , wandered forth , dragging through the time till [he]24-leslie might inquire when [Mr. Rounder]81-mr. rounder ’s return was likely to take place . “[0-i] [Master]1353-master was already at [home]139-home , ” [the maid]2057-the maid answered , and [Leslie]24-leslie and [he]372-sir soon stood face to face . [Mr. Roundel]80-mr. roundel had thought over the matter , and had resolved in [his]80-mr. roundel own mind that the rich and powerful [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson was [the injured person in this , to [him]80-mr. roundel]2058-the injured person in this , to him , obscure history , and that , on the whole , in adopting [her]29-miss chanson views of it , [he]80-mr. roundel should best consult [his]80-mr. roundel own interests , as well as [her]29-miss chanson wishes . [He]80-mr. roundel therefore scrupled not to give [Leslie]24-leslie the version [Laura]26-laura had taught [him]80-mr. roundel . [Leslie]24-leslie received the story so calmly , and so much as a matter‐of‐fact , that [Mr. Roundel]80-mr. roundel became almost persuaded that [he]80-mr. roundel [himself]80-mr. roundel had been telling the truth . “[951-a very fine young man] [A very fine young man]951-a very fine young man , ” said [he]80-mr. roundel to [himself]80-mr. roundel , when , after thanking and wishing [him]80-mr. roundel good morning , [Leslie]24-leslie disappeared down [the street]2059-the street . “[952-a fine man] [A fine man]952-a fine man , and takes the result of [his]951-a very fine young man adventures quietly ; ” and with that [Mr. Roundel]80-mr. roundel turned back to [[his]80-mr. roundel office]2060-his office . [Leslie]24-leslie meantime reached [the inn]2061-the inn , and wished to inquire what public conveyance would first start on [the road]169-the road to [[his]24-leslie own place]1381-his own place ; but the words which [he]24-leslie found [him‐]24-leslie self using were not those which bore the meaning [he]24-leslie wished to convey . [He]24-leslie tried to frame the name of [the town nearest to [[his]24-leslie own house]2065-his own house]2064-the town nearest to his own house , and spoke as slowly as [he]24-leslie could in order to fasten the sound and the idea together ; but even then [he]24-leslie failed , and perceiving that [he]24-leslie had done so , [he]24-leslie turned away by a great exertion , and forced [his]24-leslie limbs to carry [him]24-leslie a few step ’s ; then a great dizziness came over everything , and stumbling forward upon a seat which [he]24-leslie just descried , [he]24-leslie there lost consciousness of [himself]24-leslie and everything else . [He]24-leslie was known at [the inn]2061-the inn as [the guest of [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson]2067-the guest of mr. chanson , and when [the doctor]2068-the doctor had seen [him]24-leslie , and declared [him]24-leslie dangerously ill with brain fever , and when it became apparent how desirable the presence of [some responsible person]2069-some responsible person might become , [the landlord]2070-the landlord sent information to [Chanson Wood]43-wood of what had happened . [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson had returned the evening before , and [his]37-mr. chanson hospitable nature led [him]37-mr. chanson at once to the desire of receiving [[his]37-mr. chanson sick friend]2071-his sick friend , and to have [him]24-leslie nursed under [his]37-mr. chanson own roof . [Laura]26-laura se‐ conded [him]37-mr. chanson , and looked upon all as the favourable working of [her]26-laura fate , which was relieving [her]26-laura own brain from the necessity of forming further devices for the achievement of [her]26-laura scheme . [A carriage fitted up]2072-a carriage fitted up for bearing [an invalid]2073-an invalid , was despatched with [a handy footman]2074-a handy footman . [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson went on horseback to [the inn]2061-the inn , and before the end of the day , [the unconscious Leslie]2076-the unconscious leslie was conveyed to [Chanson Wood]10-chanson wood ; and lay there helpless , like [one entangled of old in the meshes of a corrupt and beautiful enchantress]2077-one entangled of old in the meshes of a corrupt and beautiful enchantress . The struggle between life and death was more severe and more solemn than [Laura]26-laura had anticipated . It lasted very long , and sometimes forced upon [her]26-laura the real probability of that which [she]26-laura had hitherto put to [herself]26-laura in words only , namely , that [Leslie]24-leslie would die . “[0-i] If [he]953-he should die ? ” [she]26-laura said to [herself]26-laura , believing it , and trembling at what it implied , but [she]26-laura threw off the image , for it was in disagreement with all , the web [she]26-laura had been weaving , and whatever unfavourable report was brought [her]26-laura , attributed its worst gloom to mistake or ignorance , which falsely represented the real state of things . But it was very long before the demon of the fever could be cast out of [Leslie]24-leslie ’s frame , and when at last it was expelled , it left [him]953-he shattered , exhausted , and so utterly devoid of the strong sense of life [he]953-he had hitherto enjoyed , that it seemed to [him]953-he impossible ever to be again [the free , careless , powerful being]2078-the free , careless , powerful being [he]953-he was accustomed to be ; rather , [he]953-he felt that [he]953-he had only escaped the death of fever to go down more slowly , and as surely , into the grave , where all things are dark and at rest .
