[His]953-he mind had begun under the auspices of the pure love with which [Elinor]21-elinor had at last inspired [him]953-he , to have healthier feelings than were habitual to it , of happiness and of virtue ; but the disappointment of [his]953-he newly‐born faith and hope had swept away all the better feelings which grew up with [them]2079-them , and a more gloomy scepticism as to whatever was just and good never darkened any human bosom than that with which [he]953-he got up from [his]953-he long illness . It was now five months since [he]953-he had fallen down unconscious in [the inn at [Cantleton]7-cantleton]2080-the inn at cantleton , and been conveyed by [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson to [[his]953-he own house]2065-his own house . [He]953-he had just become able to walk about , and [his]953-he only desire was to go [home]139-home and die [there]1176-there . [He]953-he felt the burthen of [his]953-he obligations to [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson and [Laura]26-laura , and heartily wished [they]2079-them had left [him]953-he to perish when [he]953-he fell ill , and have neither tormented [him]953-he with a second long process of dying , nor with a debt to [them]2079-them , which nothing [he]953-he could do was able to pay . [He]953-he made efforts beyond [his]953-he present strength in order to get away the sooner , and the re‐action when [he]953-he was alone piled over [his]953-he spirit the mountain weight of its oppression . [Laura]26-laura watched [him]953-he ; and it seemed to [her]26-laura the moment was coming when [she]26-laura might finish [her]26-laura enchantment , and prove whether the spell had been woven strong enough or not . [She]26-laura did not deceive [herself]26-laura as to the fact that [he]953-he loved [her]26-laura not ; [he]953-he was obliged , but not grateful ; [he]953-he was waiting impatiently to leave [her]26-laura , though there was [no one whose society]2084-no one whose society [he]953-he would seek in exchange . [She]26-laura could not talk so as to interest [him]953-he now ; though [he]953-he did [his]953-he best to renew the easy gossip of bygone days . Still [she]26-laura had strong hold on [him]953-he , and knew it . [She]26-laura had kept the secret of [his]953-he engagement to [Elinor]21-elinor inviolable ; and [he]953-he was thankful that it had never reached [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson . [She]26-laura had falsely insinuated to [him]953-he that [her]26-laura own name had been coupled with [his]953-he through [the county]551-the county , and that the result was injurious to [her]26-laura hitherto sacred reputation ; [he]953-he had believed [her]26-laura ; and though [he]953-he said to [himself]953-he the fault was [hers]26-laura , and so must be the penalty , yet it was difficult to feel [himself]953-he in no degree committed ; and , finally , [his]953-he fixed expectation of death and [his]953-he disenchantment with all faith in happiness , persuaded [her]26-laura that [he]953-he would be indifferent to one scheme of life almost as much as to another . It was one early April day that [she]26-laura proposed to [him]953-he to walk for ten minutes in [the garden]146-the garden ; and [he]953-he , eager to prove [himself]953-he strong and independent again , complied . [Laura]26-laura knew how weak was [his]953-he frame , and wondered that [he]953-he could force [himself]953-he to pass and repass so often up and down [the dry gravel walk]2087-the dry gravel walk ; at last , [she]26-laura proposed to rest under a bower which kept off the active breeze of [April]82-april and the bright sunbeam , and [Leslie]24-leslie consenting , [they]2088-they sate down side by side . “[0-i] This short walk is long for [me]0-i , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , “[0-i] but [my]0-i ability to perform it reminds [me]0-i that [I]0-i am able at last to relieve [you]954-you of a burthen which [you]954-you have so kindly supported . To‐morrow [I]0-i will find [my]0-i way [home]139-home . ” “[0-i] If [you]0-i have resolved upon a thing , ” said [Laura]26-laura , “[0-i] [you]0-i will do it ; remonstrance is useless . ” “[0-i] Yes , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[0-i] but it is a kindness in [you]954-you to speed [me]0-i thus . ” “[954-you] The kindness of letting [you]954-you free [yourself]954-you from [my]0-i society without useless contradiction ? [you]954-you can not say yes to that ; social forms forbid [you]954-you ; but honesty forbids [you]954-you to say no . ” “[1752-a dying man] Not so much honesty , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , “[1752-a dying man] as the conviction that [I]0-i am [a dying man]1752-a dying man . [I]0-i can not fence with words at this time ; [I]0-i have strength for nothing but the bare truth , and [I]0-i allow that to die in a dark corner at [home]139-home , is what remains of [my]0-i ambition . ” “[0-i] Alas ! ” said [Laura]26-laura , “[0-i] since [you]0-i say those cruel words , [I]0-i know that [you]0-i mean them ; [I]0-i too have a meaning , ” [she]0-i went on . “[0-i] Nay , do not tell [me]0-i , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , for [he]24-leslie felt [she]0-i had a scene in store , and [he]24-leslie shrank from the trouble of it . “[0-i] There is no meaning , no purpose which has anything to do with [me]0-i , or in which [I]0-i have a part to bear . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i mean , ” said [Laura]26-laura , suddenly , “[0-i] that in [your]0-i death , more die than [you]0-i . ” “[0-i] By no means . [I]0-i was [a pleasant fellow enough last year]958-a pleasant fellow enough last year , but this one , [I]0-i am a mere curtain , a drop‐scene ; when [I]0-i am pulled away , all the stage will be bright again . ” “[75-god] And all this for the sake of [one who is unworthy to be remembered]959-one who is unworthy to be remembered ! ” ejaculated [Laura]26-laura . “[83-one] [One]83-one , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , shuddering , “[83-one] whose name must not be a sound again , for [God]75-god ’s sake . Unspoken as it is , it galvanizes life back to [my]0-i heart . ” “[24-leslie] Forgive [me]0-i , [Leslie]24-leslie , [I]0-i am grieved to have said it . ” “[0-i] Forgive ! ” [he]24-leslie answered , “[0-i] there is much of that needed on all sides — not by [you]0-i , however . These are idle words . ” “[24-leslie] No , not idle , ” said [Laura]26-laura , “[24-leslie] [I]0-i am not without need of forgiveness , though [others]266-others want it more . ” “[24-leslie] Do n’t say so , for [you]0-i do not mean it , nor have [I]0-i wit or strength to unravel [your]0-i feigned humility . In [my]0-i best days [I]0-i always was idle about contradicting those who spoke ill of [themselves]961-themselves . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i are hard , ” said [Laura]26-laura , “[0-i] and oblige [me]0-i to look very narrowly to [my]0-i judgment of [myself]0-i . Perhaps [you]0-i are right ; though [I]0-i may have done a wrong thing , still it is possible that , like [Othello]84-othello , [I]0-i was not the most guilty . ” “[0-i] ‘ More sinned against , than sinning , ’ ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[0-i] [I]0-i told [you]0-i so . ” [Laura]26-laura paused , [she]26-laura thought [he]24-leslie would ask in what [she]26-laura had been sinned against , but [he]24-leslie said nothing , and [she]26-laura was obliged [herself]26-laura to make use of the opportunity [she]26-laura had opened . After a minute ’s silence , therefore [she]26-laura resumed . “[0-i] [Society]962-society makes crimes out of things which are innocent by Nature . When [man]1148-man is in [prosperity]964-prosperity [a woman]1161-a woman is obliged to deny that [his]1148-man good or evil destiny can interest [her]1161-a woman , but when fortune has forsaken [him]1148-man , when [he]1148-man is unhappy , ill , lonely , is it unwomanly then to say [she]1161-a woman feels for [him]1148-man ? ” “[1161-a woman] Alas ! ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , “[1161-a woman] [I]0-i am not deserving of one kind feeling . [I]0-i tell [you]966-you truly that [I]0-i can not rouse [one]1228-one in return , for [any human creature]968-any human creature . Who could , when [his]1148-man grave was dug , [his]1148-man shroud making ? ” “[24-leslie] Do not talk thus , [Leslie]24-leslie ; even were it true , [a woman]1161-a woman , were [she]1161-a woman [friend]970-friend , [sister]1529-sister , [wife]513-wife , would know no comfort , except to watch and support every step which remained of [his]1148-man earthly career to [one in such trouble]973-one in such trouble . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am no judge of that , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , smiling ; “[0-i] [I]0-i think , however for [my]0-i own part , that [I]0-i am like an unsociable lion , who stalks into [the wilderness]974-the wilderness to die , and leaves the lionesses to enjoy [themselves]975-themselves in [the world]1134-the world again , when [he]1148-man is gone . ” “[0-i] [The world]1134-the world , ” said [Laura]26-laura , forcing back conversation to a grave tone , “[0-i] looks to [you]978-you for its opinion of [me]0-i . ” “[0-i] Nay , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , “[0-i] it can not be so unjust . ” “[0-i] Can not be ! ” cried [Laura]26-laura ; “[0-i] why use that vain phrase when nothing is more certain than that it is ? But heed it not . It is fair , [I]0-i know that [the woman who has ventured to feel unasked]979-the woman who has ventured to feel unasked should learn to the uttermost how [she]979-the woman who has ventured to feel unasked has offended the pride of [man]1148-man . ” “[979-the woman who has ventured to feel unasked] On the contrary , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , “[979-the woman who has ventured to feel unasked] [our]981-our manly phrase is that [we]981-our are much flattered by such generosity . ” “[0-i] And [your]0-i meaning is that , [you]0-i despise it . ” “[0-i] That depends upon whether it gives pleasure . For [my]0-i part , ” [he]24-leslie went on , “[982-she] [she]982-she whom [I]0-i loved is dead , [she]982-she is as if dead , and that deadness has spread over [me]0-i , so that [I]0-i am already [a mere citizen of [that quiet country]984-that quiet country , from returning to which [I]0-i have been unblessed with a short respite]983-a mere citizen of that quiet country , from returning to which i have been unblessed with a short respite . Let [us]981-our talk no more . ” “[0-i] Yes , [I]0-i must say what [I]0-i have to say ; [I]0-i am wrong to do so , but [your]0-i desolate words wring it from [me]0-i . [I]0-i liked [you]0-i prosperous , [I]0-i love [you]0-i miserable ; answer what [you]0-i will , these are plain words — [I]0-i can not deceive . ” “[0-i] Oh no ! [I]0-i can never be deceived again , [I]0-i can never feel again . [I]0-i tell [you]0-i truly , those words of yours leave [me]0-i unmoved , therefore unsay them . [I]0-i can easily forget . ” “[0-i] No , [Leslie]24-leslie , they are as true as that [they]985-they have been spoken . ” “[985-they] [They]985-they have a meaning , certainly , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , “[985-they] but hardly that which [they]985-they bear at first sight . Let [us]986-us understand [each other]1279-each other : do [you]0-i believe that [busy bodies]988-busy bodies would respect [you]0-i more if [you]0-i bore [my]0-i name ? [A dying man]1752-a dying man ’s name is not much to give . ” “[24-leslie] [Leslie]24-leslie , can [you]24-leslie think , that even if [the world]1134-the world has been so unjust , ( and so it may have been ) , such selfish thoughts can prompt [me]0-i in what [I]0-i say ? ” “[0-i] Call [them]985-they by some other title than selfish thoughts , and they seem a fair motive enough . Only be honest with [yourself]0-i ; confess to [yourself]0-i that [you]0-i are moved by some such motive , and that [you]0-i know [I]0-i am so indifferent to [the whole world]991-the whole world that [I]0-i can not love nor esteem [any member of it]992-any member of it ; nay , that kind words , such as [you]24-leslie have used , pain or annoy [me]0-i , more than any amount of indifference . ” “[24-leslie] [You]24-leslie hate [me]0-i for [them]985-they , ” said [Laura]26-laura . “[24-leslie] No , [I]0-i can not hate , [I]0-i can not love ; it is to [me]0-i as if [you]24-leslie said [my]0-i name could be useful to [you]24-leslie , and as if [I]0-i hesitated whether to give it or not . Can [you]24-leslie still wish it ? ” “[24-leslie] Can [I]0-i do otherwise ? ” said [Laura]26-laura . “[24-leslie] Yet reflect : should [you]24-leslie not buy too dear the suppression of certain rumours which [you]24-leslie say exist , if to attain that end , [you]24-leslie must undertake to walk by [a dying man]1752-a dying man to [his]1752-a dying man grave ? ” “[24-leslie] [Leslie]24-leslie , [you]24-leslie know [me]0-i , or affect to know [me]0-i very little . [I]0-i have said the word which once [you]24-leslie almost said to [me]0-i , [I]0-i have truly said it ; [you]24-leslie knew long since , that [you]24-leslie were dear to [me]0-i — [you]24-leslie forget it — it was indifferent to [you]24-leslie . It was not [I]0-i who forgot it , and now , when all forsake [you]24-leslie , [I]0-i say again , [I]0-i love [you]24-leslie . ” “[0-i] Remember , even those words leave [my]0-i heart unmoved . [Laura]26-laura forgive [me]0-i , but [I]0-i seem to [myself]0-i like the statue of stone , upon taking whose hand [we]994-we have all seen such unpleasant consequences ensue at the opera . ” “[0-i] Can [you]24-leslie jest ? ” said [Laura]26-laura . “[24-leslie] No , [I]0-i will not — [I]0-i will calculate . [I]0-i hear those strange words of [yours]24-leslie comparing them with scenes which [I]0-i confess remain in [my]0-i memory . [I]0-i reflect on the evil [you]24-leslie say [the world]1134-the world has cast on [you]24-leslie . [I]0-i repeat that [I]0-i feel nothing , and that what [I]0-i do , or what [I]0-i forbear is indifferent to [me]0-i . And after that — if [you]24-leslie will — be [[my]0-i wife]603-my wife . ” [Laura]26-laura held out [her]26-laura hand , [he]24-leslie took it ; not as [a friend]350-a friend takes [[his]350-a friend friend]2090-his friend ’s , not as [a lover]1429-a lover grasps that of [[his]24-leslie mistress]2092-his mistress ; but [he]24-leslie laid [his]24-leslie palm upon the back of [her]26-laura hand , and rising , led [her]26-laura silently towards [the house]152-the house . Pale , unanimated , uncongenial , [these two]2094-these two went slowly along the walk , while the clouds of a suddenly overcast spring sky veiled the light of the day . It was like [Adam]67-adam and [Eve]68-eve wandering through [the world]1134-the world after [they]2094-these two were cast out of [Paradise]15-paradise . Next day [Leslie]24-leslie told [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson of [his]37-mr. chanson engagement with [Laura]26-laura , and departed to [[his]37-mr. chanson own house]2065-his own house . All approach to tenderness on the part of [Laura]26-laura , [he]37-mr. chanson treated as if it aid not exist , and [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson , [a matter‐of‐fact man]2097-a matter‐of‐fact man , was completely puzzled . But [Laura]26-laura was contented . The project which had seemed almost impossible was executed ; and when [she]26-laura pondered over the situation in which [she]26-laura found [herself]26-laura , [she]26-laura shut [her]26-laura eyes upon the fact that [Leslie]24-leslie ’s misery was [her]26-laura own creation , and dwelt upon that of attaching [herself]26-laura to [an un‐ happy and suffering man]2098-an un‐ happy and suffering man , till [she]26-laura believed that [she]26-laura was both generous and unselfish in so doing . [Leslie meantime]24-leslie reached [the Tower]2099-the tower in a state of perfect exhaustion , and [he]37-mr. chanson thought with pleasure that the next tidings [Laura]26-laura would receive of [[her]26-laura bridegroom]2100-her bridegroom , would be in the formal style , and on the formal deep‐edged paper of [the undertaker]2101-the undertaker . [He]37-mr. chanson sank into a stupified sleep , at the length of which [the few servants in [[his]37-mr. chanson house]1519-his house]2102-the few servants in his house were too uninterested in [[their]2102-the few servants in his house master]2104-their master to wonder , and probably did [him]37-mr. chanson the best service in [their]2102-the few servants in his house power by neglect . [He]37-mr. chanson woke and wondered that [he]37-mr. chanson did so , and now without rule and without physic , proceeded to live or die , just as day by day might determine . [His]37-mr. chanson time was passed in the most absolute solitude , so that through the twenty‐four hours [he]37-mr. chanson would sometimes not find occasion to utter a word ; [he]37-mr. chanson would lie at length on an easy chair , [his]37-mr. chanson gloomy eyes fixed on one spot , or wander into the air , and out of sight , [nobody]1225-nobody knew whether afar off , or just hidden by the first great tree , or projecting buttress of the old wall ; and here suffering [his]37-mr. chanson ideas to come or go as they would , the gloom of [his]37-mr. chanson mind seemed to settle thicker and thicker , as weary day was added to weary day . To [himself]37-mr. chanson [he]37-mr. chanson appeared drifting into that dark chaos , which , as [he]37-mr. chanson believed surrounded on all sides the brief light of conscious being ; and the impression was the stronger , because [he]37-mr. chanson had lost entirely the activity of those mental faculties which had hitherto been [his]37-mr. chanson pride and pleasure . [He]37-mr. chanson never read , never composed , never remembered the images with which former reading had stored [his]37-mr. chanson mind . Nature was uninteresting . There was sound without music ; forms , but no beauty ; actions , but no crime , and no virtue . Even the bitter past was not enough to account for [his]37-mr. chanson total shipwreck ; [he]37-mr. chanson was convinced as fully as if it had been matter‐of‐fact , that the near approach of dissolution it was which thus covered [him]37-mr. chanson over with shadow . In this mental condition , [he]37-mr. chanson wrote several times to [Laura]26-laura , to break off the engagement [she]26-laura had taken on [herself]26-laura . To [him]37-mr. chanson it was a matter of indifference , but to [her]26-laura it would plainly be mere misery . [Laura]26-laura , however , heeded no more what [he]37-mr. chanson said about [himself]37-mr. chanson than [she]26-laura had heeded the evil reports of [the physician]2106-the physician , when [he]37-mr. chanson was ill at [Chanson Wood]10-chanson wood . [She]26-laura had [her]26-laura own intemperate hallucination about [Leslie]24-leslie , which had begun in fancy , went on in jealousy , and was confirmed by the measures into which [she]26-laura had thrown [her]26-laura conscience , and [her]26-laura very soul , to secure [him]24-leslie . It was not likely that [she]26-laura should stop now . If a thing could be done twice , it would very seldom be done the second time . But [the girl who marries for money]2107-the girl who marries for money must reach the enjoyment of coaches , respect , and fine clothes before — if it were to be done again — [she]26-laura would not do it ; [the man who sets [his]37-mr. chanson fancy on power]2108-the man who sets his fancy on power , must have possessed the pride of governing , and the homage of [the multitude]2109-the multitude , before [he]37-mr. chanson can tell whether the sacrifices made for it were worth while . In the same way , [Laura]26-laura , with a mind incapable of self‐control or self‐sacrifice , acknow‐ ledged no alternative except being [the wife of [Leslie]24-leslie]1550-the wife of leslie ; and thus , under gloomy auspices , [their]2111-their marriage was privately celebrated in [the drawing‐room of [Chanson Wood]10-chanson wood]2112-the drawing‐room of chanson wood , during the month of November of this year . [LESLIE]24-leslie ’S excuse to [himself]24-leslie for marrying as [he]24-leslie did , was the ever present conviction that [he]24-leslie must die . But for that sick state of mind [he]24-leslie could have done no such thing . [He]24-leslie believed [the world]1134-the world to be closed upon [him]24-leslie , and circumstances drifting [him]24-leslie towards [Laura]26-laura , [he]24-leslie had wearily yielded [himself]24-leslie to [them]2114-them for the few months [he]24-leslie expected to know the last of life , and its society . Time , however , as [any one more accustomed to illness]2115-any one more accustomed to illness would have anticipated , produced a gradual amelioration ; and it was with reluctance that [Leslie]24-leslie found [himself]24-leslie compelled to acknowledge a renewal of the life which [his]24-leslie will was ever prompt to lay down . The commonplace matters of [a household in which [he]24-leslie was called to act]2116-a household in which he was called to act , did [him]24-leslie good . [A detected poacher]2117-a detected poacher , for instance , [a cheating tradesman]2118-a cheating tradesman , [a groom who neglected a horse]2119-a groom who neglected a horse ; and [he]24-leslie would have been ashamed to suffer the intellectual despair which consumed [him]24-leslie , to show itself among [practical men]2120-practical men , or domestics of [[his]24-leslie house]1519-his house . [He]24-leslie had letters to write about ordering claret , or paying for a dog‐cart , and not deigning to ask assistance , performed these commonplace tasks , and found they made inroads on [the army of [[his]24-leslie phantoms]2123-his phantoms]2122-the army of his phantoms . When [he]24-leslie mounted [his]24-leslie horse again , the familiar exercise was useful to [him]24-leslie , and the first animal [he]24-leslie rode being excessively perverse and obstinate , [he]24-leslie had no time to meditate by brook sides , or through [shadowy lanes]2124-shadowy lanes . Thus through the winter [he]24-leslie went on resuming [his]24-leslie intellectual health , though the moral sank to a lower and lower tone , as [he]24-leslie continually reflected on the dream of innocence and virtue which had existed only to make [him]24-leslie the dupe of [a girl of seventeen]2125-a girl of seventeen . [That false girl]2126-that false girl was ever present to [his]24-leslie ideas , [he]24-leslie repented [his]24-leslie forbear‐ ance , [he]24-leslie imaged [her]2126-that false girl to [himself]24-leslie in the society [she]2126-that false girl had chosen , [he]24-leslie analysed over and over the apparent guilelessness , the exquisite innocence of [her]2126-that false girl demeanour , baffled how to reconcile them with what [he]24-leslie knew of [her]2126-that false girl treason . “[0-i] But did not [I]0-i [myself]0-i bid [her]997-her follow [[her]997-her soldier]998-her soldier , if [he]998-her soldier would have [her]997-her ? ” [he]24-leslie repeated to [himself]24-leslie . “[0-i] Heaven ! how infinitely far was [I]0-i from believing such a coarse word could resemble the truth . ” [He]24-leslie had more thoroughly believed that [he]24-leslie was speaking the truth , when [he]24-leslie told [Laura]26-laura , that in marrying [her]26-laura , [she]26-laura was perfectly indifferent to [him]24-leslie . So [she]26-laura was indeed , and very soon did [Laura]26-laura , after reaching the point [she]26-laura had allowed to dazzle [her]26-laura , begin the descent which led away from that glittering height . All [her]26-laura life [she]26-laura had so far taken pleasure in being popular , as to make [people]272-people as comfortable as [she]26-laura readily could ; [[her]26-laura brother]195-her brother ’s habits and fancies , [[her]26-laura cousin]1554-her cousin ’s whims and wishes , [she]26-laura had never traversed , nay , much more had promoted , and this same patronising and good‐ humoured compliance [she]26-laura was now quite willing to extend to [[her]26-laura husband]552-her husband . But in return [she]26-laura had hitherto got gratitude and worship , and had been exalted to the place of oracle in all matters which admitted a reference . There was a difference now ; for [she]26-laura had become [the companion of [a man excessively [her]26-laura superior]2132-a man excessively her superior , whose time and habits were spent on objects which required rather [her]26-laura exclusion than [her]26-laura assistance]2131-the companion of a man excessively her superior , whose time and habits were spent on objects which required rather her exclusion than her assistance . [She]26-laura attempted changes , but found quickly that the ways of [the house]152-the house must be the ways of [the master]2134-the master ; and that there was an unbending will in this respect which stopped [her]26-laura at once . To gain the upper hand , [she]26-laura tried jealousy , [she]26-laura tried sickness , [she]26-laura tried magnanimity , but all in vain ; [Leslie]24-leslie kept [her]26-laura to [her]26-laura bargain , that in marrying [him]24-leslie , it was [her]26-laura whim and fancy which were gratified . “[26-laura] [Poor Laura]26-laura ” [he]24-leslie said to himself,“I[26-laura] promised [her]26-laura [I]0-i would die , and here [she]26-laura is suffering all the penalties of believing [me]0-i . [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i intended it . ” [Laura]26-laura ’s goodhumour soon gave way to these trials ; [her]26-laura next effort was anger , passion , reproach ; but to those [he]24-leslie put an authoritative stop . Love was far from [them]2135-them both [he]24-leslie knew ; but ridicule should be equally far ; an outer decorum should prevail in [[his]24-leslie house]1519-his house ; and as for the rest , were not [women]1158-women proved to [him]24-leslie to be creatures undeserving respect , incapable of goodness ? Rather more than a twelvemonth had passed since [their]2135-them ill‐omened marriage ; and however apparent the unsuitableness of [Laura]26-laura ’s character became , the secret of [her]26-laura machinations remained undiscovered . In the early days of [her]26-laura marriage , the apprehension that some chance might reveal it , had continually haunted [her]26-laura . Every letter which [she]26-laura saw [Leslie]24-leslie reading made [her]26-laura anxious ; [she]26-laura watched [his]24-leslie face for the sudden lighting of discovery ; [she]26-laura dreaded when [he]24-leslie put it by and said nothing about the contents , that suspicion had been excited which [he]24-leslie would silently follow out ; [she]26-laura examined [his]24-leslie letters before they reached [him]24-leslie , if [she]26-laura found it possible to do so ; and made pretexts , which afforded mirth to [the servants’‐hall]2138-the servants’‐hall , to look at the addresses of those which [he]24-leslie left for [the post]2139-the post ; every acquaintance awakened [her]26-laura fears , lest some chance word should reveal the real position of those whom [she]26-laura had represented under such false colours ; and in [her]26-laura anxiety and alarm , [she]26-laura had invented many ingenious excuses for avoiding communication with all who could by any chance be acquainted with [the persons and circumstances of the past months]2140-the persons and circumstances of the past months . But as time went by and no revelation took place , as [Leslie]24-leslie remained unaltered , and no kind of allusion to the past ever arose between [them]2141-them , the silence in which all was involved began to give [her]26-laura confidence , and that which might have happened at any moment , and which did not happen , seemed like a thing gone into oblivion , which never could possess a tangible shape again . [Laura]26-laura grew bold in impunity , and then followed the reflection that [she]26-laura had secured the position [she]26-laura now occupied beyond the power even of discovery to dispossess [her]26-laura . By degrees [she]26-laura began to feel as if the very discovery would have its advantages . There would be at least a momentary triumph , in showing how [she]26-laura had outwitted [Leslie]24-leslie ; and when [his]24-leslie superiority weighed upon [her]26-laura , unsoftened by any kindness on [his]24-leslie part , there would arise a longing on [her]26-laura ’s , to show that [she]26-laura had once baffled [his]24-leslie talents , and possessed [herself]26-laura of a place from which no efforts of [his]24-leslie could now remove [her]26-laura . It was a heavy secret , which [she]26-laura dreaded to betray , yet found it difficult to keep , and which would come almost into the shape of words occasionally , yet shrink back in terror when there arose a real chance that it should escape . In this uneasy state , irritation arose out of many a trivial circumstance ; harsh words were said on [her]26-laura side ; cold scorn of them was implied on [his]24-leslie ; [he]24-leslie forgot them , and was neither more nor less annoyed by [the companion who had forced [herself]2142-the companion who had forced herself upon him than he had expected to be upon [him]24-leslie than [he]24-leslie had expected to be]2142-the companion who had forced herself upon him than he had expected to be ; [his]24-leslie interests were all apart from [her]26-laura , and were tinctured by the gloomy atmosphere which still clouded [his]24-leslie spirits . The habits of [his]24-leslie mind made [him]24-leslie resort as necessarily to reading , as [his]24-leslie bodily appetite to food ; but the only subjects which could fix [his]24-leslie attention were the stern expression of great passion , the details of strong purpose and of grand crimes — whatever was bitter towards [man]1148-man , whatever lowered human nature , [he]24-leslie dwelt upon , and thence broke away to [his]24-leslie own gloomy reflections , pursuing the phantom of past faith and hope to [their]2144-their disappearance , and racking [himself]24-leslie against the problem of [Elinor]21-elinor ’s character and conduct ( as they appeared to [him]24-leslie ) , which it baffled [him]24-leslie to explain . [He]24-leslie wearied [himself]24-leslie with restless exercise , and sought the reality or the semblance of danger as a means of forgetting for a while [his]24-leslie vain longing for the past ; and [his]24-leslie hatred of the present . Miserable , but resolutely silent , [he]24-leslie lived through the days . In these circumstances [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson found [them]2144-their , when , in the end of the autumn following [their]2144-their marriage , [he]24-leslie re‐ turned from [a moor belonging to [him]24-leslie in [Scotland]19-scotland]2145-a moor belonging to him in scotland , and came to pay a visit at [the Tower]16-the tower . [He]24-leslie saw nothing that was going wrong ; outer forms were carefully observed , and [he]24-leslie was satisfied with the smooth surface which was presented to [his]24-leslie eye ; the bitter words which [Laura]26-laura could not restrain , were unanswered by [[her]26-laura husband]552-her husband , or made to pass for jests ; the complaints [she]26-laura suggested were unreasonable ; and [[her]26-laura brother]195-her brother , who , in the midst of all [his]195-her brother admiration , had sometimes felt [her]26-laura government rather a severe one , secretly applauded the manner in which [Leslie]24-leslie reigned so absolutely , yet without any ostentation of dominion . [He]24-leslie was well pleased with [his]24-leslie reception , with the amusements of [the wild and extended country]2148-the wild and extended country , and finding [himself]24-leslie alone with [[his]24-leslie sister]1508-his sister and [[his]24-leslie brother‐in‐law]2150-his brother‐in‐law , [his]24-leslie talk flowed more freely than it did when tramelled by society . [They]2151-they were all three one afternoon upon [the terrace of [the Tower]2099-the tower]2152-the terrace of the tower , where [the building wanted most repair]2154-the building wanted most repair , and where [Leslie]24-leslie had arranged some plans of alteration . [Laura]26-laura was very much opposed to these ; [she]26-laura had always drawn the elevation of [[[her]26-laura brother]195-her brother ’s cottages]2156-her brother ’s cottages , and had as constantly met with unbounded applause ; and when [she]26-laura first heard of the necessity of building at [the Tower]2099-the tower , [she]26-laura had prepared a drawing of battlements and loopholes , which [Leslie]24-leslie negatived at once . The subject had been ever since a sore one , and [Leslie]24-leslie avoided it as much as possible . To‐day [he]24-leslie had been far from willing to make this spot the scene of [their]2151-they saunter , but [Laura]26-laura , who was in a bad temper , knew no ease till [she]26-laura had got [[her]26-laura brother]195-her brother [there]1176-there , and could vent [her]26-laura discontent . “[0-i] [I]0-i should not wish [this picturesque building]999-this picturesque building spoiled , ” said [Laura]26-laura ; “[1000-you] should [you]1000-you , [Lawrence]51-lawrence ? ” “[51-lawrence] No , who would ? ” “[1001-we] [We]1001-we do n’t agree about the way of restoring it , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . “[1001-we] No ; [I]0-i incline for preserving the character of [the building]1002-the building . [I]0-i do n’t see any reason for destroying a beautiful thing , merely because [another person]321-another person wishes to preserve it . ” “[0-i] Look here , [Lawrence]51-lawrence , ” said [[his]51-lawrence host]2160-his host ; “[51-lawrence] this fragment of a wall fell when [I]0-i was [a boy]1560-a boy , climbing [the Tower]16-the tower . [It]999-this picturesque building and [I]0-i came down together . ” “[999-this picturesque building] And [you]0-i not killed ? ” said [the Squire]1324-the squire . “[0-i] So it seems , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . “[0-i] Is that the reason , ” asked [Laura]26-laura ; “[1000-you] why [you]1000-you mean to leave [the Tower]2099-the tower with a great rent in [it]2099-the tower ? ” “[1000-you] But [I]0-i do n’t mean to do so . ” “[0-i] Nay , the other day when [I]0-i showed [you]1000-you [my]0-i idea of the restoration , [I]0-i understood [you]1000-you to say it did not suit [you]1000-you to do anything to [the Tower]16-the tower . ” “[1000-you] Pardon [me]0-i , [I]0-i did not feel the merit of [your]1000-you suggestion ; but [I]0-i was and am aware , that restoration of some kind is essential . ” “[0-i] When do [you]0-i mean to begin building , ” said [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson . “[0-i] [I]0-i have not thought much about it , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . “[0-i] Then [you]1000-you may leave it to [me]0-i . [I]0-i have thought , and [I]0-i have a right to do as [I]0-i please with a part , at least , of the expenditure of [the house]152-the house . ” “[0-i] What is [your]0-i meaning ? ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . “[0-i] Once [I]0-i could do as [I]0-i pleased with all that was then [my]0-i own . ” “[0-i] That ’s a strange observation , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[0-i] let [us]1007-us speak of it this once , because [[your]1000-you brother]869-your brother is [here]1135-here . [Lawrence]51-lawrence , [I]0-i beg of [you]51-lawrence to say whether the implied reproach is well founded . ” “[51-lawrence] [Laura]26-laura , [[my]0-i dear]1127-my dear , really [I]0-i am obliged to acknowledge that for once [you]26-laura are wrong . [Leslie]24-leslie ’s magnificence to [you]26-laura ...... do recollect ! ” “[24-leslie] Wrong ? did [you]0-i ever say such a word as that to [me]0-i , while [I]0-i was so happy in [[your]26-laura house]1011-your house . ” “[0-i] One more word , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[26-laura] be just with [yourself]26-laura . In bringing [you]26-laura [here]1135-here , did [I]0-i deceive [you]26-laura ? ” “[0-i] Oh , dear no ! [I]0-i am not so easily blinded as [others]266-others are who boast very much of [their]266-others penetration . ” “[266-others] What are [you]0-i saying or meaning , ” said [[her]0-i brother]195-her brother , who observed [Leslie]24-leslie ’s heightened colour at this last thrust , and the sudden compression of [his]195-her brother stern lips . In fact , [he]195-her brother understood [Laura]26-laura to allude to [his]195-her brother fatal secret with regard to [Elinor]21-elinor , which [she]0-i had hitherto kept from [[her]0-i brother]195-her brother , but which [he]195-her brother would prefer at once revealing , to having it held out as a threat whenever [she]0-i might lose [her]0-i temper . “[0-i] It is quite true , ” said [he]195-her brother to [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson , “[0-i] that [I]0-i was strangely deceived by one to whom [[your]0-i sister]474-your sister alludes . ” “[24-leslie] No , no , [Leslie]24-leslie ! ” cried [Laura]26-laura ; “[0-i] [I]0-i did not mean that . ” “[0-i] What do [you]0-i mean ? What does [anybody]262-anybody mean ? ” said [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson . “[262-anybody] It is best to cast away secrets , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[262-anybody] who could bear one clinging about [him]1016-him like a poisoned shirt ? [That young girl]1017-that young girl ...... ” “[1017-that young girl] What ! [Elinor]21-elinor ? ” said [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson ; “[21-elinor] nay , [Laura]26-laura told [me]0-i all about [her]1017-that young girl the very day [we]1018-we parted , when [Peter]56-sir peter took the place with [me]0-i which [you]0-i threw up , and went [I]0-i know not where ...... but what does it matter ? [Laura]26-laura forgave [you]0-i . ” “[26-laura] Forgave [me]0-i ? ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . “[0-i] Well , whatever word [lovers]1019-lovers please to use . [You]0-i were reconciled at all events , for here [you]0-i are [man]1148-man and [wife]513-wife . ” “[513-wife] Do choose some other topic for discussion , ” said [Laura]26-laura ; “[56-sir peter] [I]0-i will explain what [he]56-sir peter means presently , ” [she]0-i added , in a low voice to [Leslie]24-leslie . “[56-sir peter] No , allow [me]0-i to understand [[your]0-i brother]869-your brother , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[0-i] [I]0-i remember the day perfectly , but being absent , [you]0-i know , [I]0-i was not aware of the movements of [the rest of the party]1023-the rest of the party . [[Your]0-i nephew]1024-your nephew took [my]0-i place ? ” “[1024-your nephew] [He]1024-your nephew did . [Laura]26-laura persuaded [him]1024-your nephew . ” “[26-laura] Yes , ” said [Laura]26-laura ; “[26-laura] [they]1025-they travelled part of [their]1025-they journey together . Now , [Lawrence]51-lawrence , [you]51-lawrence promised to walk to [the brook]1245-the brook . Let [us]1025-they go , or it will be too late . ” “[51-lawrence] Well , if [you]0-i wish it , ” said [[her]26-laura brother]195-her brother ; but [Leslie]24-leslie interposed . “[51-lawrence] Did [you]0-i ever learn where [Sir Peter]56-sir peter went when [you]0-i parted ? ” “[56-sir peter] To [Ceylon]12-ceylon , [man]1148-man ! [We]1025-they all know that .. ” “[56-sir peter] But in the interval between the time when [you]0-i parted from [him]56-sir peter and [he]56-sir peter set out , are [you]0-i aware where [he]56-sir peter went ? ” “[0-i] Nowhere at all , ” answered [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson , “[0-i] except where [I]0-i went . [I]0-i never did part with [him]56-sir peter till [he]56-sir peter went abroad . How could [he]56-sir peter go anywhere ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i heard a very different tale , ” said [Laura]26-laura . “[0-i] That ’s unaccountable , ” said [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson ; “[0-i] why , [you]0-i know very well that [I]0-i went to [sea]1028-sea with [him]56-sir peter for a dozen miles , and came back in [[Mendip]86-mendip ’s yacht]1029-mendip ’s yacht . ” “[0-i] Are [you]0-i sure , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie to [Laura]26-laura in the commonplace tone of conversation ; “[0-i] that [you]0-i did hear a different account ? ” “[0-i] Did not [you]0-i ? ” said [Laura]26-laura , in an abrupt , scornful voice . “[0-i] Yes . [I]0-i was told another . ” “[0-i] And believed it , ” whispered [Laura]26-laura , under [her]26-laura breath . [Leslie]24-leslie looked at [her]26-laura fixedly . [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson went on speaking . “[0-i] [Peter]56-sir peter was sorry enough that [his]56-sir peter visit was at an end . [He]56-sir peter was [a great admirer of [Laura]26-laura]1030-a great admirer of laura , and in a lesser degree of [Elinor]21-elinor also . It was a pity [she]21-elinor could not marry [him]56-sir peter . ” “[21-elinor] Do [you]0-i speak so easily of what passed ? ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . “[0-i] Why not ? if [she]21-elinor had liked [him]56-sir peter it would have been all very well . ” “[21-elinor] [She]21-elinor had no mind to marry [so poor a man]1031-so poor a man , ” said [Laura]26-laura . “[21-elinor] [Poor little thing]1032-poor little thing ! Any fate would have been better than shutting [herself]21-elinor up in [the nunnery]1033-the nunnery , ” said [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson ; “[21-elinor] [I]0-i often think of [her]21-elinor . ” “[0-i] [She]21-elinor is there ? ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , in a voice of perfect composure , and [Laura]26-laura could not but start at the self‐command which enabled [him]24-leslie to catch at the revelation [[her]26-laura brother]195-her brother was unconsciously making without betraying that it was new to [him]24-leslie . “[21-elinor] Certainly ; it was entirely [her]21-elinor own choice to go there , was not it , [Laura]26-laura ? ” “[21-elinor] [Her]21-elinor own , solely , [I]0-i suppose [we]1034-we must conclude , ” said [Laura]26-laura . “[21-elinor] [You]1035-you hear of [her]21-elinor sometimes ? ” asked [Leslie]24-leslie . “[1035-you] Yes ; every three months [an ecclesiastic connected with the establishment]1036-an ecclesiastic connected with the establishment acknowledges [my]0-i remittance of [her]21-elinor little income . It is little , indeed , but since [she]21-elinor has chosen that life , [they]1037-they tell [me]0-i it is better not to add to it . ” “[1037-they] [You]1035-you have never failed to hear from [him]1038-him ? ” asked [Leslie]24-leslie . “[1037-they] No , except when [I]0-i was absent from [home]139-home . [Laura]26-laura had the letter then . Did not [she]26-laura mention it ? ” “[26-laura] Not [I]0-i , ” said [Laura]26-laura ; “[26-laura] was it worth while ? [I]0-i am tired of the subject — [I]0-i am cold . [I]0-i shall go in ...... ” and [she]26-laura departed , walking leisurely towards [the house]152-the house . “[0-i] [I]0-i see how it is , ” said [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson ; “[0-i] [Laura]26-laura has not quite forgotten the fit of jealousy which [Elinor]21-elinor caused [her]26-laura , but take no notice of it . [Women]1158-women are naturally unreasonable , and must be allowed for . ” “[1158-women] In what have [I]0-i given [her]26-laura cause ? ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . “[0-i] Oh ! [I]0-i am alluding to the time before [your]0-i marriage , to [your]0-i great quarrel , when [we]1041-we all parted . ” “[26-laura] [She]26-laura complained to [you]0-i ? ” “[26-laura] No , no ! do n’t think it ; but seeing [her]26-laura so unhappy , [I]0-i could not but inquire the cause , and then , for the first time [I]0-i learned [your]0-i engagement , and [her]26-laura fears that [Elinor]21-elinor had entangled [you]0-i , though in love all the time [herself]26-laura with [young Bicester]56-sir peter . ” “[26-laura] All that , [she]26-laura told [you]0-i ? ” “[26-laura] Yes . ” “[26-laura] Indeed ! ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[26-laura] never mind . [I]0-i begin to understand . And [Sir Peter]56-sir peter , what did [he]56-sir peter say ? ” “[56-sir peter] [I]0-i never said much to [him]56-sir peter on the subject . But in what little [he]56-sir peter did , say , [he]56-sir peter alleged in [his]56-sir peter own excuse that having learned [your]0-i engagement to [Laura]26-laura , from [Laura]26-laura [herself]26-laura , [he]56-sir peter thought [himself]56-sir peter entitled to make love to [Elinor]21-elinor , as [you]0-i had no right to do so — all the time acknowledging that [she]26-laura avoided [him]56-sir peter as much as [she]26-laura could , and that [he]56-sir peter was wrong to have so persecuted [her]26-laura . ” “[56-sir peter] Did [he]56-sir peter say that ? ” asked [Leslie]24-leslie ; then , as [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson made no answer beyond a brief “[56-sir peter] Ay , ” [he]37-mr. chanson repeated in a tone which would have startled one more observant than [the Squire]1324-the squire : “[56-sir peter] Did [he]56-sir peter say that ? ” “[56-sir peter] Yes : honourable of [him]56-sir peter was it not ? [I]0-i should have been quite deceived in [that young girl]1017-that young girl had not [Laura]26-laura told [me]0-i beforehand of [her]26-laura little skittish ways . ” [Leslie]24-leslie kept silence , but with a sudden effort [he]24-leslie broke in two the short stick which [he]24-leslie held in [his]24-leslie hand ; [[his]24-leslie brother‐in‐law]2150-his brother‐in‐law looked at [him]24-leslie in astonishment . “[26-laura] By [Jove]87-jove ! that ’s a strong arm . Is it some trick ? How do [you]0-i do it ? ” “[0-i] Sometimes [one]1228-one has a wish to do a strong thing , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , pitching away the broken pieces . [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson rose from the stone wall where [he]37-mr. chanson had been sitting . [Leslie]24-leslie also moved , and took the way towards [the house]152-the house , whither , following the impulse thus given , [the Squire]1324-the squire also bent [his]1324-the squire steps , and entering [it]152-the house by the first door [they]2171-they came to , [Mr. Chanson]37-mr. chanson turned into [the hall]187-the hall , and [Leslie]24-leslie , the moment [he]24-leslie was alone , strode up stairs in quest of [Laura]26-laura . [She]26-laura knew [he]24-leslie was coming , but did not know [herself]26-laura what mood [his]24-leslie coming would excite in [her]26-laura . [She]26-laura was frightened at one moment , angry and fierce at another ; sometimes [he]24-leslie seemed the Leslie upon whom [she]26-laura had let [her]26-laura fancy doat , and then [the Leslie whom at other times [she]26-laura hated with all the violence of [her]26-laura former love]24-leslie . [He]24-leslie found [her]26-laura , at apparent ease , in a lounging chair , with a newspaper in [her]26-laura hand . [She]26-laura looked at [him]24-leslie as [he]24-leslie entered almost as a wild animal would look , excited to self‐defence , and ready for flight or fight as the movements of [the intruder]2173-the intruder might determine . [Leslie]24-leslie came forward to the table which was on one side of [her]26-laura , and there [he]24-leslie stood , saying at once in a perfectly calm voice , “[1228-one] [I]0-i am come to demand account from [you]1044-you of the deceit [you]1044-you have practised upon [me]0-i . ” “[1044-you] Have [I]0-i deceived [you]0-i ? ” said [Laura]26-laura ; “[0-i] did [you]0-i believe [me]0-i ? ” “[0-i] Yes ; a lie like yours there is no defence against . Unsay it . ” “[0-i] What am [I]0-i to say and unsay ? ” “[0-i] Where is [that young girl]1017-that young girl ? ” “[1017-that young girl] Whom do [you]0-i mean ? ” said [Laura]26-laura . “[0-i] [Elinor Ladylift]21-elinor . ” [Laura]26-laura laughed . “[21-elinor] [You]0-i speak out . [Elinor Ladylift]21-elinor is in [the convent of St. Cécile]1046-the convent of st. cécile . [You]0-i heard [[my]0-i brother]482-my brother say so . ” “[0-i] Did [she]1017-that young girl at once go [there]1176-there , stay [there]1176-there ? did [no one]1434-no one ever seek [her]1017-that young girl [there]1176-there ? did [she]1017-that young girl take refuge and remain [there]1176-there ? ” “[51-lawrence] So [Lawrence]51-lawrence said . ” “[51-lawrence] [You]0-i dare not trifle ! ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , striking the table with [his]24-leslie hand , and advancing a step nearer to [Laura]26-laura . “[51-lawrence] Do [you]0-i know it of [your]0-i own knowledge ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i know nothing to the contrary , ” said [Laura]26-laura . “[0-i] [You]0-i acknowledge , then , that [your]0-i representations were false ....... ” “[0-i] False ! ” said [Laura]26-laura . “[0-i] Go on . There was a letter brought to [me]0-i by [yourself]0-i . Explain it . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i have often brought [you]0-i letters , ” said [Laura]26-laura . “[0-i] There was a letter purporting to be written by [Elinor Ladylift]21-elinor to [[your]0-i cousin]676-your cousin [Bicester]56-sir peter . Was that letter a forgery ? ” “[21-elinor] It was [her]21-elinor writing , ” said [Laura]26-laura . “[21-elinor] What is behind in [your]0-i meaning ? Dare [you]0-i say [she]21-elinor sent it to [him]56-sir peter ? Dare [you]0-i ..... ” “[0-i] [I]0-i did dare , and it answered [my]0-i purpose , ” said [Laura]26-laura ; “[0-i] [you]0-i believed . [I]0-i could have laughed at times to think how the great , manly intellect yielded to [despised woman]1054-despised woman . ” “[0-i] Laugh ! yes , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[0-i] that is the very word for perfidy and crime which in due time have lost [their]1055-their covering , and are carrying [you]0-i to the ruin [you]0-i have wrought for [others]266-others . ” [Laura]26-laura sprang up . “[0-i] Nay , not so ; guilty [I]0-i have been , but what has made [me]0-i so ? Miserable [I]0-i may be , but [I]0-i ventured all for that which [I]0-i have won — [I]0-i am [yours!—you]1057-yours!—you are [mine]0-i ! In that hope [I]0-i knew nothing , cared for nothing , except itself . Whatever [I]0-i have done , [you]0-i , [you]0-i [Leslie]24-leslie should pardon [me]0-i , for that for which [I]0-i perilled [my]0-i very soul was [your]0-i love ! ” But [Leslie]24-leslie drew back as [she]0-i approached [him]24-leslie . “[0-i] Love ! ” [he]24-leslie said ; “[0-i] is it by that name [you]0-i call a vile fancy which was con‐ tented patiently to destroy life and hope in its object ? How nearly [you]0-i have dragged [me]0-i to death , how far from happiness . But no more of that . The past has been [yours]0-i , the present is [mine]0-i . [I]0-i care nothing for unravelling the web of [your]0-i perfidy . Enough that [I]0-i know all [you]0-i have said and done is false . Enough . [I]0-i have borne with [you]0-i while what [you]0-i acted passed for true . Now do [you]0-i bear with whatsoever befalls [you]0-i , dragged on [your]0-i own head by [your]0-i own deed ! [I]0-i have done . ” [He]24-leslie left [the room]104-the room at once . [Laura]26-laura sprang up before [he]24-leslie was gone , and called [him]24-leslie , but [he]24-leslie closed the door and went to [[his]24-leslie room]1901-his room . Here , like [a man who once possessing the amulet that ensured the blessing of [his]24-leslie life , and who , dropping it into [some profound lake]2177-some profound lake , stands despairingly gazing into [the waters]2178-the waters]2176-a man who once possessing the amulet that ensured the blessing of his life , and who , dropping it into some profound lake , stands despairingly gazing into the waters ; did [Leslie]24-leslie stand awhile , horror‐stricken at the knowledge of [his]24-leslie own fate . All that [he]24-leslie had left behind [he]24-leslie now saw and knew ; all the clouds that had hidden past actions rolled away , and left the view of [the sunny land]2179-the sunny land behind [him]24-leslie , which [he]24-leslie had exchanged for [the dreary pestilential region now surrounding]2180-the dreary pestilential region now surrounding [him]24-leslie . The horror of [his]24-leslie entanglement bewildered [him]24-leslie ; the thought of all those days and months , wherein reparation for [his]24-leslie cruel injustice had been delayed , pressed upon [his]24-leslie senses ; the choking feeling of distance and alienation wrought so fiercely on [him]24-leslie , that of all impossible things the most impossible to [his]24-leslie imperious and self‐indulged nature was to delay by even another hour to seek , nay , to force an interview with [Elinor]21-elinor , leaving the issue of that interview to be what it will . Springing out of the first torpor , [he]24-leslie took measures at once to leave [the Tower]16-the tower . [He]24-leslie provided [himself]24-leslie with what money was in [the house]152-the house ; [he]24-leslie thrust [his]24-leslie papers and letters into the drawers , and summoning [a servant]1442-a servant , bade [him]24-leslie instantly prepare what was necessary for a journey , and bring it after [him]24-leslie to [the neighbouring town]1971-the neighbouring town , whither [he]24-leslie [himself]24-leslie would proceed at once on foot . To put [himself]24-leslie into action was the only relief [he]24-leslie could find , and hastily [he]24-leslie passed through [the hall]187-the hall , and out on [[his]24-leslie road]2185-his road away , able [he]24-leslie knew to conceal [his]24-leslie emotion from [any one [he]24-leslie might casually meet]2186-any one he might casually meet , but not trusting [himself]24-leslie either with inaction or with the sight of [the woman who had ruined [him]24-leslie]2187-the woman who had ruined him . When joined by [[his]24-leslie servant]1386-his servant , [he]24-leslie took charge [himself]24-leslie of the portmanteau , sending back [the man]2017-the man without message or explanation , and hastened alone with all possible despatch to [the coast]2190-the coast . Here [he]24-leslie took the first conveyance which crossed [the sea]2191-the sea , and was put ashore at early dawn on [the Breton coast]2192-the breton coast , at [a village but a few miles from [[St. Cécile]20-st. cécile ’s nunnery]2194-st. cécile ’s nunnery]2193-a village but a few miles from st. cécile ’s nunnery . It was Thursday , and [he]24-leslie remembered having heard [Elinor]21-elinor say that Thursday was the day on which [the pensioners]2195-the pensioners were chiefly permitted to receive [[their]2195-the pensioners visitors]2196-their visitors . [He]24-leslie therefore pressed forward with all haste to add one more chance to those shadowy chances which remained of ever beholding that dear face again , but [his]24-leslie heart died within [him]24-leslie to think how faint [they]2197-they were ; sixteen months ’ grief , neglect , Time , what had [they]2197-they done ? Was [she]21-elinor even there ? was [she]21-elinor perhaps lying at perpetual rest beneath a reviving turf ? or if [she]21-elinor lived , was [she]21-elinor by this time [a professed nun]2198-a professed nun , alive , but dead to [him]24-leslie ? Could [she]21-elinor forgive [him]24-leslie ? had [he]24-leslie not believed accusations which [the deceiver]2199-the deceiver [herself]2199-the deceiver had thought it incredible to impose upon [him]24-leslie ? Oh ! what mountain piles of sin had [he]24-leslie not committed against [the gentlest , most charitable , most defenceless of [beings]2201-beings]2200-the gentlest , most charitable , most defenceless of beings ! [He]24-leslie saw [the little low building rising before [him]24-leslie]2202-the little low building rising before him with emotion that almost choked [his]24-leslie breath . [It]2202-the little low building rising before him stood on a common which descended to [the sea‐shore]2203-the sea‐shore , terminating in rushes and [sand hills]2204-sand hills ; [a marshy pool or two]2205-a marshy pool or two glittered in the sun , and some small cows were picking up the coarse herbage under the care of [a boy]1560-a boy and [girl bareheaded and barefooted]2207-girl bareheaded and barefooted . [The building]1002-the building [itself]1002-the building was low , and formed a square , of which the side opposite [Leslie]24-leslie was unpierced by windows , and except for one low door at the upper end , it might have been , what [Leslie]24-leslie ’s gloomy feelings likened [it]1002-the building to , [a tomb]2209-a tomb . At this door [he]24-leslie knocked , and presented a letter [he]24-leslie had prepared , entreating [per‐]88-per‐ mission , in [[her]88-per‐ guardian]2210-her guardian ’s name , to speak to [Miss Ladylift]21-elinor . [The lay sister]2211-the lay sister took it , and returning before long , conducted [him]24-leslie to another part of [the low , gray square]2212-the low , gray square , where [she]2211-the lay sister admitted [him]24-leslie to [the parlour]2213-the parlour and there left [him]24-leslie . There was already [a young girl]754-a young girl , laughing with [a motherly woman]2215-a motherly woman , and with [a child]110-a child , who seemed [[the girl]114-the girl ’s sister]2218-the girl ’s sister . [Leslie]24-leslie turned to the window , [his]24-leslie back to [these people]2219-these people , [his]24-leslie face therefore not to be seen at once , although [he]24-leslie could watch [whoever came in at the door]2220-whoever came in at the door . And before any long time , there was the voice [he]24-leslie loved so fearfully . “[0-i] Qui [me]0-i demande ? ” and [Elinor]21-elinor stood there looking at [the group within]2221-the group within . “[0-i] One not worthy so much as to ask pardon , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , turning to [her]21-elinor and approaching . “[24-leslie] [Mr. Leslie]24-leslie ! ” cried [Elinor]21-elinor , starting as if a bullet had struck [her]21-elinor heart . “[24-leslie] That ’s the last word [you]0-i said when [I]0-i last beheld [you]0-i , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[0-i] if [I]0-i was mad then — if there was a curse upon [me]0-i , can [you]0-i forgive [me]0-i ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i forgave [you]24-leslie long since , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[0-i] That is , [you]0-i would wish [me]0-i no harm , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[0-i] but is that all — is forgiveness only that ? ” “[0-i] Yes , only that ” said [Elinor]21-elinor ; “[1058-good‐bye] but indeed , full and free forgiveness , for though [you]24-leslie were more unjust than [I]0-i understood , [you]24-leslie know that , now , or [you]24-leslie would not be here . [Good‐bye]1058-good‐bye . ” “[1058-good‐bye] No ! no ! no ! ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , taking [her]0-i hand , and drawing [her]0-i to the window , while [he]24-leslie spoke very low . “[1058-good‐bye] It is not all so lost between [us]1059-us . [You]24-leslie are to [me]0-i all [that woman]1060-that woman can be to [man]1148-man . [You]24-leslie have [my]0-i destiny in [your]24-leslie hand ; [you]24-leslie must hear [me]0-i . ” “[24-leslie] There is nothing to hear , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor ; “[24-leslie] [you]24-leslie renounced [me]0-i , and [I]0-i found shelter here . [[Your]24-leslie wife]1062-your wife sent [me]0-i . ” “[1062-your wife] [I]0-i have none , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . “[1062-your wife] How ! [I]0-i know from [herself]1062-your wife that [you]24-leslie have married [Miss Chanson]29-miss chanson . ” “[29-miss chanson] No ; there is [a fiend who lays claim to [me]0-i]1063-a fiend who lays claim to me ; a serpent stole round [me]0-i , but [I]0-i am free ! ” “[24-leslie] [You]24-leslie speak madly , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor ; “[24-leslie] [I]0-i will go . May [you]24-leslie be happy ! [Farewell]89-farewell ! ” “[89-farewell] Is that all ? [you]24-leslie loved [me]0-i once , [Elinor]21-elinor . ” “[24-leslie] [I]0-i try to forget all the past , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[0-i] It is quite gone ... Let [me]0-i go now . ” “[24-leslie] [You]24-leslie try ? Do [you]24-leslie say that ? Alas ! is it [your]24-leslie will never to see [me]0-i again ? ” [She]1064-my beautiful did but bow [her]1064-my beautiful head as if in assent , but [he]24-leslie felt [her]1064-my beautiful trembling hand . “[1065-my perfect] Oh , [[my]0-i beautiful]1064-my beautiful ! [[my]0-i perfect]1065-my perfect ! ” [he]24-leslie cried , grasping that hand and trying to look into [her]1064-my beautiful eyes ; “[1064-my beautiful] [you]1064-my beautiful love [me]0-i still ! that love is still there . [You]1064-my beautiful are too true and good to say ‘ No ! ’ when [you]1064-my beautiful can not but say to [yourself]1064-my beautiful ‘ It is Yes ! ” ’ [Elinor]21-elinor hid [her]21-elinor face as far as [she]21-elinor could on [her]21-elinor own shoulder , the tears ran down [her]21-elinor cheeks . “[1064-my beautiful] [You]1064-my beautiful loved [me]0-i once , ” [he]1064-my beautiful repeated . “[1064-my beautiful] [You]1064-my beautiful tried to make [me]0-i , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor . “[1064-my beautiful] Oh , [angel]881-angel ! [I]0-i did . It was long before [your]881-angel heart gave way ; very long before [your]881-angel colour mounted when [I]0-i came , but it did at last , and [you]881-angel never can forget it . ” A sob broke from [Elinor]21-elinor . “[91-jacqueline] La pauvre enfant , ” said [the old mother]2222-the old mother , who was present ; “[91-jacqueline] laissons les ! ” “[90-mais] [Mais]90-mais , ma mère , c’est si joli , ” whispered [the young pensioner]2223-the young pensioner . “[90-mais] Fi , donc , [Jacqueline]91-jacqueline ! un jour cela t’arrivera à toi , peutêtre . Faut être compatissant , ” and [the good woman]2224-the good woman drew away [[her]2224-the good woman girls]2225-her girls , leaving [the room]104-the room to [Leslie]24-leslie and [Elinor]21-elinor . [Leslie]24-leslie drew a chair for [her]21-elinor , and sank down before [her]21-elinor . “[0-i] [I]0-i have been so miserable , ” [he]24-leslie said , dropping [his]24-leslie face on [her]21-elinor knees , “[0-i] [I]0-i am so — not at this moment , with [your]881-angel precious hand in [mine]0-i , but if [I]0-i loose it and am again what [I]0-i was before [I]0-i grasped it , [I]0-i can not go on living , [I]0-i must die . ” “[0-i] It would be best if [we]1067-we both could die , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , “[0-i] for on [earth]1557-earth [we]1067-we must part for ever . ” “[0-i] Then [you]881-angel , [you]881-angel — are [you]881-angel happy ? ” “[0-i] No ! ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , hiding [her]21-elinor face and weeping . “[0-i] Alas ! and once [we]1067-we were so near it — a word or two was all that was between it and [us]1067-we . [I]0-i had it in [my]0-i hand , [I]0-i let it go . But it is near again , now [we]1067-we are near . ” “[881-angel] How could [you]881-angel doubt [me]0-i ? ” said [Elinor]21-elinor ; “[881-angel] [I]0-i learned [you]881-angel thought [I]0-i could possibly feel regard for one who was not [you]881-angel . ” “[881-angel] Was [I]0-i not mad ? was [I]0-i not [a fallen spirit , into whose hands an angelic one had been put]1069-a fallen spirit , into whose hands an angelic one had been put ? But [you]881-angel are here again to save [me]0-i ; it is [your]881-angel destiny to save [me]0-i . ” “[881-angel] Do not talk idly ; [you]881-angel have chosen [[your]881-angel companion]1070-your companion ; [[your]881-angel wife]1062-your wife ...... ” “[513-wife] [Wife]513-wife , hush ! hush ! there is one whom [my]0-i heart acknowledges — here , this is [[my]0-i lawful wife]1073-my lawful wife . [That woman]1060-that woman is [a mere adultress]1075-a mere adultress . ” “[1060-that woman] [You]881-angel frighten [me]0-i , [Leslie]24-leslie . ” “[881-angel] Ah ! save [me]0-i from what frightens [myself]0-i — come with [me]0-i now . [Rise]92-rise , fly with [me]0-i . [The world]1134-the world is waiting for [us]1077-we outside that open door . [We]1077-we can not stay in [prison]1485-prison ; [home]139-home , paradise , innocence , wait for [us]1077-we there ! Come , [[my]0-i own [Elinor]21-elinor]1080-my own elinor ! ” [Elinor]21-elinor ’s eyes raised to [his]1080-my own elinor face , reminded [him]1080-my own elinor of that day , now two years old , when [they]2227-they before so innocently looked at [him]1080-my own elinor , wondering at [his]1080-my own elinor meaning . “[21-elinor] Could [I]0-i leave [[my]0-i Mother]1208-my mother so ? Would [she]1208-my mother allow it ? ” “[1208-my mother] No , no ; but to be happy is [our]1077-we nature . [I]0-i am good if [I]0-i am happy , but make [me]0-i miserable , [Elinor]21-elinor , and what crimes lie before [me]0-i ! ” “[21-elinor] Nay , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , “[21-elinor] [we]1077-we need not be happy , but [we]1077-we must be good . ” “[21-elinor] Are not those two things one , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie ; “[21-elinor] if it lie in [your]21-elinor power to render [a human creature]1082-a human creature the most blessed being on [the earth]1083-the earth , would [you]21-elinor not do wrong to leave [him]1082-a human creature in [his]1082-a human creature misery ? Must not that be wrong ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i can not tell , ” said [Elinor]21-elinor ; “[0-i] [we]1077-we must wait — one day , no doubt , [we]1077-we shall be happy . ” “[0-i] And will [[our]1077-we youth]1084-our youth wait for [us]1077-we , will [our]1077-we life wait ? ” “[0-i] Oh no ! ” said [Elinor]21-elinor , “[0-i] and [I]0-i wish , with all [my]0-i heart [I]0-i wish , that [we]1077-we were old , and sick , and infirm , for then [we]1077-we should be near [the land where [I]0-i may come to [you]21-elinor]1085-the land where i may come to you . ” “[0-i] Ah [Elinor]21-elinor ! but should [those lands]1086-those lands be dreams ! Hear [me]0-i ! ...... ” “[0-i] [I]0-i can not , [dear Leslie]24-leslie — oh yes ! indeed [you]24-leslie are [dear Leslie]24-leslie — [I]0-i only know [we]1077-we are parted for ever . ” [Elinor]21-elinor forcibly rose , while [Leslie]24-leslie with [her]21-elinor hand in [his]24-leslie , detained [her]21-elinor , pleading , still more by the agony [he]24-leslie suffered than by [his]24-leslie words ; and at that moment the door opened , and [a tall handsome woman]2228-a tall handsome woman , [her]2228-a tall handsome woman face bounded by the straight lines of [her]2228-a tall handsome woman head‐gear , came in , and [Elinor]21-elinor at once broke away , and took up [her]21-elinor place , pressed close against [the Reverend Mother]98-the reverend mother . [She]21-elinor whispered a word or two to [the young girl]107-the young girl , and [Elinor]21-elinor instantly stood freely up , and though the tears ran over , spoke out , “[0-i] God bless [you]24-leslie , [Leslie]24-leslie ! Farewell ! ” and vanished through the door , from [his]24-leslie sight . “[24-leslie] [You]24-leslie have brought [her]1087-she bad news , [I]0-i fear , ” said [the Superior]109-the superior . “[24-leslie] Yes , bad news , ” repeated [Leslie]24-leslie , mechanically . “[1088-poor child] [Poor child]1088-poor child ! [she]1087-she has need of good . Ever since [she]1087-she came back here so suddenly , [she]1087-she has had a weight at [her]1087-she heart . What sort of people were [they]1089-them , [those guardians of [hers]1087-she]1090-those guardians of hers ? ” “[1089-them] [I]0-i know scarcely anything about [them]1089-them , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . “[0-i] Yet [you]0-i came from [them]1089-them to [her]1087-she , [I]0-i understood . ” “[0-i] Yes , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , “[0-i] [I]0-i am acquainted with [them]1089-them , but [they]1089-them are people perfectly indifferent to [me]0-i . ” “[1089-them] Do [you]0-i think anything happened there to make [her]1087-she unhappy ? Who visited chiefly at [the house]152-the house ? ” “[1228-one] [I]0-i knew [one]1228-one , [a mere fool]1093-a mere fool , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , “[1228-one] [he]1228-one thought [himself]1228-one clever , and was the gull of [every female and male idiot]1094-every female and male idiot that chose to deceive [him]1228-one . ” “[1228-one] Then [he]1228-one it could not be , whom [she]1087-she regrets . ” “[1228-one] Does [she]1087-she regret some one ? ” “[1087-she] [I]0-i can not tell ; [[her]1087-she confessor]1095-her confessor knows ; if [she]1087-she have proved the vanity of worldly affections , [I]0-i hope it may turn [her]1087-she soul to the holy bridal of [the church]1363-the church . ” “[0-i] God forbid ! ” cried [Leslie]24-leslie . “[0-i] And why , [sir]372-sir ? Do [you]372-sir think [she]1087-she has no vocation ? ” “[372-sir] Vocation ! ” repeated [Leslie]24-leslie , hardly knowing what [he]24-leslie said . “[372-sir] Before [she]1087-she went to [England]6-england , [I]0-i thought so too , ” said [the lady]174-the lady , “[0-i] but experience of [the world]1134-the world ’s emptiness and sorrow , often work a change for the better in the heart . ” “[372-sir] Alas ! ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . “[372-sir] There would be a difficulty , of which [you]372-sir are perhaps aware , ” said [the Superior]109-the superior . “[372-sir] Difficulty ? yes , no doubt — what is it ? ” “[372-sir] When [we]1099-we have devoted [ourselves]1099-we to [our]1099-we profession , and have no leisure for the works which earn a living , [we]1099-we must have means of subsistence , live as hardly as [we]1099-we will . Therefore [those who enter here for a life of devotion]1100-those who enter here for a life of devotion must be able to support [themselves]1100-those who enter here for a life of devotion and [others]266-others , by contributing to the general stock , or else [they]1100-those who enter here for a life of devotion must come as [menials]1102-menials , which would not do for [her]1087-she ...... but [Elinor]21-elinor is so very poor . ” “[21-elinor] Is [she]21-elinor poor ? ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , with infinite pity in [his]24-leslie voice . “[21-elinor] [She]21-elinor has perhaps ten thousand francs for all [her]21-elinor fortune ; what [you]372-sir call , [she]21-elinor tells [me]0-i , sixteen pounds a‐year . ” “[21-elinor] Oh ! [[my]0-i [Elinor]21-elinor]1103-my elinor ! ” groaned [Leslie]24-leslie . “[21-elinor] With that [she]21-elinor boards , and though it is too little , [we]1104-we keep [the precious child]1105-the precious child among [us]1104-we , and [she]21-elinor nurses , teaches , works , up to [her]21-elinor best strength to make up what is wanted . ” “[93-madam] [Madam]93-madam , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie , “[93-madam] [[your]93-madam society]1106-your society is most worthy , most deserving , would not a few thousand francs , bestowed on it in [her]21-elinor name , secure [her]21-elinor more comforts , more ease ? ” “[34-the reverend mother] Such a donation might enable [her]21-elinor to assume the veil , ” said [the Superior]109-the superior . [Leslie]24-leslie shrank as if [his]24-leslie hand had found itself on the bag of a nest of hornets . “[34-the reverend mother] Do n’t let [her]21-elinor do that , [Reverend Mother]34-the reverend mother , ” said [he]24-leslie ; “[21-elinor] what is so dangerous as to encourage vows which are not voluntary , or of which [the vower]1107-the vower may repent ? [You]93-madam might have a sin to answer for . ” “[93-madam] Fear not , ” said [the Superior]109-the superior , with dignity , “[93-madam] that [we]1104-we need the advice of [a stranger in guiding [our]1104-we flock]1108-a stranger in guiding our flock . ” “[1108-a stranger in guiding our flock] No , no , [I]0-i am aware of that — yet [I]0-i entreat [you]93-madam forbid [her]21-elinor to become [a nun]103-a nun . ” “[93-madam] Leave [her]21-elinor to [us]1104-we , [young man]1110-young man , ” said [the Superior]109-the superior . “[1110-young man] [I]0-i must see [her]21-elinor again , ” said [Leslie]24-leslie . “[0-i] Nay , [your]0-i interview has already been long . ” “[0-i] And write to [her]21-elinor . ” “[0-i] Give [me]0-i [your]0-i letter , if [you]0-i wish to write , [she]21-elinor shall have it . ” “[21-elinor] But if [she]21-elinor wishes it , [I]0-i may return . ” “[21-elinor] If [she]21-elinor does not wish it , [you]0-i can not . ” “[0-i] And [you]0-i will influence [her]21-elinor . Oh ! [madam]1111-madam , there are miseries in [the world]1134-the world , so great that [you]0-i would pity [the very devils whom [you]0-i hate]1113-the very devils whom you hate , for suffering [them]1113-the very devils whom you hate . ” “[1111-madam] There is a refuge from all , ” [the Superior]109-the superior began — but [Leslie]24-leslie broke away . “[0-i] [I]0-i ca n’t hear it now ; preach to ease , not to the rack . Let [me]0-i go , ” and [he]1114-he rushed away in a state of mind almost beyond [his]1114-he own control . For several days [he]1114-he wandered round [the Convent]127-the convent , asking admittance , and still refused , offering rewards to get a letter con‐ veyed to [Elinor]21-elinor , but denied ; haunted by [her]21-elinor tearful eyes , by [her]21-elinor poverty , by [her]21-elinor desolation . [He]1114-he was terrified at the possibility of the vows [she]21-elinor might contract , and was for ever grasping at those blessings which might have been [his]1114-he and [hers]21-elinor , but which were now mere shadows of those real things floating away , further and further into the past . [He]1114-he was fast bound in the meshes , which [a woman]1161-a woman , [a mere woman]1117-a mere woman , had found the means to twine around [him]1114-he , and fiercely did [he]1114-he resent the injury , and gaze sternly at [her]21-elinor falsehood and successful deceit . It was in vain [he]1114-he raged against [his]1114-he bonds , which [Elinor]21-elinor refused to assist [him]1114-he in evading , and which the hand that fastened them , even if willing , had no power to untie , though it had sought and forced the fatal spell to make them fast . [She]1161-a woman was [his]1114-he fate ; [a contemptible , but all powerful agent]1118-a contemptible , but all powerful agent ; a hateful presence which had forced itself upon [him]1114-he , and which held [him]1114-he imprisoned in sight of the felicity [he]1114-he had once grasped , and let go at the false accents of [that despicable deceiver]1119-that despicable deceiver . Violent were the passions of [the strong but fettered man]1120-the strong but fettered man , fierce the hatred of the powerful but baffled intellect ; wild was the fury of [the man , who believed in but one world of good , and saw the mortal moments passing away]1121-the man , who believed in but one world of good , and saw the mortal moments passing away , unenjoyed , and irretrievable . Out of those hours arose a purpose . [The reader]1268-the reader sees [the man]2017-the man , and knows the deed . From the premises laid before [him]1268-the reader , [he]1268-the reader need not indeed have concluded that [even that man]1124-even that man would do that deed ; but since it was told , in 1855 , that [the husband]1125-the husband killed [the wife]1126-the wife , so now , in 1860 , it is explained why [he]1125-the husband killed [her]1126-the wife .
